After working for Eastman for 20+ years, and knowing what I know now, I should have sought out another form of employment!

review_title: Company continues to make poor decisions
pros: Really good people work for Eastman - people who care about the company's success and have made great sacrifices to make Eastman successful.
cons: Senior management continues to make poor decisions on the future of the company.  They seem to believe that long-range planning is to the end of the week.  The latest is the $100 million reduction that will focus on labor - details to follow.  Amazing. We just received a 2% raise and they have hired approximately 400 people since the Jan 1.  We used to be told that the employees are the company's greatest asset.  Ha!  No more.

review_title: Eastman is a great employer and place to work.
pros: Eastman provides many opportunities for growth and development personally and in your career. They provide programs, support, and encouragement to employees to take care of themselves physically and mentally.  Benefits and salary provided are very good.  Eastman has been wonderful to me during my employment and I am very proud and thankful to be an Eastman employee.  Eastman employees are willing to go the extra mile for coworkers and customers which is a great work environment.
cons: College degrees have become a requirement.  I think college degrees are great and regret that I do not have a degree.  I do not have anything against this, but it makes me wonder if in the future employees who do not have college degrees will not be as valued.

pros:
The people and culture of Eastman are great.  It means a lot to like the people you work with in such a friendly and collaborative atmosphere.  Safety is foremost in everything and that is also comforting.  I feel I was compensated well and the benefits were competitive with what is being offered now a days.  I feel that my time here was a valuable experience and will be important to my future career path.

I really like Kingsport and all the area has to offer.  If you enjoy the outdoors this is a great hub for hiking, backpacking, camping, hunting, etc.  The downtown is also being revitalized and there an increasing number of things to do for young professionals in the area.
cons:
I see the relative performance evaluation as causing people to be more competitive than collaborative. The culture is starting to change and not in a good way.

My spouse was never able to find a job in the area (including Eastman, as he is also an engineer), having interviewed several times and was never able to get any feedback.  Had he found a job in the area, I most likely would have stayed with Eastman for the long haul.

review_title: Great place to work! Lot's of job opportunities, and great stability.
pros: Eastman is focused on being a safe place to work -- you'll hear a lot about our commitment to safety once you work here.  Eastman is also known for being a stable employer.  We have a reputation for being a community- and family-friendly company. Eastman is known for being a good place to work.  The salary and benefits are competitive, and that's before you take in to account the low cost of living in northeast TN.  There are lots of job opportunities, so you can pick-up a variety of experiences during your career.  Eastman people work together and look out for each other.
cons: I agree with the other comments regarding Eastman being hierarchical.  I'm sure all companies are like this though, wherein promotions can seem to be based more on who you know than what you do.  Eastman _does_ believe in slow and steady promotions and salary increases, however, your compensation is always fair/competitive.

pros:
Eastman is the best kept secret in the Fortune 350. Anchored in the gorgeous hills of northeast Tennessee, the sun never sets on the Eastman footprint: 50+ sites all over the world. That means global opportunities. The large sites in Tennessee and Texas (no income tax) are so big and integrated, they allow you to have a diverse career without ever having to pick up and move. 

Don't like what you're doing? Eastman wants you to own your career and pursue those areas where you have passion. 

Eastman has a collaborative, innovative culture where support and encouragement are welcome and jerks don't last long.
cons:
Eastman is based in Kingsport, Tennessee. It's a beautiful area to live, world-class schools and friendly people. Expand your view to the entire Tri-Cities (Johnson City & Bristol), and you have a very robust set of choices for education, living, shopping, playing and dining. 

But it's not for everyone. You're flying through Atlanta and Charlotte wherever you go. Kingsport itself is working to improve its retail offerings.

pros: Eastman Chemical has been a great place to work.  I have been here more than 25 years, and held positions in 3 different areas of the plant.  There is a great variety of jobs, so you can move around a bit if you work hard.  Benefits and compensation are still good, offering some of the better wages in the area.  The people at our site are great, with winning attitudes and determination to do whatever it takes to get the job done.  Vacation benefits are very good and you accrue more the longer you are employed (up to five weeks).
cons: Although still competitive, the benefits have slipped over the past few years.  Retirment packages for new employees are different from employees who have been with the company for several years, however there are some employer matches and contributions for 401K's.

review_title: It has been a fantastic journey during the 8 years I have spent with Eastman Chemical.
job_title: Principal Research Scientist in Kingsport, TN
pros: I really didn't know what to expect when I joined Eastman.  From the first day, I was totally amazed by how close everyone seemed to be.  All my co-workers were truly friends both at work and outside of work.  I had been involved in the Pharmaceutical Industry for almost 20 years before coming to Eastman 8 years ago, and I just assumed internally rivalry and a stressful work environment was the norm for any large company.  I have never experienced any of that since I've been here.  Everyone speaks when you meet them in the hallways or in the parking lot.  Even people you don't even know!  Salary and benefits are competitive with other large companies, and every day is a new experience.  I can honestly say I have never dreaded going to work one single day while being an employee at Eastman.
cons: There really aren't any.  I probably work harder here than any place I have been employed previously, but that's a choice I and almost all the people I know here have made.

review_title: Use to be a great company to work for but has been raped of most good things
pros: About the only game in town. Pays slightly above average but local companies are catching up quickly.
cons: Average worker extremely under valued and often referred to as useless pawns that can be replaced at any time. Huge pay differential from salaried positions to operations roll employees.  No incentive for operations roll  employees to do anything other than show up because the Old bonus system was given to the upper echelon and replaced with a VIP (variable incentive plan) that amounts to basically a weeks pay. Not fair or equitable as lower management and above share the take and give nothing to the employees doing the work. Made more real money 20 years ago. Sad the direction this company is going by taking away benefits and decent pay. 20 years ago you could not pay someone to say anything bad about Eastman. Now, only employees rating company higher are either paid or scared.

review_title: Terrible HR policies leading to bad employee morale
pros: Great, dedicated employees who tirelessly sacrifice.
cons: While other companies are giving out extra bonuses and raises in order to keep employees and reward them for their service in today's business-friendly tax environment, Eastman does all it can to short-charge employees of bonuses and raises.  Eastman's healthcare plan is pathetic - we used to be able to save some money, but now it all goes for healthcare.   Management at higher levels has lied to employees, and makes lip service to safety but we all know that production will win-out as the almighty dollar (for management, in  terms of their UPP bonuses) trumps all.  Most management decisions are based on the UPP - whatever puts more money into senior management's pockets.  UPP is the bonus structure of senior management, while VPP is the bonus structure for working people...why the two bonuses?  Should be fairly obvious.

review_title: Great Company to have a long career
pros: Large company with many, many opportunities for growth in your career.  I have worked in 4 different divisions over a period of 20 years. Pay is competitive to other large Fortune 500 companies.  Work culture is becoming more diverse.  Team work is highly valued.  If you love to travel, you will have lots of opportunities to see many other Eastman locations throughout the world.  Safety is number one priority no matter what your job.  Management is very caring and allows a flexible schedule (4 - 9's and a 4).  City school systems are great and are recognized nationally.  Great place to raise a family.
cons: Several large acquisitions have taken place over the last several years.  There is still a lot of room for improvement when integrating other companies.  Corporate headquarters are in a very small southern town.  Not a lot of activities for the young at heart after hours, however, its a safe environment to raise a family.

review_title: Eastman is not what it used to be
pros: Stable work environment with virtually no layoff worries. Very nice recreation center that has great activities and clubs that should be able to interest anyone.
cons:
Pay scales for operations employees are based on local averages of other companies not other chemical companies. 
Operations departments are kept at the bare minimum for staffing which can create problems trying to get people trained to be considered first operators.

review_title: Be a local or be gone!
pros: Kingsport is a great place to live if you like outdoors, want a short commute and want a cheap lifestyle. (It’s cheap because there is nowhere to spend money)
cons:
Eastman moves at a snail pace seriously company who wants to be a specialty chemical company needs to be fast and agile. They are stuck and been spinning in place for years now.

There is very much so, us vs them mentality. There are golden children (typically home grown talent committed to the area - that’s fast tracked) and there is everyone else. No incentive to working hard. Be a local or be gone is the motto.

pros: The corporate office building is new with fantastic amenities. Compensation and benefits are great.
cons: The atmosphere is draconian.  Obedience is valued over performance and can seem like an antiquated way of thinking for experienced employees that are new to the company and trying to promote change.  You will find lots of managers that earned their roles by longevity  with the company not an ability to lead.  If things don't work out, there isn't other employment options in the area.   Some managers can be disrespectful to staff.  It's a difficult company to become employed with and once onboard there is a sense that you should feel fortunate to have been chosen. The truth is, you have better options.

pros:
Good area to raise a family.
Okay starting pay. 
Lots of good people - easy to develop some great friendships.
Lots of talented people.
cons:
While there’s lots of talented and smart people in management, it feels like more of an old culture where they are to be feared rather than seen as leaders there to help you grow and knock down roadblocks.
There’s absolutely no reason knowledge workers should be required to work onsite.
Most of those knowledge workers should have no real dress code.
Career progression seems to be based on who likes you and how long you’ve been there.

review_title: A work environment dominated by white males, most of whom are intelligent and think highly of themselves.
pros: The headquarters is located in a great place to live and raise a family.  Most employees spend a career here and are very dedicated to doing a good job. The cost of living here is relatively low, salaries and benefits are competitive.
cons:
Current management philosophy does not demonstrate that people or diversity is valued.  
There is  a lot of micromanagement going on at high levels which keeps middle managers runnng around in many circles trying to please their bosses.
Too many early to mid career business and technical personnel as well as managers are spending 24/7 thinking and doing things for the job and not in a position to have work-life balance. There is too much fear in the workplace to push back.
It is not unusual to hear statements from directors and above that are discrimantory towards groups of people and would be extremeley embarassing to the company if made public.

review_title: Priviledge to work with the people I work with... don't get rid of them.
pros: The best part about Eastman is the people i work with. Everyone is very helpful and patient with me. We all work as a team to produce quality product for Eastman. The place we live is really beautiful and pay is nice too!
cons: Eastman has started a ranking system with the intention of rewarding the "best" workers and punishing the "worst" workers. Now this punishment can be anywhere from increased training to being fired. In either case, my fellow employees and I are not too thrilled with this new action. We all work as a team and we don't need added stress of comparing each others skills. Our culture of teamwork and family focus will be ruined as this ranking system continues.

pros:
Ethical Company - Ethical Executive Leadership
Employees - very nice - good moral at Kingsport
Great Location for outdoor enthusiasts
Universities near by - community college and 4 year and medical/pharma
Commitment to employees health - healthy culture
cons:
Diversity - see women in leadership but low to none in senior scientist levels
Surprising to see old to very old equipment creating poor work efficiencies, and surprised that experienced technology folks not pushing for newer up to date (modern) equipment.
Organizations need a balance of new, mid, and seasoned professional team mates - I think if people stay in the same job for more than 10 years they can become stagnant and not forward thinking.    People need new challenges to stay fresh.   I've seen some groups fully loaded with people about to retire with no to little succession planning by bringing in younger or mid career people to take over.

pros: The company has changed quite a bit from the Kodak days, and mostly for the good. Co-workers and managers are generally helpful and want you to succeed. In spite of some recent blunders I believe the CEO is intelligent and does want Eastman to prosper. Diversity of workforce is mostly a plus; lots of expats have successful careers here. Primary caregivers, however, are more challenged (see Cons). Eastman has historically had many very technically competent employees, but this is changing quickly (more about that in the Cons).
cons: The 2016 downsizing and push for productivity has resulted in exceptionally overworked employees. Forget about taking all your vacation ( and you can't carry it over or get it paid out). Most of the comments in the reviews about the performance management system are true; it is only used against you to prevent a promotion or so your boss can give part of your bonus to one of his pets. The plus side is if you are one of your boss's pets then you don't need to worry about your rating. Experience and technical knowledge are not valued very much; long-time employees are treated like diseases when layoff time comes around. A staggering amount of experience walked (or was shown) out the door in 2016 simply because a young new hire looks cheaper on paper than an old timer. Women (and some men) with children won't fare as well in their careers due to a lack of work/life balance.  Another Con is that managers change position every couple of years; I think this is a Con because your direct supervisor may never understand or appreciate what you do or your value. On the other hand this could be a Pro if you're incompetent or want to hide out till retirement.

review_title: Current employee with over 20 years of experience and my family over three generations has 117 years of experience
job_title: Integrated Global Supply Chain in Kingsport, TN
pros: Eastman is a great place to work and you have the opportunity to grow within the company to levels you never expected. I love coming to work and having the opportunity to contribute to increasing the company's bottom line is very rewarding. We have a very diverse group of employees that use all of their experiences to help us come to the best decision in most cases that benefit the company. I wouldn't want to work anywhere else.
cons: Like any company, Eastman has some areas in my opinion we could improve upon but I wouldn't share that with the world because we should be able to fix those areas internally.

review_title: Working at Eastman has been my best career decision.
pros: Compensation, benefits and career opportunities are among the best reasons to work at Eastman.  However, while other companies may be able to match those attributes, the Eastman culture is like no other. From the first day on the job, employees feel that they are part of a team. Co-workers all around are helpful and offer assistance to allow you to succeed, because your success makes the Eastman team even stronger. I've never worked in a company where responsibility was so highly valued. It is truly a can-do work environment where you can always count on your co-worker. I look forward to coming to work each day.
cons: It is a manufacturing company and as a result, people dont' see us as a pretty office building in a pristine business complex.  While we work hard to maintain our sites and do have some beautiful office complexes, our sites are mostly chemical plants with lots of pipes and columns.

review_title: Competitive wages, great benefits, flexible schedule, monotonous work
pros: Competitive wages, great benefits, flexible schedule, lots of holidays, decent amount of paid vacation, unpaid vacation if we want it
cons:
(1) Monotonous work as a lab technician. Work is the same most days with different problems
(2) Big company, feel like I am a cog in the big machine some days. Even though it takes 8-9 months to get a technician up to speed with my work, I feel semi-easily replaceable.
(3) Do not feel valued or respected for the work I do. If I rated the value and respect I feel out of 10, it would be a 4-6. I would prefer 8-10. 
(4) To me, the Eastman culture calls you to work constantly and productively; but there is little incentive to go above and beyond the call of duty. I feel restrained and demotivated from the work energy I've had in my teens.

pros: Eastman Chemical has long been a Triple Bottom Line company and has a track record to show it.  People, Planet and Profit -- Eastman focuses on all three with great success. I personally work in the environmental (Planet) part of the company and I am proud of our stewardship.  We have a great compliance record, largely because our Management insists on doing what is right and not trying to just get by. Regarding the People component, the company's emphasis on safety and wellness is exemplary. Finally, you only have to look at our rising stock price to know that we don't have to sacrifice Profit in order to achieve success in the areas of People and Planet.
cons: Eastman Chemical's headquarters and largest manufacturing site are located in a relatively small town in the Appalachians. As a result, our workforce is not very diverse.  This hinders us in our efforts to become a more global company

pros: The pay is good and if you're not in CPE, you are probably treated better
cons: Good ole boys run the show. Doesn't matter how well you do your job, if you disagree with good ole boys, you will NOT advance. My Team Manager was 73 and been there 40 years. There is a very hard worker and good man that works for him but he doesn't agree with the games they play, so the Team Manager is trying to get him fired. One lady he didn't like only got approved by him for 1 day bereavement for her husband's death. One lady he does like is off her job 6 hrs out of 12 smoking, sleeping, on the phone, or in dept her boyfriend works in. It's all about how well you suck up to him. The good employees suffer for it. Very sad

pros: Has been a pleasant first year.  Was a contractor at a site acquired by Eastman and was converted to an Eastman employee.  Eastman did a nice job with transition of the acquired company/site and my transition to Eastman employment.  As an Engineer coming in with 30+ years of experience, felt the salary offer was good, the benefits were very good, and 4 weeks of vacation was offered starting out.  I was working for one the largest US engineering firms prior to joining Eastman and the compensation and benefits at Eastman are tremendously better.  Eastman was great about including me in their bonus program, salary increase, and the  voluntary company retirement saving contribution in my first partial year.  Eastman really seems to look out for the financial interest of their employees.
cons: Being a recently acquired site, there has been a considerable amount of change to convert to Eastman systems, but overall Eastman has done a nice job with the transition.

review_title: "EASTMAN CHEMICAL COMPANY, A VERY GOOD PLACE TO WORK.
pros: The company is secure financially and has implemented various measures to stay that way.  The CEO, Brian Ferguson, makes it a point to send out communications to all employees advising on any effect on our company a Hurricane, or a wall street meltdown, will likely have. Most BU's have a "Family" feel to them as everyone seems to genuinely have an interest in how you are doing.
cons: Eastman still has a somewhat "Good Old Boy" system of promotion.  Openings get posted but for the most part the person who will fill the opening is prechosen, so the posting is meerly to appease the one's who will not be chosen.  If one really wants to move up one must align themselves with fast movers and ride their coattails

review_title: great place to learn about marketing
pros:
good pay and benefits
a lot of attn from management (good attention and not micromanaging - lots of teambuilding)
nice environment - people definitely make this a lifetime career and community - everyone says hello in the elevator or hallway - very friendly and welcoming
a lot of resources to get your job done
good communication across depts - minimal silo problems
great marketing team and a very progressive marketing dept particularly for a b2b
cons:
overheard some rumbling from others about "old school" in terms of pay and promotion - but i saw a wide range of people in management so this may just be bitterness from a few individuals
the company is huge so obviously people will be passed over some
i disliked being in a cubicle and wanted more teamwork
kingsport is a small town - not a lot to do

review_title: Where else would you want to work?
job_title: Integrated Global Supply Chain in Kingsport, TN
pros:
The corporate culture at Eastman allows employees to feel empowered.  To be as innovative as Eastman is, employees must be allowed to take calculated risks without fear of repercussions if a desired result is not achieved on a first attempt.

The opportunity for advancement is abundant for those who show initiative.  Effort is recognized and rewarded.  Coaching and feedback are provided in efforts to maximize potential and productivity.

With such a diverse workforce, Eastman can draw upon a plethora of personalities and experiences.  This allows the company to make well informed decisions.

Wellness and sustainability are heavily promoted within the company.
cons: As is the case with most large corporations, it can be difficult at times to determine the correct person or department to assist with an issue.  Although, most are very helpful and patient, it is often time consuming to find the right person for your situation.

review_title: I have been working at Eastman Chemical Company for one year
pros: Before I started working at Eastman, I could easily pick Eastman employees out of a croud. The people that make up Eastman are a team of individuals that are the most giving and sincere people that I've ever met. They area mothers. They are fathers. They are friends. They are leaders. And they are inovative. They all come together as a team and make this company a great place to work with great benefits.
cons:
Although there is plenty of room for personal growth inside Eastman, advancement is a slow process. Eastman offers a wonderful benefit package and competative salary, however, many people are performing at levels well above their current salary level without being properly recognized for their contribution to the company.

I think I speak for most Eastman employees when I say that parking is, well, less than satisfactory.

review_title: Younger work force emerging and it's supported and encouraged by management.
pros: Great salary, great benefits, paid holidays, flexible schedule, and a boss who's a coach, not a dictator. I recieved a job offer before graduation in exactly the fields I studied. I'm learning from my boss and my co-workers every day. Despite my young age I receive a lot of project ownership and my creativity is respected not ignored. Eastman is doing a great job of making collaboration amongst all departments a priority. Most importantly I'm challenged at work, but I don't have to take it home with me. I'm excited about my work, not stressed!
cons:
The cafeteria food is par at best, but hey, the microwave works great for my Lean Cuisines. 

Also, when you first arrive everyone asks you non-stop about your social styles... Eastman has everyone participate in a course in which you learn about your personality. It's extremely interesting and quite beneficial when working in groups, however so much emphasis is placed on it that you feel like you're just being labeled.

review_title: Great place to work, but not a place for rapid advancement.
pros: Ability to grow in a stable corporate environment. East Tennessee is an incredibly nice place to live and raise a family. The cost of living is very low compared to most parts of the United States.
cons: Eastman relies on its location to protect its workforce. Although the company claims to provide competitive pay for professional and management positions on a national basis, it does not. The same positions ofter pay better at competitors which reside in other geographies. Most people stay at Eastman for their entire careers, and Eastman develops really good people for management roles. Unfortunately, ability to obtain higher level roles is often a function of timing rather than a reflection on the individual's capability in the marketplace.

pros:
Wonderful Mentorship for Entry-Level Engineers
Pay is Extremely Competitive and Much Higher than other Employers in its Region
Numerous Discounts
Health & Wellness Oriented
Work/Life Balance- 4 9's and a 4 work schedule
Opportunities to Receive Advanced Training
Educational Advancement & Tuition Assistance
401k Funds are Some of the Best in Class
Bonus Target Incentive is Competitive
cons:
Nothing, if you work at Eastman, you're practically set for life as long as you do your part.
A lot of folks complain about the insurance, but that isn't the companies fault and it is the same anywhere you go.
Some say the 401k match isn't good enough. If you're relying on a company match to retire, you're in no position to complain. Don't put yourself at the mercy of someone else to retire.

pros: Overall this is a good company to work for and I value my job highly.  I have been given a chance to advance in the company and deeply appreciate the opportunity.
cons: Like most large companies your job satisfaction in this company is dependent on the department you work in.

review_title: Great for Shareholders .  . . Not so Great for Employees or On Site Contractors
job_title: Sure I'll Take On More in Kingsport, TN
pros:
There are fewer and fewer.  
Good area to raise a family.  Most co-workers are supportive.
cons: Health Insurance deductibles continue to grow.  People retire or leave for jobs elsewhere but the work is simply redistributed to those left behind.  Any comment about I'm swamped or overloaded is met with a frown and a comment about not being a good team player.  As reported in several newspaper articles top management over the past 5 years have seen a 56% increase in pay and bonuses.  Those doing the work about 5% for the same 5 years.

pros: Working with some the best people in the industry. Decent pay relative to the cost of living in the area.
cons: Employees are becoming less and less valued. Layoffs are a regular occurrence, and there are very few employment opportunities in the area. In addition to layoffs, freezes on salary increases happen fairly often. The performance management system requires a forced ranking of employees into categories making a majority of the employee population feel scared and undervalued. The only real incentive for working harder is not losing your job. Folks are constantly being asked to do more with less and less, and their performance has to be better every single year. Otherwise they will be labeled partially meets or does not meet expectations. And once they are labeled, it is very easy for management to give them the same rating every year regardless of performance. This also makes them a potential target for the next round of layoffs which are inevitably around the corner.

review_title: A job at Eastman isn't a career choice, It's a life choice for the better!
pros: Working with Eastman is like joining a family. The environment is very inviting and personable. In my expreience, the managers care very much about your well being and success with the compant. They do not view you as replaceable but instead work very hard to find the right spot for you in the company. The work/life balance is great and encouraged by managment.  Eastman offers several courses for learning and are patient when it comes to learning. They also offer several ways for employees to become involved with the community by offering volunteer opportunitities, recreational clubs and team sports. If I had to sum up Eastman in three words, it would be Safety, Family, and Fun.
cons: Some challenges are about advancement. There is not a clear path for advancing for analyst and technicians.

pros:
Competitive salary and decent benefits. Stable company with a lot of opportunity for moving around. The people are great. Lots of opportunity for training. 

Great work/life balance depending on your job and the four 9's and a 4 work schedule is nice.
cons:
Eastman used to promote people and move people around faster, but now both of these processes can be slow. Despite record breaking performance, promotions and bonuses are mediocre. The salaray is attractive, but when you look at overall compensation, it does not look as great. They have recently changed the ranking system, which is leading the culture away from the collaborative, teamwork environment to more of a competitive environment. 

Although there are a lot of job opportunities within Eastman, management seems to make decisions for you on where you get moved, rather than talking to you about where you want to move.

review_title: Being too focused on the short term with disregards for employees doesn’t really build loyalty.
pros: Great people, can do attitude. Good reputation.
cons:
Not sure if cutting costs and fixing only next month is a way to develop professionals for the future. Feels like we are just preparing the company to be acquired, which is fine but you have to wonder what message that sends to employees. 
Eastman has no clue any more in how to build loyalty with employees, targeting for lay-off very senior employees not ready for retirement gives you a message as a young engineer on how you can expect to be treated when you are 58.

job_title: Account Manager in Menlo Park, CA
pros:
Eastman is a great place to start your career, you'll get some of the best training in the industry.  I was able to work with managers that truly cared about me and my development.  I worked with some of the smartest people in the industry.  Eastman still has many great employees, and I would say they have employed some of the smartest people in the industry.  

I am proud that I worked at Eastman, I still recommend young people consider Eastman as an initial employer.
cons: Lower than average pay than the industry.  Few opportunities outside of Kingsport, TN.  No incentive to keep pay in line with the industry when situated in a small town with very few other options available without relocation.  HR and Management recognize this and implement various measures knowing many employees will tolerate more than in most geographic areas with more employment options.

review_title: Not a Company For Today's Employees
pros: If you are selected as the "in" employee, there are tremendous opportunities for advancement, training and pay increases.  Unfortunately, one person's opinion can make or break your career, which is not the optimum way to manage employees.
cons: Pay may not be as good as offered for international companies outside of Kingsport, especially when you consider the overtime necessary to get even average raises. It's maintained a good reputation in the area because it's the biggest game in town, but many people who value their personal and family life may want to look elsewhere for employment.  The company expects too much from employees for too little loyalty and pay. HR practices for hiring and firing are lacking for a company that should be world class.

review_title: The best company I have ever worked for
pros:
First, Eastman employs what I think of as a collaborative management style.  In this style, the supervisors work with the employees to set goals and see that the employee has what is needed to obtain the goals.  As a result, there are no year-end surprises during the performance review where the employee is criticized for not doing something he didn't even know he was supposed to be doing.
Second, people at Eastman act as team members.  The other companies I have worked at had departments that were so independent that little useful work could get done.  I have never detected this attitude at Eastman.  People are always ready to help others with any project.
Third, Eastman is a very open company.  We have frequent town hall meetings with the CEO during which the CEO actually gives out good and honest answers.  Other companies I have worked at, when they had town halls at all, always staged them with prepared questions.
cons: None that I can think of.

review_title: Great experience, but not for me
pros: Company is devoted to personal and professional development of the employees. Five star company to work for.
cons: Just my personal preference, but I did not enjoy working inside the plant itself. It is dirty and loud. Others may not have an issue with this but I did. Also, when hired in to the job, I did not have a full understanding of what my job responsibilities would be. I did not get a chance to see my office or get a good feel of what the day to day activities would be like. Had I seen those things, I probably would not have taken the position. It wasn't a good fit for me. Also, as an electrical engineer, the role was looked at as support, rather than lead. Looking at management, most of those people have a chemical or mechanical background since those roles drive the company. It's difficult for an electrical person to get noticed, but not impossible.

pros: They care about their people. The training opportunities have been excellent. One of their top priorities is SAFETY. There are some really wonderful and hard working people at this company. Overall it is a great company to work for, like any company there are issues and I see Eastman moving in a great direction.
cons: The biggest would be the benefits but i don't see that as Eastman's fault, they are a business and have to balance offering benefits with business decisions. Medical costs are rising at an alarming rate.

review_title: Not sure why I went to college for this.
pros: The pay is good. The insurance deductible is ok, but it has more than quadrupled since starting 3 years ago.
cons: After starting questions about job security were being asked within a month. No chance of moving up unless you have your doctorate, even though the doctor’s bosses don't have one.  Vacation use is not guaranteed and hard to take because the business always needs you more than not. Some vacation time is always forfeited without compensation. Eastman touts is safety program, but little if any common sense is used when implementing safety procedures. The only thing that keeps more employees from reporting that they are hurt is the fact that Eastman fires employees hurt on the job regardless of fault.

pros: Employee focused, good benefits, gym and group fitness on premises that spouses can also use, 401K company match, Fidelity advisors will come to plant to meet with employees, flex schedules, personal day in addition to vacation, and opportunity for additional paid time off for contributing to United Way, paid time off for doctor appointments and volunteering, and more.  By far the best employer in the area. Good pay in comparison to other companies.
cons: It seems like they keep taking things away to cut costs such as printers, vacation carryover, but continue to waste in other areas. This has a huge impact on morale, especially when the top executives don't appear to be sacrificing.

review_title: Eastman is a great place to work
pros:
Eastman is an great company to work for.  These are the reasons why:
1)  Ethics:  Starting at the top, the company is full of people that are honest and believe in living an ethical and moral lifestyle
2)  Northeast TN:  Eastman's headquarters is in Northeast TN,one of the most beautiful places in the world.  I know this because I have traveled around the world.
3)  People:  Worldclass people that are professional, smart and great to work with.  The people are truly a step above and go the extra mile.
4)  Respect:  I feel respected and trusted to do my job.  Trustworthy people have a tendency to be trusting.  My supervisor trusts my word and my judgment.
cons: Northeast TN is a small town atmosphere.  It is difficult for young people and single people.  Southern people can be closed minded.

review_title: Long and very satisfying career with Eastman so far.  Great people!  However, I am concerned...
pros: Eastman actually does care about their team members and their well being.  Lots of opportunities for those willing to engage the challenges and work hard on the solutions.  For such a large company, integrity and ethical practices are still in very much in practice daily.  I personally think this is the backbone of Eastman's strength.
cons: Some of the management and leaders of acquisitioned companies seem to not practice the same level of teamwork and integrity as is the culture of Eastman.   Have seen some of this behavior somewhat "tolerated" over the last year or so.  Very concerning to me.

pros: Eastman has had a lot of interesting product releases in the last several years, and along with the acquisitions, the product portfolio has expanded to the point of having many different types of businesses and technologies to work on, so plenty of good opportunities to continuously learn.  The company also does allow people to change job functions (provided there is a need).  With so many manufacturing sites, there are usually opportunities to travel for work if you seek them out.
cons:
First, the company has made a huge negative shift in how they value their employees.  When I hired on, it was a team based feel where people enjoyed helping each other.  After the rating system was introduced, the desire to help each other started to drop.  Mentoring became more awkward for people, as helping one person might be hurting another, so both the company and the employees were losing.  

The company has some ethical issues as well.  Despite receiving the "Most Ethical Company" award several years in a row, there are some shady actions that happen within the company.  There was one particular issue I reported, and after the investigation occurred, I was told "That's just part of their process."  

The company doesn't seem to truly value diversity and inclusion.  This issue becomes worse as you move from Senior Management to middle management as well.  Senior Leadership at least recognizes it and says they want to work on it.   A good portion of the middle management (in all fairness, not all) ignores it.  The company took the approach of "it takes time to change a culture" when it came to diversity and inclusion, but when the company wanted a change for something that made a quick dollar for the shareholder...let's just say things were happening within a week.   

Promotions are horrifically slow, unless you are one of the "chosen" ones who are placed in special development programs.  They have a list of these "chosen" ones for opportunities, and the select people are added pretty quickly after starting with the company.  This brought the diversity issue to the forefront even more; how were they able to pick these "chosen" ones without some time to evaluate a person's work?   The answer is reflected well in the organizational charts.

review_title: I've worked for three chemical companies in my career and I enjoy working at Eastman the most of all.
job_title: Principal Industrial Hygienist in Kingsport, TN
pros: Eastman people, from the bottom of the ladder to the top, can and do meet as equals to get the job done.  It's an incredible feeling of empowerment where everyone's input is valued.  The difference with other chemical company employers that I have experienced is the culture and the people.  I consider the people in my immediate work group as some of my best friends.
cons: I started out at Eastman, then in a period of seven years (for personal reasons) worked for two other chemical companies and then came back to be re-employed by Eastman.  In coming back, I did accept a lower pay rate, but that was brought back in line in a few years.  I don't think this (lower pay rate) is an issue now for new hires.

review_title: Eastman Chemical Company is a steady, reliable employer.
job_title: Integrated Global Supply Chain in Kingsport, TN
pros:
For the most part, I do not worry that my job will be eliminated or outsourced.  In my job, I am pretty much my own boss; I know what needs to be done, and I am able to do it according to how I best see fit.  I do not have a manager breathing down my neck barking out orders.  
Eastman preaches safety above all else.  The expectation is that all jobs will be done safely.  Taking short cuts is clearly a violation of company policy.
cons: Eastman's selection of 1st line supervisors and similar positions -- safety representatives, for example -- sometimes makes one wonder, "What were they thinking?"  It's not uncommon for written communication at that level to contain poor grammar and misspelled words.  If a person does not know proper grammar or how to use a spell check program, can I really trust him to make sound decisions?

review_title: Great place to work with fantastic corporate culture and fellow team members
pros: Eastman corporate culture and values are top notch and it makes a difference to work for a company that is truly ethical. The fellow team members provide a familial atmosphere to the workplace and even upper level management seems down to earth with a concern of you as a person and employee. Opportunities to grow within several different areas are available and you can experience different roles with or without relocating. Recent acquisitions have made the company more global allowing for more diversity and experiences interacting with different cultures.
cons: Historically analytical culture and employee mindset can hinder quick innovation and path to action - decisions can feel like they take extended periods of time to reach action state. Company has recognized this and is changing but still overcoming the fear of something not working or failing can slow down changes or innovations from being implemented.

review_title: Great place to work all around!
pros:
Great people to work for.
The culture is the best thing at Eastman.
Having the option to work 4 9's and a 4 or 5 8's.
There is something to for everyone as far as extra curricular activities go. 
Love the Eastman sports leagues.
cons:
The same as anywhere else really. It can be somewhat competitive and when you take over a role from someone else who moves on to another role, you often do not get much transition help from those whose role you are taking over. That means you pick up their projects in the middle and don't get much help figuring out where to go from there.

Sometimes I think the managment wants to follow what the big companies do too much instead of stick to what has made Eastman a great place to be. So far they havn't done so, but I just sometimes think they want to.

review_title: Unique products with good work/life balance
job_title: GL Team Lead in Kingsport, TN
pros:
The company really lives by its commitment to ethics. 
Though it's a big company, and a public one, it feels much more like a family company.
The polymer products are, in general, quite differentiated, so they have true value propositions and the work to become qualified in a new application is satisfying.
There appear to be a lot of opportunities for moving to different roles. 
There doesn't seem to be the same budget crunch feeling here as in other R&D organizations.
cons:
People are sometimes *too* nice, and conflict-averse. 
It's a big ship, and it takes a lot to change the direction of a big ship. 
Chemical companies tend to be risk averse; Eastman is no exception.

pros: Eastman provides a very challenging but also very rewarding work environment.  It is exciting to be part of a growing company with unique competitive advantages and a keen focus on growing in ways that will sustain the company for consumers, employees and the community for many, many years.  I have never worked with employees, regardless of position, more committed to company success.
cons: There is a tendency for things to get bogged down in perpetual analysis but I am seeing this improve as employees are being challenged to work more efficiently and to let go of non-value adding work.  In times of stress or poor market conditions employees can also feel like there is little trust or empowerment for them to do their jobs in ways that benefit the company.

pros: No pros about working in Logistics.
cons:
Working in Logistics at Eastman is very demeaning and degrading.  It is not a trusting, healthy work environment.   There are lots of mixed messages coming from Logistics Management and it is a very stressful environment.  Employees are micromanaged, told what to say, how to say it and what to think.   

Logistics Management is a good ole boys club and the people at the top have very long memories.   They continue to put people in authority positions that will agree and are yes-men.   If you ever make a mistake, they are unforgiving and will bring up things that happened years ago.   Management does not like it when you have a different opinion and do not agree with their approach.

review_title: Eastman Chemical has been a great company for me to earn a living and support my family.
pros: There are many pros to working at Eastman. Those at the top of my list include: location--East Tennessee is a beautiful place to live and offers many outdoor activities; salary--among the best in the area; opportunities to advance--so many different areas to work in and learn new skills; quality coworkers--high standards for contribution and behavior; leadership--many managers are invested in the success of their employees; community--Eastman is very supportive of the local community and strives to be a good neighbor and the community benefits as a result; benefit package--Eastman offers competitive health, dental and retirement packages; health and wellness focus--many opportunities and encouragement to be fit and conscious of health.
cons: There are hazards of working at any chemical company. You just have to be aware of your surroundings and watch out for your coworkers. The smells of the plant can be intense and unpleasant at times.

review_title: Eastman is a strong company--stronger than my first day of work. Not all companies made the hard choices. EMN did.
pros: Great teams, co-workers. Wonderful community for families, strong values and community support through $$$ and time of employees. Amazing results given the time constraints/volume of work/high expectations and growth.
cons: People have difficulty comparing what we have now to what is available elsewhere and seeing how lucky we are. The big pensions and free health care are gone for everyone. Understand we have the best of what is out there now.

review_title: I look forward to coming to work each day
pros: Eastman has it's priorities in the right place.  I have never had an instance in which I needed to take care of something with my family and was told that it would have to wait.  Also, the people I work with are great and I genuinely look forward to working with them each day.  Eastman has also proven to be very stable.  Finally, Eastman genuinely cares about the development of employees.
cons: Eastman is a large, publically traded company that comes along with a lot of the "stuff" that other companies like that bring.  That said, Eastman has always tried to distinguish itself through its values, culture, and people.  This has proven true with me.  Healthcare recently changed to higher premiums and higher deductibles.

review_title: Not starstruck, but overall, a pretty sweet deal.
job_title: Integrated Global Supply Chain in Kingsport, TN
pros: There are many great opportunities in my organization right now to step up, advance, gain training, experience and responsibility. Eastman culture is highly focused on developing people.The pay is competitive, and the work life balance is really fantastic.
cons: Highly bureaucratic and risk-averse environment, takes a long time to make any decisions. The decision is often to just keep doing what we're doing, even if it's clearly not the best answer. We are just afraid to try something different, because failure is not okay. We could be better!

pros: Have been at Eastman for a long time and can say that if you are adaptable, enjoy challenges and are willing to shape your own role, this is the place to be. The Eastman I work for today has evolved over the years to keep up with a changing environment and demographics, and I like what I see and am proud of contributing to this constant change.
cons: I do not have any to share.

review_title: Believe some hype ... just not all of  it.
pros: Solid company based on a good reputation for innovation, global reach. The company financial outlook looks stable. Fairly good benefits. Vacation time is often based on lifetime experience--not just years with Eastman.  Eastern Tennessee is nice.
cons:
Despite what the company says or how it talks about itself in the media, there seems to be a shift from innovation to mergers and acquisitions. Upper management is increasingly from a business background than engineering, which creates a disconnect--perhaps why it feels like such a class system of elites vs. working people. It's a schism that seems to be growing. Employees are asked to tighten our belts but there doesn't seem to be any lack of perks for execs. 

Another con is that Kingsport smells from all the industry. But you can live a short way away and be ok.

pros: Eastman is a good company with a range of career opportunities.  Being part of the company as it is growing through acquisition and organic growth is both fun and exciting.  In general the work life balance is good and the company is very ethical and treats employees well.
cons: The compensation at Eastman is lower than what you could obtain elsewhere for both salary and benefits (insurance, bonus, etc.).

pros: Has a lot of exceptional employees and is a great location to work.  The Eastman company culture has an excellent reputation that is mostly deserved.  Company is highly invested in the Kingsport, TN site.
cons: New company leadership team is overly emphasizing a "performance culture."  While this is theoretically appealing, in practice it falls flat.  Comparing apples and oranges since in the current lean structure comparisons of employees is very subjective and IMHO eventually lead to declining morale & performance.  Eastman has apparently recently introduced a somewhat arbitrary method to rid itself of low level executives and mid- to senior-managers.  With the current management philosophy don't plan on a career at Eastman.  A particular element to working for this company in Kingsport is that there are very few competitive employment opportunities in the area.

pros:
Eastman is a high performing, ethical company and strives to do the "right thing" at all times.  Eastman does a great job of recognizing its team members are the reason for its success.  

While some who work at HQ in Kingsport find a non-metro area as a con, I think it's a pro.  I have lived in several big cities and love the relaxed pace of Kingsport, the strong ties Eastman has to the community, and the easy commute to work.  Kingsport is close to Charlotte, Knoxville, and Asheville which provides a quick drive to a larger city for activites like sporting events and shopping.
cons: Advancement opportunities are not always available due to low turnover.  While low turnover is a good thing because it demonstrates my pros stated above, it can impact the ability to rise to leadership positions.

review_title: Eastman has been an excellent company to work for - for 28 years.
pros: Eastman wants employees to be engaged and empowered. I have worked for Eastman for more than 25 years and I can honestly say that no two days have been the same. They keep employees motivated by giving us the opportunity to do different jobs, letting us have a voice in our career paths, by recognizing us and paying us well. They also allow us to have flex time and enable us to work from home so that we can balance our lives. They also offer a host of health and wellness opportunities.
cons: I can not think of any cons. Eastman management has always listened to my opinions and my concerns. They always do the right thing. Eastman is an ethical, family-oriented company.

review_title: Great place with lots of opportunity
pros: One of the best things about Eastman is the people you work with. They want you to succeed in your job. As a new employee I have been welcomed in and given the necessary training. They also provide networking events for new hires every month. The work life balance has beenn a big plus as well. It has been a great experinece thus far.
cons: Vacation rollover could be better. The amount of days you can carry over and the time you have to spend them by keeps getting reduced.

job_title: Process Improvement Engineer in Longview, TX
pros:
Management promotes work/life balance and family focus

Great opportunities for growth and development (if you seek out those opportunities)

Eastman has a solid long term strategy (integrated specialty chemicals) and a track record of returning value to shareholders.  These attributes are integral to sustainable business.
cons:
Eastman is a global company with many small sites.  However, Eastman's two biggest sites are in small towns (Kingsport, TN and Longview, TX).  Employees should understand the implications of living in a smaller town (~70k population). 

Compensation can often lag the going rate of the market.  This is tolerated because the work culture and environment are truly very good.  However, it is something to consider.

job_title: Advanced Research Scientist in Kingsport, TN
pros: The company really fosters a collaborative work environment where the employees, especially in technology, are encouraged to interact with each other for the betterment of the company. The company also seems to genuinely care for its’ employees, which makes sense, as happy employees are good employees. And the company has switched its focus to become more customer focused. Meaning they are interacting with customers more often to develop new technologies. This will lead to new commercial products in a shorter period of time.
cons: As I have only been working at Eastman for a short period, I have not found any negatives as of yet. I guess the area could be a concern for some as it is not located in a metropolitan area, but East TN is beautiful, and if you enjoy the outdoors, there are not many better places to be located.

pros: Through the interview process to being here for a month, there has been not one moment that I have felt unwelcome or benefitted from the excitement of my coworkers.  My team members and coworkers make the company culture not only innovative but challenges me to learn and grow my OWN career while having a little fun.  I think I am really going to enjoy being a process improvement engineer and beginning my career here.
cons: The company is so large at this site alone, it is going to be hard to meet everyone.

review_title: Trustworthy, technically excellent company with a sound plan for the future
pros: People work together to achieve the greater company goals; you work with trustworthy people - if they say they will do something, they will; flex schedules are allowed whenever possible; management actively works to train and develop people.
cons: Feedback on performance is once/quarter at best.  Reduced schedules (less than full-time work) are generally reserved for those with family responsibilities or retirees that are hired for specific company needs.

review_title: Very fullfilling career with many opportunities and challenges presented in my 20 years with the Company.
pros: The culture is team oriented and supportive. The people are fantastic to work with.  The small town atmosphere of a global company headquarters is unique, and the town embraces Eastman and what is means to this region.
cons: More diversity in senior leadership positions is needed.  The company needs to ensure that the candidate pool for next generation leaders in being developed to be robust, diverse and reflective of the ideals of our employee base

review_title: Eastman has provided me with endless opportunities to develop as an engineer, coworker, philanthropist, and person.
pros: Eastman places an extreme value on personal development all throughout your career. This company focuses on betterment of the individual because that translates to an even larger scale of betterment of the company. Not only does Eastman compensate employees with highly competitive wages, but also ensures that your job satisfication- relationships with peers and superiors, project focuses, career planning - is where you want it to be as well. With a company like Eastman, there is endless potential to work in countless positions with amazing and brilliant individuals; there are endless opportunities to develop leadership skills and move laterally as well as up the ladder if one desires. Everyone has a voice at Eastman.
cons: The only challenge I can see arise from working at Eastman is that there are over 7,000 employees at our site and it is difficult to get to know everyone just do the volume of people and the size of the site.

review_title: Eastman promotes employee engagement and development to drive company performance.
pros:
Eastman treats employees as a valuable resource and invests in their development.  We identify high performers and provide them with a variety of assignments to maximize their impact.  
Eastman is financially solid and well-managed;   this has enabled the company to deliver consistent growth to shareholders and provided a stable work environment for employees.
Expectations are communicated and we are held accountable to deliver results against these clear expectations.  It is much easier to succeed when you understand the target and objective.
cons:
Eastman is siloed and it can be difficult to make connections across businesses and functions.  
It is often risk-adverse and this impacts our desire to be viewed as a more specialty company since we don't like to introduce product offerings with an uncertain future.

pros:
Many dedicated employees
Diversified product portfolio 
Expertise on technology platforms
Strong engineering capabilities
cons:
Mark Costa  is destroying the company. Where is backbone of the rest of the executive team? Will HR stand up?

The employees are treated as disposable. The great culture of teamwork and collaboration is being laid off and if you oppose it in anyway its career suicide. 

Too many employees coming in without expertise. American jobs have been shipped to Hyderabad India and the rate is only increasing. Hyderabad employees are creating disasters, too many jobs added too fast there. We’re laying off the very people that can fix the mess. All new employees are in India or straight out of school. You get what you pay for. 

We say D&I is important to us, yet we are moving jobs rapidly to a place that has a horrible diversity and inclusion record, particularly towards women.  When issues happen with they are excused because of their cultural background.  I guess it is fitting since there are no women on the Executive Team, and only one minority in that group.   

Mark’s strategy looks like classic corporate greed, he took raises away after they were communicated to employees. He says we don’t have the money, yet we announced an acquisition weeks later. Not to mention we have the cash to increase the dividends and buy back stock. Did I mention Mark flies back and forth to his home in Miami weekly, also his pay is higher than any previous CEO at a time employees are treated the worst in the company’s history? Where is HR and the rest of the Executive Team? 

Training and continuing education for employees is at a paltry level. 

Cost cutting and layoffs for years isn’t a strategy!

review_title: Eastman is an excellent career path for bright, hard-working people who value teamwork, integrity and continued growth.
pros: Eastman's culture values honesty and depth of character.  Humility is important--your colleagues are exceptionally talented and experienced.  Employees enjoy problem solving and helping each other and our customers to solve complex problems.  Employees are strongly encouraged, enabled and empowered to continue developing throughout their careers--an Eastman employee may change roles and responsiblities many times over a career without changing employers.  Eastman invests in the long-term wellfare of its employees--fair pay, good benefits, personal wellness incentives and a strong emphasis on safety.
cons: Plant locations, including the global headquarters, are located in fairly remote areas.  Travel can be time-consuming from non-urban centers.  Cultural diversity is more difficult to achieve in non-urban locations.

review_title: Eastman is a great company full of hard working people who are dedicated to each other and the company's success!
pros: People are easily Eastman's greatest assest.  You find great people across all organizations who truly care about each other and are extremely responsible towards their committments.  There is a strong team environment and it can be a bit of a family culture at Eastman which can be a tremendous benefit both personally and professionally.  I also enjoy how we operate with a high level of sophistication.  There are a lot of very intelligent people around the world coming from all walks of life who bring an incredible amount of talent and diversity of thinking to the table.  I've really benefited over the years learning from my colleagues and peers.
cons: A very matrix structure can sometimes challenge pace and clarity of decision making if the objective of the work is not clearly defined.  Ability to gain alignment and committment favors those who are strong communicators.

pros: The culture is phenomenal. Everyone wants to contribute, learn, and grow at their maximum capacities. The leadership in this company is great, and is able to get the most out of it's people. This is the best company in the region to work for because of the commitment to its employees and the communities that it serves. There is a clear vision that everyone can follow here, and everyone is on board.
cons: The con can also be a pro for some. This is a small town when it comes to life outside of work. If you enjoy the mountains and outdoor activites, this region is the place for you. If you enjoy urban life and the culture that bigger cities have to offer, you may be disappointed. I will say Kingsport is on the move, and it is looking for opportunities to accomodate this problem.

review_title: Blah.  No real employee value proposition anymore
pros: Most people tend to be friendly and helpful, but you never know when that helpfulness will come back to bite you in the form of negative feedback to your boss for not knowing how to do something.
cons:
There are a lot of downsides.  Management more and more seems to think that continued employment and a paycheck every two weeks is the only benefit necessary.  While this messaging may have been acceptable the past few years, the economy is much improved and employees are starting to walk out on these hardball tactics.  The company culture is mostly an office space mentality where everyone does enough to get by because there is no incentive to do more.  

Promotions are very difficult to come by unless you are in the “in” crowd as Eastman is very political.

Favoritism is rampant as well.

Right now the environment at the company is not pro employee and very toxic.  I would avoid it if you can.

review_title: I love Eastman as a whole but upper management does not care about the blue collar worker
pros: Great people to work with, good pay and benefits. Low level management is super.
cons: I worked for Eastman a total of 22 years. This is almost half of my life. I had a life changing event happen recently and was let go because of this. I would not wish what happened to me on anyone but upper management did not care. I had several etr's and have NEVER been written up during my entire career there. I am now 50 years old and without a job. Upper management DID NOT CARE what had happened to me!  My now ex sister in law works in HR and this only added to my problem. I was taken to b215 and was let go before I even got there.

job_title: Integrated Global Supply Chain in Kingsport, TN
pros: The environment at Eastman is incredibly collaborative and uplifting for everyone. Everyone seems to have the company's best interest ahead of their own, and its apparent in the day-to-day activities around the office. Eastman values hard work and integrity, and rewards employees accordingly. Eastman is a growing company with a lot of opportunity, I feel very fortunate to work at Eastman Chemical Company.
cons: Depending on how you like to spend your free time, some see the location as a Con. Kingsport is not a large city, and the closest bigger cities are 1+ hours away.

review_title: This is the best place where I've ever worked.
pros: People at Eastman are willing to help you with whatever project you're working on. I've never felt such a team spirit at any other company.  Also, whether its someone in manufacturing or someone in a business office, everyone seems to be focused on the same things to move the company forward
cons: Competition from companies in other countries continues to increase and increase quickly.  It's sometimes hard to stay ahead or even keep up. Plus the company has grown quite a bit in the last 3-5 years and alot of change has occurred. The changes haven't necessarily been bad, but there's been constant change.

pros: Eastman's culture is one of a kind. Collaboration is huge. Everyone works together to reach a common goal. Leadership is humble and so very down to Earth. Employees positively impact the company regardless of title and you can tell everyone truly cares for one another. Working for Eastman has really been inspirational. They equip you with everything you need to succeed in life and then some, always going one step beyond what is necessary. They are also always giving back to the community in not only money, but time as well. Eastman encourages and pays its employees to volunteer their time to local non-profits and organizations. They really invest in their employees and are constantly insistent on work-life balance. I’m blessed to work for such a wonderful company.
cons: Some of the challenges of working for Eastman is that it's rather conservative and traditional. But leadership is very open to hearing new ideas and ways of doing things. They understand that times have changed.

pros: There are a lot of opportunities to try a lot of different kinds of jobs. Changing jobs every three years to try something new not uncommon, great way to get a good view of the company. People are genuinely nice, polite southern culture, and East Tennessee is a gorgeous place to live.
cons: Management does have their favorites, options for growth if you weren’t on that list are limited. With the southern culture comes some passive aggressiveness,  they are not great with conflict.  There are some limitations to the culture of the area, lack of diversity especially with trying to raise a young family.

job_title: IT Systems Analyst in Kingsport, TN
pros: My co-workers are great to work with. They are knowledgeable, dependable and will rally to help others to fix a computer system problem.
cons: Within the last 3 years I’ve seen supervisors become cold and callous in their zeal to improve employee performance. Employees within my division who were known for their expertise and strong performance have taken early retirement because of recent poor annual performance ratings and unreasonable supervisor expectations. I too have become a victim of The Set-Up-To-Fail Syndrome described in the March 1998 issue of the Business Harvard Review. I tried the open door policy with my management and met with HR representatives to discuss the situation but to no avail. I feel employees in my position have no advocate or means to deal with unreasonable supervisors.

pros: Eastman offers excellent compensation, competitive benefits, and they value a reasonable work-life balance (for most positions). They are extremely focused on creating a safe workplace and protecting the environment.  There are a wide variety of job opportunities for most roles -- lots of potential to move around the company to gain experience with different divisions.  HQ is in Kingsport TN -- safe, great schools, and an excellent area in which to raise a family.
cons: Promotions occur at a slow pace.  While there are opportunities to move around, moves don't typically occur fast unless you are on the "fast track".  HQ is in Kingsport TN.  While this area has an incredibly low cost of living (~15% below national average), your "entertainment" options are limited unless you want to drive 2-5 hrs to a big city.

pros: The other engineers I work with are extremely smart and capable, and our team's boss is very committed to using the talents of her team efficiently and helping us reach our career goals, even when that means moving to a different team or department within the company. There are some good training opportunities offered both to new employees and veteran engineers. The culture of Eastman encourages work-life balance and focuses on collaboration between employees rather than competition to perform. The Kingsport site is very large, so mechanical engineers have a great opportunity to get experience with several different types of equipment and support multiple processes.
cons: Some of the initiatives that upper management is pushing seem to be geared towards making the company seem more streamlined, rather than increasing the efficiency and safety of plant operations. It would also help if upper management was more transparent with their employees about the state of the company and how money will be spent.

review_title: Love my job love my company
pros: I love coming to work each day because I get to do what I do best.  I get rewarded for doing a good job.  I get to work with exceptional people.  I get to make a difference for my company, my community, my country and people around the world.  I love working for a company that cares about it's people, the community and the environment.  The culture here sets Eastman apart.  We reward on results and behaviors not just results.  Those who help others and make others better are rewarded so it's refreshing being in an environment where everyone wants to help each other and work with each other
cons: With growth comes lots of opportunities.  The hardest thing about working at Eastman is prioritizing the many good things you could be working on

review_title: Great Company to Work for but There are Always Improvement Opportunities
job_title: Second Level Manager in Kingsport, TN
pros:
Company has strong leadership and stategy/direction. Safety is given a very high priority. 
Opportunities to change roles/career paths without leaving the company.
cons:
Relative perfromance initiative is not very well defined or executed. This program has also been somewhat detrimental to the team culture that Eastman has historically had. 
It is very difficult to adequately reward plant roll employees for outstanding performance, but management is significantly rewarded for slightly above average performance. 
Although honesty and integrity are highly valued, some levels of management have difficult time shooting straight. They will sugar coat things or not fully communicate the details behind decisions.

review_title: Great company culture with talented people and a leadership team that cares!
pros: The leadership team leads by example by creating a culture that allows employees to succeed.  The company has a great safety mindset and is working on creating a culture of health.  Eastman has a very competitive compensation and benefits package.  Eastman is continuing to grow which translates into career opportunities.  It's a place where team-mindedness is embraced.
cons: As the company continues to grow globally, the Kingsport, TN corporate mindset will need to evolve into a global mindset. Employees located in Kingsport should understand that they represent only 50% of the workforce.  In addition, a collaborative culture can sometimes be confused with driving to consensus.  This can lead to decision making paralysis.

review_title: Some things change for the better, some things for the worse
pros: In over 30 years as an employee, I have seen work/life balance improve significantly. Employee/manager relationships have improved by allowing decisions to happen at the employee level, with less micromanagement. Excellent coworker relationships. Safety and environmental protection has always been paramount at Eastman at all levels.
cons: Employee morale is generally low. Salary, bonuses, and health benefits have fallen behind for plant work employees over the years. Other benefits have improved (retirement savings plans, vision, dental). Opportunities for advancement are lacking for those without advanced degrees, though wages are on par or higher than the surrounding area for operations level employees. Technician level jobs are stagnant, with limited to no advancement after passing through the advancement levels.

review_title: Rewarding career in a great company culture and team
pros: Eastman has a history of hard working employees that are creative in solving problems.   Over the past six to eight years the culture has focused on growth and is in the middle of trransforming their portfolio.    Employees are encoruaged to be collaborative and work as a team.   As employees we are proud to be a member of the Eastman team
cons: As with most companies that are undergoing change there are risks of getting away from those things that got you were you are.    Change should be executed with understanding of what were the strengths and leverage those strengths versus just changing for the sake of changing.

review_title: I work for a company that I share my values
job_title: Six Sigma Black Belt in Kingsport, TN
pros: Eastman has very capable leaders and there's a big team working behavior. I admire Eastman's integrity and honesty, its concern to safety and wellness. Eastman promotes a great work environment and gives people opportunity of learning and development. I'm very proud to work for Eastman.
cons: Due to the matrix organization structure, I feel that there's so many people in charge to approve certain things (as a new project execution, for example) that takes to much time. Process changes take too much time and effort, but could be simpler and more straightforward.

review_title: Still a great place to work!
pros: Engaged direct management concerned about me as a person and as an employee.  Opportunities for growth are available and supported. Great teamwork across the company and work/life balance most of the time.  Company supports the health of employees by offering free Group fitness classes and gym with flexible schedules to be able to fit in exercise.
cons: Benefits are not as good as what they should be.  Though this is a difficult time for the company, every effort should be made to take care of the employees and their families.  Better management of costs at the "top" would help the company overall.  Keeping debt low and having free cash flow is good.  Some of that free cash flow could be reinvested in employee benefits.  Productivity is increased when employees are not worrying about how to pay for medical and prescription expenses.

job_title: IT Systems Analyst in Kingsport, TN
pros: Decent benefits, fair pay, good work life balance
cons: We got a new CIO about a year ago. That CIO openly admitted to lying about reorganizations and restructuring in an open Q&A session. Company culture is shifting to be a lot more cut-throat with relative performance assessments (forced ranking with set targets for number of people 'not meeting' expectations). Some leaders outside of IT are able exert too much influence over how IT recognizes and promotes talent. Most frustrating recently is when the least competent candidate is selected for leadership potential and despite constantly making poor choices (leading to high performers leaving the company), nothing is done about it.

pros:
The culture and the people.  Eastman Chemical features some of the brightest and most dedicated individuals I have ever met.
