The collaborative atmosphere generates high levels of productivity while fostering professional relationships, too.  The people are friendly and helpful, and the life-work balance is ideal.

I accepted my offer with Eastman Chemical because I knew it would be a place where I would enjoy the work and be able to develop my career at my own pace.  I appreciated the high moral values embedded in the Eastman culture, and I knew I would receive challenging projects that strengthened my skills.  Mostly, I wanted to work for a company where people did not have to compete against one another but could celebrate everyone's sucess.
cons: There can be a lack of activities outside of work for young professionals.  Programs and clubs are developing, but they are not all well-established.  Location could be better.

review_title: The compensation is good, but there are unreasonable expectations at times.
pros:
- Compensation is good, including medical insurance, dental insurance and life insurance. The work can be interesting and coworkers are generally cooperative.
- The option of working 4 nine hour days and a 4 hour day on Friday is pleasant.
cons:
- There can be unrealistic expectations at times (e.g. unreasonable expected level of profiency in certain areas)
- Upper management asked us to submit a review on this site about how good it is to work there.
- Employees are often expected to be available after hours for answering questions, etc.
- Depending on the area in which you work, job responsibility can often increase without an associated increase in pay.

job_title: Supply Chain Manager in Kingsport, TN
pros: Eastman offers many opportunities to work in several different facets of the company for engineers, from engineering design to hands on troubleshooting, to working in the business side of the company.  The opportunities to move around become more difficult as you grow in salary grade.  The Culture is the best part of working at Eastman.  In general, most people are willing to help any collegue.
cons: Some jobs in the business side of the company are very demanding and stressful.  There are some people in management positions that are not as supportive of collegues, however these seem to be few and only in some areas of the business.  Also in some areas, there is management that tends to want to hold back young new hires into a position instead of looking for opportunities to grow these folks.

pros: People that work at Eastman genuinely care for coworkers. The environment is very collaborative. There is no back-stabbing here. Folks actually want everyone to succeed.
cons: Upper management has made very poor choices over the past two years. Their mistakes have resulted in folks being forced into retirement before they were ready. There have been no cuts in upper management to help with profits shortfalls. They just look at the numbers that we call employee ID numbers and cross them off. It is time for a new CEO and CFO.

review_title: Conduct market reasearch and develop market strategies.
pros: Great working teams in most cases. People tend to,like each other. Work is meaningful. Location is good to raise a family.
cons: Difficult to get honest performance feedback and potential advancement opportunity input from supervisor. Many new supervisors are not transparent. Feels like there are lots of secrets and side conversations regarding responsibilities and roles. If you’re doing your job well 95% of the time, you get a below average pay raise while others seem to do quite well.  There are few woman and people of color in leadership roles.

review_title: I've spent most of my career at Eastman with opportunity to grow, advance and try new things.
pros: People are high caliber and enjoyable to work with.  Management is pretty accessible and willing to listen. The large site I am located at has allowed multiple opportunities for me to pursue career changes without relocation.
cons: There are sometimes hints of the old boys network.  New HR policies are very time consuming for managers and punishing to most.  In the past, we have not been aggressive enough about performance issues but the new relative performer and rating systems threaten to undermine the teamwork and openness that has for many years contributed to our company's success.

pros: Eastman diversifies in a way that allows stability of both operations and employment. Though constantly changing over the years can, at times be uncomfortable, the ability to react and be proactive has helped this company weather many storms. Eastman has vastly improved in the work/life area over the years, allowing for flexible schedules and being more willing to work with employee's life situations.  I've been here over 30 years, and see the future looking bright.
cons: Pay is higher than most jobs in the region, but may still lag in some roles when compared to national averages. Hourly worker roles can become stagnant, when defined promotional limits are reached.

pros: I have been at Eastman for 11 years and during that time I have worked with amazing people and been presented with amazing opportunities.  The Eastman culture is focused on team work and family.  As a mother of 2 young children, I greatly appreciate the ability to manage my work/life balance.
cons: I currently work in one of the company's functional groups.  There is a huge difference in compensation between resources in the the business organizations and those of us in the functions.  I feel that my compensation and advancement are unfairly limited due to underappreciation of my function's responsibiliites.

job_title: Technical Service Manager/Sales Development Manager in Kingsport, TN
pros:
1.  Collaborative Environment is excellent.
2.  People at Kingsport/regional sites are excellent.
cons:
1.  If you are recruited to work at Eastman, be prepared to be used for the following information with little reward:
      a.  Connections of a focus industry if you come from that industry.
      b.  Manager not to be involved in your skill set development.
      c.  Little Career Advancement because your manager will be a fellow Eastman colleague when you start.  The manager will be promoted as a result of your experience/knowledge.
      d.  Constantly yelled out by my manager who had little experience in the industry compared to myself.
2.  Overall Benefits are terrible.  Health benefits are not good and minimal salary increases are given.
3.  Corporate Credit Card is really a personal credit card given by the company which the company reimburses for approved expenses.

job_title: Business Organization Specialist in Kingsport, TN
pros:
Lots of opportunitiy to improve skills and learn.  
Pay is above most similar jobs in the area, but is probably less to the national level in the industry.
Good management at Executive levels, expect company to grow and prosper.
cons:
Health Insurance benefits have decreased greatly in the past year with the "Consumer Driven" aspect, however it seems like the consumer is the comany rather than the employee.
Opportunities for advancement are limited sometimes by the area you are working in or the manager you report to.  Education is sometimes valued more than experience.
As it is with most of Corporate America these days, Shareholders are valued more than employees.

pros:
1) Many opportunities for engineers who are flexible with their personal lives
2) Lots of very talented co-workers who work collaboratively
3) Company is forward thinking in its business strategy and is promoting a viable long-term strategy - this has led to good Variable Pay
cons:
1) The company's sites tend to be in out of the way places
2) Benefits are kind of "middle of the road" - vacation policies (carry over, etc...) have gotten progressively worse over the last 20 years.

review_title: Eastman is a Great Place to Work!!
pros: Eastman has a very collaborative, team-oriented culture.  I've worked at other Fortune 500 Companies, and Eastman's culture is by far the best!  It's cool to look over and see the CEO having lunch beside you in the onsite cafeteria.  Kingsport (home to Eastman's Headquarters) is a small town so there's little traffic and crime, but it's within a half-day drive to larger cities.
cons: There are career development opportunies at Eatman; however, the Company has historically been slow to promote employees.  Leadership is in the process of redefining the Performance Management / Career Development Process to ensure competitiveness and allow employees to take more control of their careers.

review_title: Eastman has treated me like a family member since the day I was hired and I have been able to exceed my career goals.
pros: I have been trusted to manage areas that I never dreamed possible. I have the opportunity to travel and the opportunity to have a positive impact on our business. Eastman also cares about the health and well being of their employees. Safety is a key business initiative in all that we do.
cons: Health benefits have taken a real beating with the new consumer driven health plans. Eastman benefits are not what they used to be but they are still better than most large companies.

review_title: Eastman is a great place to work!
job_title: Supply Chain Analyst in Kingsport, TN
pros: In the area where I live, Eastman is the best place to work.  It is a very successful company that is growiing.  It has a history of stability and success.  Overall pay and benefits are very good.  Eastman will invest in developing people so there are many opportunities for continued learning.  Eastman also invests in technology and provides the best tools available for doing your job.  I work with a good team of people that feel more like family than co-workers.
cons: For me personally, I cannot think of a negative aspect of working at Eastman.

review_title: Eastman is a great place to work, learn and be valued
pros: Eastman is a very innovative company which provides different paths for you to develop a strong career. The company is flexible, very results-oriented and it is always posing challenges to the teams. I feel valued at Eastman and like very much the way the company and my co-workers act and make decisions. Eastman is concerned about people from safety, health and family issues. My quality of life improved a lot after joining Eastman.
cons: The company has made some acquisitions and people need to adapt to this new environment. It is just a matter of being adaptable but I am happy to see the company's growth! This is more a challenge than a cons.

pros: Harmonious work environment, you will never hear yelling or swearing among coworkers. Good starting salary.
cons: Lacking diversity, and the efforts to address are laughable. While they say there is no forced performance distribution, in reality, it coerced distribution; managers draw a line to meet the "suggested" distribution. Too much wasted effort on metrics to justify existence. Even the two pros are so extreme they end up being cons, need for consensus and harmony stifles creativity, empowerment, and challenging status quo, ultimately slowing change to a snail's pace. Good starting salary is quickly eroded by basically non-existent raises (once you account for benefit losses). Top heavy management, with senior management scared of shareholders. Unless you are a white, Christian, male, with stay at home wife and two kids, don't bother.

pros: They take their co-op program very seriously. The plant site in Kingsport is very large so there is a wide array of opportunities for students to gain experience. Mentors and supervisors work hard at helping new employees become acclimated with the environment. You are allowed to work on meaningful projects that are challenging and exciting. Benefits are excellent for a co-op position. The company seems to take very god care of their employees, through encouraging them to improve their health and by allowing flexible work schedules. All of the employees are easy to work with and a joy to be around. Everyone is helpful and polite. Their commitment to safety is outstanding, you can be sure you will be safe as long as you are smart about doing your job.
cons: Not much to say here, if you are OK with living in the middle of nowhere TN.

review_title: A Great Company That Will Grow on You
pros: A healthy culture underpins an engaged workforce. Leaders have a sharp focus on what's needed to stay healthy and sustain success. Kingsport, where both the corporate HQ and the huge Tennessee Operations plant are located, is a delight for those who love getting out in nature. The area is family friendly, and despite having thousands coming onto campus each day, it's a very easy commute. Growth is helping to increase opportunities and create a more diverse workforce.
cons: If you don't come from or like small communities, living and working in Kingsport may require a big adjustment. While diversity within the company has increased, the region overall is less diverse. Career opportunities exist but some career paths are not very clear. Still, Eastman is a great company that offers challenging opportunities and a chance for people to grow and excel.

job_title: First Class Operator in Kingsport, TN
pros:
Pay is great for the area.
Care about safety.
They furnish your uniforms and PPE.
cons:
Managers make you feel inferior because that is the real culture.
Insurance is high deductible and a lot out of pocket.
Shift work drains your body.
Not much room for growth. 
Once an operator you will always be one unless you make manager. 
Maintenance has endless growth opportunities that you'll never see. 
Tons of overtime/never get to see family.Work all holidays if scheduled.
No safety awards or celebrations. 
Crew morale is usually low.
Fitness centers are lacking.
Zero free coffee, lunch, snacks, etc..

review_title: Still a good place to work just not as good as it once was
pros: Great area to live, good climate, little traffic at headquarters location in Kingsport.  Almost all employees exhibit a positive attitude and are good to work with.  Great support from all levels of company to solve problems.
cons: Relentless focus on cost management has resulted in both personal and professional stress from a job security perspective and from continuing to try to accomplish the same or greater amount of work with fewer resources.  Any initiatives to reduce work do not extend into manufacturing because manufacturing work generally has so many regulatory, safety, quality and reliability requirements associated and very little can actually be eliminated.

pros:
Flexibility in scheduling; 4 9-hr days and a 4 hr day.  
Upper management stresses work/life balance, as well as fitness.
Multiple on-site fitness centers and fitness classes. 
Competitive pay/benefits and advancement ladder.
Great culture/diversity.
Opportunities to help the community by donations and volunteering. 
Supportive management, does their best to manage workloads.
cons:
Recent cost cutting has lead to people taking on multiple positions, making getting things done difficult at times.
Upper management makes an effort to be involved, but there is still sometimes a disconnect on what is going on.
Things do not always get communicated correctly between teams.

pros:
Headquarters sits 20+ miles from a beautiful, mountainous region. TN has no state income tax, which is valuable in retirement. If satisfied with rural living, then the region has some allure.

In the Kingsport area of the company, there is a great "family feel" culture in the manufacturing side and their facilities. There is a terrible culture fostered in the Headquarters.
cons:
You get the sentiment, through all the resources that are thrown into quarterly investor calls, that the company is extremely sensitive to investor demands. There is a substantial level of tension in the executive suites leading up to every investor call. 

Historically, the organization had a longer term vision. Right now it's just "Journey to Specialty." The CEO doesn't live in the region, which is a huge statement (I believe he lives in Florida). If you want to thrive in the specialty chemical space, and have career options, it's best to identify employers around other dense populations. If you relocate to Kingsport, and lose your position (there have been lay-offs and cost pressures consistently on a 3 year tick), you may damage the opportunities for your family. There are no other substantial chemical employers within 100's of miles.  The HQ is a brand-new facility, but when you go around the other facilities in Kingsport, they scream 'old age and lack of investment.' It truly is a facade. I'm not 100% sure why a young professional (male or female) would relocate here, other than to be near family. Johnson City continues to grow and that's good to see, but Kingsport with its plumes of steam in the air and the smell, it gives you the feeling you may be getting cancer every day. Beyond diversity in the CHRO seat, there is little female or diverse representation in their executive board (all white males), and I think future employees should look at this, because it is a reflection of leadership values and mindset towards diversity AND diversity of thought.

If you have a family, and want your children growing in a diverse environment, this may not be the best region for you.

Eastman Chemical is an underwhelming employer through a global lens. You would do much better to look elsewhere. If you are physically tied to the region...then this is your best financial option.

review_title: Most everyone works together and is friendly with one another.
pros: Supervision is fare and work is evenly distributed.  There are different shifts available to work which helps when it comes to the needs of your family.  Just a few of the perks include paid holidays, one personal day, paid vacation.  You are also given opportunities to grow.  The company is community-oriented and volunteer work is encouraged.  Heatlhy living and exercise are encouraged also.  There are facilties available for exercise.
cons: In my department, those with senority get to choose what area and what shift they so choose to work in each year.  This makes it hard for those who are newer employees to have to adjust their schedules and balance family/child care needs yearly.  However, this is a perk for those who have senority.

review_title: Collaborative culture with many career opportunities within the company.
job_title: Technology Group Leader in Kingsport, TN
pros: Most employees are highly ethical and work with the company's best interest in mind-this has led to the supportive, collaborative culture we have.  We hire well-employee competency is really high, and the turnover is low.  It's fantastic to have lots of career options in the same company (no moving)-I've had multiple roles over a decade+ with continued opportunities.  Training opportunities abound.  The corporate headquarters, Kingsport, is in a small city, which is a huge pro if you dislike traffic and like easy access to nature.
cons: Compensation increases are fairly minimal-in line with whatever GDP growth is, the low turnover gives HR little incentive to do more.  There are typical politics that go into selecting leaders, and those choices are rarely based on contribution/experience/skills in managing people-more on who you impress early in your career (first year or two).

review_title: No longer the company it was
pros: There is still a dynamic work force at Eastman that are committed and talented.  They represent the greatest aspects of what remains of this once wonderful company.
cons: The company has become so top-heavy that there is no longer recognition for all of the extra hours, or multiple job roles being required to hold on to jobs.  The cuts are taking place and unfortunately a lot of highly regarded and capable employees are looking for work elsewhere.  Meanwhile, there seems to be a lack of commitment by upper management to trim their own fat.

pros:
Fantastic and enthusiastic culture.  The people I work with all work well as a team.  
The benefits and compensation is very competitive.  
In a scientific community, some people tend to be selfish when it comes to ideas and results, but everyone I've met at Eastman isn't selfish or greedy.  Everyone wants to share the success.
cons: In a changing work environment across the entire continental U.S., the job ladders and structure is a little outdated.  There need to be more opportunities for 4-year degree holders to move into exempt roles, especially in research.

review_title: Almost four decades of total satisfaction
job_title: Global Supply Chain Leader in Kingsport, TN
pros: For the last 36 years, I have lived and worked for Eastman around the world in twelve countries and four continents.  Throughout those assignments, Eastman's concern and focus on family was paramount.  While the work challenges were tough and delivery of results always expected, Eastman made sure that the employee and family were well supported.  From the weekly delivery of a home town newspaper while outside the US to making sure our pet arrived safely, Eastman made the employee's family a priority.
cons: I don't have another four decades to work for this company.  I am jeleous of the next generation and the contributions they will add to Eastman's legacy of growth and success.

review_title: Eastman Chemical is a great place to work
job_title: Marketing Communications Manager in Kingsport, TN
pros: Eastman provides tools and training opportunities to improve communication and leadership across the company.  The leadership team is very involved and provides regular updates and communication to the entire company via emails, updates and town hall meetings.  Making sure that everyone is aware of and contributing to the corporate strategy is a hallmark if a great company.
cons: Eastman is a company of high performing and driven employees.  It is a difficult task to make sure that all employees continue to contribute at Eastman standards.  Although the company does a great job in this regard, it is very challenging to make sure all employees are held accountable for their contributions.

review_title: Only here for the decent pay.
pros: Good pay, good people (for the most part) and pretty good work/life balance. Dental and vision benifits are fairly good
cons: Poor communication between operations, management and tech staff. Takes way too long for newer operators to get operatirs pay. No way to move within the company where a persons skill set or education can be used the best. Very political. Health insurance is a joke. The operations people get taken advantage of while the upper management get very good bonuses, very good!  Very low morale

review_title: This company's culture is truly a competive advantage.....I think that Eastman is a well-kept secret
pros: A culture that is serious about helping people succeed - not something that you find in many organizations; Challenging work that allows you to make significant contribution to the company; People listen and respect your ideas.  The company is in a growth mode and it feels as though there will be great career opportunities in the near and long term.
cons: The pace of decision-making can be slow.  There appears to be a need for a great deal of consensus before people make decisions or a lack of confidence in making decisions.  Its also a very process driven organization.  Sometimes if feels like process just for process sake, not necessarily a compelling business reason.

review_title: Great company, but changing with the tides
pros: People and established culture are great, and have always been great.  Eastman preaches core values, and I have experienced this to generally be real - most people subscribe to the Eastman core values, especially safety, integrity, and performance-driven teams.
cons: It's still a business, and there does seem to be some gamesmanship that goes on in different aspects of the business.  I'm not sure you can ever be successful in business if you are completely transparent, unfortunately.  There have been many changes over my 12-year tenure here, and many of them are not in the direction I would choose, but they seem necessary with the current business/economic climate.

pros:
This company really makes the employees feel important. 
They have the highest focus on safety, diversity, ethics, and product quality of any company I’ve ever been a part of.  
I can’t apeak for every dept here, or the hundreds of areas, but as for mine the management is as good as it gets. Working 12 hour shift work with the same people really brings you close to one another. To a point where your almost family. 
Great company.... I plan to retire from here.
cons:
As with a lot of companies our insurance benefits continuously get worse. The prices go up and the coverage go down. I don’t fault the company for this as much as the healthcare industry as a whole. 
I still have insurance so I can’t complain.

pros:
-The high caliber, high performance culture. 
-If you're good and want to learn, you'll quickly be noticed and given significant responsibilities.
-Good work/life balance for the most part
-No traffic EVER to get to work
-Surrounded by extremely smart people who care about the company/community so it helps motivate you to bring your "A-Game" every single day
-Eastman is undergoing a massive transformation into a specialty company. Its a great time to jump on-board and help shape the journey (just look at the stock price)
cons: -Geographically, it doesn't have the trappings of Manhattan or Silicon Valley (but doesn't have the cost of living associated with each) but if you accept it for what it is (great community, VERY low cost of living, unlimited outdoors activities, short drive from major cities) its a great place to be

review_title: Awesome!  Eastman is a great place to work!
pros: Eastman cares about your work vs family life.  They take steps to ensure your health and well being.  The salaries are above what people could make elsewhere in the community.  The benefits are great and the work facilities and working environment are very well maintained and comfortable to work in.
cons: The only downside I could say is the parking.  Not to say that the parking lots are not adequate, it's just that you have to park so far from your work area due to the number of people working at Eastman, but that is a good thing, that so many people have good jobs so I guess I couldn't really call this is a con.

review_title: A company that cares about developing its employee coupled with high-integrity, ethical culture
pros: Eastman knows its stripe and know where it stands in the chemical space and the Eastman team works closely to transform Eastman to a specialty chemical company. In the process of doing so, it will open up opportunities for employee to grow professionally and Eastman believes in coaching its employee towards reaching their highest career potential
cons: We need to be patient with our career progression since succession planning is very key in developing next generation talent. This methodical process for career development could be frustrating for some employee, especially those who came from other industry.

pros: Eastman is a highly ethical company and there is comfort in knowing that you will not be asked to do something that is questionable as well as knowing you can discuss concerns at any level of management. Also, the diversity in assignments enables employees to gain expertise and grow personally.
cons: Long hours and struggle for work/life balance depending on position. Maybe it is the larger roles given cost measure from prior years during the recession or the full swing growth activities, regardless, still difficult. Also, seems the compensation is still in the recession mode.

pros: One of the best companies to work for in this area. There are very few choices though when it comes to manufacturing. This is why Eastman can do the things they have been doing. There is  no competition.
cons: Very poor employee satisfaction below the management level.Have had very good performance the last few years but have constantly cut benefits and given only minor cost of living raises.Cut retiree benefits to the very people that have made the company what it is today. Upper management has enjoyed large bonuses and pay increases While the majority of the company has suffered. George Eastman would be disappointed at what his company has become.Have worked for them for 43 years. If only the company treated the employees as it did in the first few years I worked there.

pros: A good place to start your career if you are freshly out of school or need visa sponsorship. Eastman is nice to new people and compensation is good.
cons: Career movement is very slow. Eventually you will find yourself become a second-tier politician and third-tier scientist if you want to be promoted (or "join the club"). Diversity is lacking - Need more people with diverse background sitting in management positions. Until so, Eastman will struggle competing globally.

review_title: I have grown as a person and as a professional because of the various assignments and projects that Eastman has provided
pros: Having worked at two companies previously, I can say with confidence that Eastman is a forward thinking organization despite being in a very conservative industry. Eastman embraces new marketing practices, modern IT tools and fosters a culture of individual growth.
cons: Being a matrixed organization, decisions tend to be made by committee and so it takes a long time to make decisions.  The selection of health care provider is dismal.

pros: Eastman provides so many opportunities to grow your career both locally and globally.  I have found that I have developed professionally and have a sense of contribution since I have been at Eastman.  As a new employee, I have found that others within my team took the extra time to mentor me and solicite feedback from me about my expertise.  Although Eastman is a large company, the culture is close knit, friendly and collaborative.  I love working for a company that is so innovative and plays a vital part in products that touches our lives every day.
cons: Overall, the benefits are great, but it would be even better if out of pocket deductables were a little lower.  The monthly premiums are the lowest that I have had with any other company, so I guess it balances out.

pros: Good non-micro managing work culture. Management puts faith in employees to get their job done, and we can then more easily deliver results. People are generally friendly and helpful. Benefits seem to be decent. The company supports new product development (although the stage-gate process seems cumbersome at times), and seems to have a very good strategy for growth. Great international focus, allows for a dynamic team environment.
cons: The travel reimbursement system/work credit card is horrible. By far the worst part of traveling for the company. Please give us Amex and a reasonable expense report system, personal reimbursement needs to go, its an unnecessary inconvenience.

job_title: Brand Communications Manager in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Eastman offers a respectful environment filled with really smart people who care about doing what it takes to drive results. Leadership provides the resources (people, tools, budget, etc.) to support growth initiatives, innovation and day to day "lights and water." The opportunities for growth - through training, cross function movement, etc., is tremendous. I feel very blessed to work for a company with so many positives!
cons: Because there are a lot of really smart people and good ideas are welcome from any function in the organization, there's no shortage of "what ifs." Everyone, however, is reasonable and respectful of a set strategy that allows you to say no to good ideas (at least for the project at hand).

review_title: A great place to grow personally and professionally!
pros: The opportunities for growth are numerous and I feel like the supervisors care about their employees well-being. The company provides high quality training to support your professional growth.
cons: The environment can be very competitive and can make for a stressful work environment. The company policy's try to support a fair and equal opportunity workplace. But it is obvious that many people are promoted based on family ties and not on their own merits.

pros: Eastman is an amazing company to work for as an intern.  They give you hands-on experience by allowing you to work on projects in the plant that are making a difference.  Their University Relations team wants to make sure you have an overall positive experience working for them so they setup a variety of activities for their interns and co-ops.
cons: The plant is located in northeastern Tennessee.  The closest "big" city is about an hour away.  However, there is still a ton of stuff to do in the Tri-Cities area.

review_title: How to Build a Best Place to Work
pros: I have enjoyed working in the payroll department for the last year. I am a new employee and have been challenged in this department. I am grateful for the amazing and helpful employees in the payroll area. The North American Payroll Team is a group of 11 employees with a combined 116 years’ experience. We handle payroll for approximately 11,000 Eastman team members in 36 U.S. states and Canada. I love the flexible schedule that I work. Also, I like that our supervisor does not micromanage us but trusts us to get our work done.
cons: I am a limited service employee who can not work more than 1,300 hours a year. I do not receive any benefits or vacation days. I would love to get hired as a part time employee with paid time off and vesting for retirement.

pros: Great place to start employment because they invest in training (up until recent years) but  not a good place to grow a career as a young professional
cons:
Eastman has begun to slash and burn benefit packages to make investors happy. Employee morale is at an all-time low. 

New ranking system (the kind Exxon or Mobil has abandoned) is ranking the bottom 5% as Does Not Meet Expectations, 15% Partially Meets Expectations. This has financial impact as well as stigma. After two layoffs in 2016, the company still believes, or is promoting the fact that 20% of it's work force is below average. 

Financially the starting pay at Eastman is very competitive with it's peers, but the stagnation happens quickly. If you had taken a job making 15-20K less out of college, you would be reaping the benefits now. Your peers will surpass you with much more upward mobility.

pros:
Results of investments in new technology and platforms is starting to come to fruition.

Focus on building new capabilities in people that will help both the company and the person grow.  

Increased commitment to Inclusion and Diversity.  Starting to see the impact of that work on the culture of the organization in a positive way.
cons: Some people continue to not recognize why the company needs to change to remain competitive and ensure employees have a job to come to.  If we don't change, we won't be successful.

review_title: Hard to believe it's been 25 years.
pros: Seems like just yesterday that I joined the company yet I completed my 25th year this summer.  During that time, I've been given multiple assignments, challenges, and opportunitites to stretch my capabilities. I've been supported, developed and encouraged in each role I've had.  All in all, a great place to spend a career.
cons: Having a global HQ in a small town has some disadvantages in terms of ability to attract and retain talent.  While our matrixed structure ensures multiple perspectives are considered, it does slow down the decision making process.

review_title: Good company now, but heading in the wrong direction
job_title: Manufacturing Chemical Engineer in Kingsport, TN
pros: The company offers competitve wages and benefits with ability to work some flexible work week hours, if need be. The safety culture is top notch and they do what they say when it comes to safety. Eastman is a stable company to work for in your career.
cons: The perforamance evaluation system is preventing fare treatment of their employees and causing moral to decrease among long time LOS employees. The HR policy changs are destroying employee motvation.

review_title: Has exceeded my high expectations at every turn.
pros: Eastman is a fantastic place to work for a variety of reasons.  Salary/Beneifts/Vacation are all good, co-workers and the overall work environment are very pleasant, and opportunities for growth are provided and encouraged by management.  Additionally, Eastman is a place that truly cares about ALL of its stakeholders and this attitude is one that is reinforced from the very top of the organization.  It is a really honor to work for an employer like Eastman.
cons: The only con I have is that corporate headquarters location is a little more rural than I would prefer.  That said, Kingsport (Tri-cities) is still a pleasant area to live (especially if you plan to raise a family).

pros: I have been with the company for nearly 25 years and they have treated me fairly and helped me raise a family. The culture of the folks encourages others to be friendly and helpful to others while maintaining the focus of taking care of the customers.
cons: There seems to be only one area that the company is weak in and I believe the pattern benefits for the entire country seems to be on the slide. Health care benefits just seems to continue to get worse year after year.

review_title: I have worked for Eastman Chemical Company for 38 years. I and am currently a legal assistant in the Legal Department.
pros: I enjoy the work I do.  I have great co-workers.  I enjoy the opportunity to work a flex schedule.
cons: They are continually shrinking benefits for employees.  For example, I was 5 months away from getting six weeks of vacation, and Eastman cut out that option. For retirees after 1/1/2015, one cannot buy life insurance through Eastman - Eastman will give only $10,000 to retirees after this year.

pros: Teamwork and collaboration are emphasized and self-promoting behavior that hurts the team is not tolerated.  Top talent is recruited and expected to live up to the company's legacy of innovation and performance while still allowing for a life outside work.  Kingsport is a great area to live if you like the mountains and outdoor activities.
cons: While it's changing as the company grows, many of the jobs are still based in East Tennessee.  This is not necessarily a negative, but it is not like living in a major urban area  If that's what you want, maybe Eastman is not for you.

review_title: Growth potential at risk by misguided management
pros: Talented employees that want to do the right things, business portfolio has great growth potential, company has unique capabilities and ethical decision making
cons: Poor management practices- action and words do not match, cutting resources in critical areas, very slow wage growth and rate of promotion, higher turnover rate of top talent

pros: Great pay for the area.  The headquarters is also a uniquely located chemical company in a geography with nice weather.
cons: There is a dichotomy at Eastman.  Generally great words come out of leadership at the top but the actions leave you unsatisfied.   It's honestly the worst display of leadership I have seen in my career.   The lack of identifying the root cause of issues and taking swift actions is poisonous to ambitious younger employees.

pros: Adjectives that apply: friendly, happy, positive and old fashioned. Confrontation and dissent are discouraged.  Processes are king, results are an expectation from following the process.  If the results are short of expectations and the process was followed, all is well.
cons: Think 1984's NewSpeak.  The entire organization is expected to use the same script.  Compliance with expectations and achieving targeted results are not enough, employees are expected to be fully "committed".   Problems and failures are not to be discussed -  if the process was followed, all is well in spite of the results.  Reports to the contrary are suppressed and the dissenter reprimanded as behaving too negatively.  One must remember to be friendly at all times.   Location in East TN is completely removed from real world.

pros: Many opportunities to advance and move around. When the economy limps, Eastman weathers the storm every time. Eastman does well becuse of the many different products we make and of course, the people.
cons: Dealing with the many different personalities.

pros: Eastman generally tries to do the right thing ... for the company and for its employees.  Corporate culture is changing and Eastman is changing accordingly, but, in doing so, still strives to maintain a employer-friendly atmosphere..
cons: None to report.  Eastman has been a good employer and it is recognized that, in order to compete in the marketplace and to move to a competitive global company, changes have to be made.  Sometimes, for employees who have been with the company for many years, these changes do not feel good.  But, at least some of the changes are necessary.

review_title: Eastman Chemical provides great job opportunities in a collaborative corporate culture.
pros: A key strength to the Eastman culture is that people focus on moving forward collaboratively. It was a refreshing change to come here and find the internal politics that existed at other companies I'd worked relatively reduced and folks focused on doing what was considered best for the companies success. The Kingsport area is a great place to live if you enjoy outdoors activities (hiking in the Smokies, Appalachian whitewater, etc.).
cons: Eastman's collaboration and process-focused culture can also be a factor that slows down change in the company at times. It seems it can take too much energy to get the company to adapt / adopt new approaches to doing things.

review_title: Enhanced focus on diversity and inclusion
pros:
An enhanced focus on diversity and inclusion is exciting to see! Diversity will further promote innovation and better us as a company. 

Co-workers truly value each other and want to see each other succeed. That is what makes Eastman great!

Great focus on developing leaders that was not previously seen.

Like most companies, work-life balance is what you make it.
cons: Current economic environment the entire industry is facing!

review_title: Good place to enjoy the balance between work and life
pros: EMN has long history and classical corporation culture. It has already transferred from traditional chemical company to special chemical company. It is focusing on innovation area which makes it more successful and develops fast. You can balance your work and life easily here. The compensation is higher than the normal level in the same position in this industry area.
cons: Compared to the company's great success and fast development, the employee's treatment is decreasing. The company continues to hire more and more staff while the welfare is less than before. It's very hard to have promotion and the career development is slower, the job title is lower than the normal level with same functions in this industry area.

review_title: Eastman is a good place to build a career and work with good people
pros:
Highly ethical chemical/manufacturing company
Strong coworkers with high individual standards for the most part
Good relationships between various employee groups from management to first level employees - nonunion environment as a result of these relationships and working environment
HQ in a strong, family-oriented community/region for those interested in that aspect
cons:
Limited movement across sites if that is a strong individual interest
HQ in TriCities TN not attractive for everyone.  If you will only consider location with big city amenities, probably should look elsewher.  We do have significant presence in St. Louis and Pittsburgh

pros: The team I worked with was my family until management started running them off and replacing them with younger employees that really don't know anything. You were expected to train them and they end up taking your job. Oops this was supposed to be a pro.
cons: So many of the reviews have hit the nail on the head. Layoffs are Eastman's answer to cutting costs. Heaven forbid the executive team cut their inflated salaries and travel expenses!! People used to be proud to work for Eastman. Now all anyone wants to do is leave. The school system is the only thing keeping me in the area anymore. I would rather work 2 full-time jobs shoveling manure than go back to Eastman. Treats employees worse than garbage.

pros: Company innovation is solving problems the world needs solved (e.g. circular economy) so a strong purpose; seeing improvements in inclusion and diversity and commitment to employees with more of a focus now in these areas; in the long term the investments in growth along with the reshaping of the business will pay off
cons: Short term financial challenges while trying to make change in the midst of a difficult external environment; change is slow because still a lot of people who want things to stay the way they have been in the past and resist change, and management slow to deal with that

review_title: Well Managed, Ethical Company that is Fair to its Employees
pros: I think Management has done a god job positioning the company so that it can prosper and provide stable employment for the forseeable future.  The company is full of people that want to work and do a good job and the teamwork you see is excellent.  The compensation, both monetary and benefits, combined wih the low cost of living at the Headquarters site provides a vey comfortable life.  The company takes Safety seriously.
cons: The company  places a lot of credence in getting input on decisions and courses of action.  While that can lead to better decisions, it can get frustrating waiting for and getting the input.

pros:
Opportunity to bring my "A" game each day without worrying about typical corporate office "games"
Opportunity for career advancement and/or broadening experiences without moving to a new location.
Great culture!
Externally competitive but internally very collaborative
Opportunities in multiple locations, including OUS
Very close driving distance to multiple larger areas (Charlotte, Atlanta, Nashville, Asheville, etc.)
Opportunity to work on meaningful projects which directly affect bottom line
cons: From my perspective there are no meaningful "cons" to working at Eastman.  Kingsport TN (Tri Cities area) is a great place to live and raise a family.  The Tri Cities area is certainly not Atlanta or Charlotte but the area does have a lot to offer, particularly to those who enjoy outdoor activities like hiking, biking, golf, etc.  That said, if you desire a larger metropolitan area, Kingsport, TN is not that.

review_title: Rewarding, Challenging and great place to work!
pros:
Eastman is very employee oriented. Eastman's core values and leadership principles are all very focussed on self development, peer development and direct reports development.
Eastman supports new ideas and orients employees' with their interests as much as possible. Eastman is a growing company and it believes in its workforce. There is never a wrong person. There can be a wrong role for the person! Eastman manufacturing sites are very good places for new employees as well as experienced employees for advancement and self development. Eastman believes in employee training and education and has several programs to support further education.
cons: Chemical companies in general tend to be in rural areas although this is not much of a problem for me as I like rural places to live in.

review_title: My time at Eastman continues to be challenging and very rewarding.
job_title: Supt Manufacturing Support in Kingsport, TN
pros: Eastman has remedous group of employees that work very well together to get the job done. The company recognizes the outstanding work of its employees, is working to improve the well being of its employee through its Wellness program, has improved is support of the balance of work and family, and supports the local communities that it is located in.
cons: I do not see any real downsides at working for Eastman. Many of the locations are in not in metropolatin area so some individuals may not like the areas they would be living in. This has actually been apositive

pros: The company is very supportive of its employees. The culture is built around safety and a commitment to excellence. The training is second to none. The company is also very supportive of the surrounding communities. The employees are hardworking and dedicated to producing high quality goods. The Executive Team at Eastman Chemical promotes a culture of respect and accountability. This respect is funneled down to the first line supervisors and their entry level employees. Overall it has been a very rewarding career.
cons: The economy has put a strain on the company's budget and has limited the employees benefits. The bottom line has to be met, but at what cost to the employees. I have only recently been concerned about the direction of our companies benefit package. I am still grateful for my job at Eastman.

review_title: A Positive, Engaging place to work.
pros: Eastman is a great place to be.  Our safety culture, our people, and the interesting and challenging things that we get to be a part of every day make it an exciting and fun place to work.  Plus - Eastman values my work / life balance as well.  I have a good amount of flexibility and great benefits.
cons: As with any large company, there can be some bureaucracy and red tape to navigate through at times.

job_title: Chemical Engineer, Entry Level II in Kingsport, TN
pros: Eastman is a wonderful company that cares for family values, and is headed in the right direction. Opportunities in the company are great, but you have to be willing to look for them and take control of your career. Don't expect anyone to hand you your next promotion.
cons: HR is not very effective, often hiring the wrong types of employees, and do a very poor job at incentivizing the younger generation. Talent retention at the company is low, with lots of younger people leaving to find companies that pay them what they are worth.

pros: The strategy to develop into a specialty chemical company makes Eastman an extremely exciting place to work.  Every business team supports a balance of productivity and growth initiatives and focus to deliver results.  The people are talented and work with sense of urgency.  I really like working in the technology organization at Eastman.
cons: There are some of the usual big company issues at Eastman; specifically, the two biggest complaints are some activities can be process heavy and decision making can sometimes be slow.  People need to develop some process knowledge and political savvy to get things done or they become very frustrated.

review_title: Great company, but too many changes in too short of time
job_title: Process Improvement Engineer in Kingsport, TN
pros: Large company with a lot of different processes. Enough work to keep someone busy for an entire career. Plenty of advancement opportunities. Comparable compensation. Collaborative work environment.
cons: Shifted from commodity chemical company to specialty chemical company resulted in successive rounds of layoffs to hit specialty "growth rate". Company became more corporate like after Costa took over, less about the people that make it happen and more about just money. Only way to move out of a bad fitting job is to over perform, but you are more likely to be discouraged and underperform in that situation.

pros: Very high quality organisation. Management attracts good people and is able to get the best out of them. Very good work ethics. Very strong supply chain, confirmed by customers. Good tools to work with: hardware, software. People tend to stay for a very long time with the company and are usually very motivated.
cons: Some jobs are being rotated very quickly internally. This means you are dealing with changing people in those jobs. The other thing is that the company culture is rather towards executing known paths forward instead of taking risks into new opportunities. So innovation and entrepreneurial behaviour is a challenge.

pros:
-Personal development opportunities abound
-Most employees are intelligent and fun to work with
-Low-to-mid-level managers care about their people, in general
-Many different career paths to pursue in the same company
cons:
-Executive team has suspended raises and promotions despite 6 years of earnings growth
-Executive team continues to take home more money year over year
-Executive team is paying double-digit dividend increases despite suspending raises
-Executive team has cut HR spend year over year for several years despite continuing earnings growth
-Excessive cost cutting has led to poor morale and employees that are not engaged
-The future looks bleak at the company because the executives seem to care more about their own wants than the needs of their employees or customers
-Decisions are made too slowly
-Providing criticism to upper management is heavily frowned upon
-Fewer employees means more work to do when we are already understaffed, and excessive cost cutting prevents new hires
-Company leadership is leaning more heavily on older practices in tough times rather than trying to evolve with the times

Eastman is not without its positives, no doubt, but the leadership team is of a singular mind - the stockholders are the most important part of this company, to the detriment of its customers, and especially to the detriment of its employees. The focus on more growth and more money no matter the cost is driving top talent to look elsewhere for career opportunities.

pros: It is a prestigious company with a good standing in the community that offers slightly above average pay and good  benefits and  perks.
cons:
Somewhere in the last 10-15 years Eastman Chemical has abandoned its core principles of decent employee relations and the fair and ethical treatment of its longer-tenured employee base.
There was a time when experience was rewarded with advancement and opportunity.  That has all changed.  A college degree - regardless of the intelligence of the person with the diploma, is regarded more highly than years and years of hard work and struggle for the person who established the process and sacrificed the pain to develop it.
Thousands of years of practical and logical experience is being cast aside for lofty catchphrases, excitable ideas that have no power and a group of people who know what to say - at just the right time and to the right people.  Everything seems perfect on the surface - but the work ethic has been replaced with ideas that never reach action.
If you have a certain degree from an honored institution - you are a deity.  If you have 20 years experience and know every intricate nuance of the business you become secondary and expendable.  Education does not necessary equal intelligence and a diploma cannot bestow character.  There is no magic in a degree.
If you share the last name of a director - you are immediately placed on the fast track straight out of college and if you don't thrive you are quickly put into a lesser more protected role where you can 'hide' from the real work and weather the storms of cutbacks because of 'who' you are - not how well you work.  And then those around you - who filled in your gaps when you struggled - will be the ones who will be asked to give the ultimate sacrifices.
Nothing is ever totally fair - that is a reality.  But slowly over time what is being realized with the shortfalls that my company has suffered in the last 10-15 years is a slow erosion of the knowledge base that once made this company a joy to work for.
In time - the culture will evolve to correct itself or the company will adopt this new culture as the norm.  But as this struggle ensues and the core principles change - productivity and profits will suffer.  Kaizen is a wonderful things and change is inevitable but there is an immeasurable worth to hand-on experience.  Of course it can be replaced - but if it is not revered, respected and preserved, the value will always be diminished.

job_title: Entry Level Chemical Engineer in Kingsport, TN
pros: Paid a lot more than average, especially considering the location. Not expected to work over 40 hours per week and work/life balance is valued. Couldn't find better people to work with and I really like Kingsport and Johnson City. Eastman is doing some really exciting and innovative stuff to help solve the plastic crisis our generation is facing.
cons: Upper UPPER management values shareholder earnings over continuous improvement and employee salaries (raises have been delayed 2 years in a row to meet cash flow goals). However, safety is not compromised, which is nice.

review_title: Solid company with some room for improvement
pros:
The culture is very team-oriented - I don't feel like I would be manipulated for someone else to gain an advantage.

Benefits are good. Pay is in line with national averages.

Independent work environment allows me to solve problems in my own way, but there is enough structure to prevent total disorganization.
cons: Leadership can be slow to make decisions. Some HR policies are dated, leading to low performers hanging around and high performers not being rewarded as much as management would like.

pros: Eastman cares about its employees & the local community.  Upper management very approachable.  Will not hire folks strictly on the basis of their expertise, they must also have people skills.  If someone is put into a position of managing people and they aren't good at it, they will move them out of that position & find something more suitable for them.  Team members are heard and don't have to endure supervisors who are not good managers of people.  If an effort is shelved, they try really hard to find positions for folks that are displaced.
cons: Movements within the company seem to be kept secret even from the folks moving into new positions, sometimes until a few minutes before it is announced which seems rather odd to me.

job_title: Process Engineer in Saint Louis, MO
pros:
*Laid-back environment
*Helpful and supportive co-workers
*Excellent work/life balance
*Engaging work and projects
*New ideas and original thinking is encouraged
*Family atmosphere at work
cons: There is very little I can say that is negative about Eastman Chemical that would not be true of other companies.  The significant amount of documentation and paperwork associated with every project is my biggest complaint.  This sometimes makes it difficult to get projects started and finished. However, there is never someone that stands in the way of a project because it pushes the boundaries or attempts something new as long as it does not cause unreasonable safety concerns.  I had trouble getting my feet underneath me when I first started because the training program was not finished, but it has been a work in progress and is getting better.

review_title: A great place to learn and grow!
pros: A strong committment to training people to improve productivity and effectiveness in current roles as well as prepare for future rolls. I've been exposed to more training opportunities in the last 15 months versus prior 10 years in heritage Solutia.There is also a lot of exertise and capabilties (narrow and deep) within the company that we can tapped which is great in supporting a business.
cons: In some areas, the work pace and decision-making is slower than in a smaller company environment. There are also some areas where I see regional strategies being developed which may be sub-optimal versus if more holistic global strategies were developed with regional implementation.

review_title: Great place to work with life-balance and personal health culture that includes recognition for going above and beyond.
pros: Schedule flexibility and opportunity for growth. Great performance management process.   Work-life balance and personal health culture is emphasized and supported by on-site health facilities and management support.  Ethical decisions are supported by upper management.  Recognition for going above and beyond regular job duties.
cons: Sometimes lack of specific job training due to lack of training support in certain areas.   There are very few Cons to speak of.

pros: Eastman provides a friendly atmosphere full of great people to work with.  Multiple gyms, fitness classes, and cafeterias inside the company perimeters are convenient options.  Eastman is a large, complex organization which offers opportunities to continuously learn and grow as a professional either as a technical expert in a specific area or an overall expert with a broader focus.  Employee town halls, corporate communications, and other opportunities to gain insight into activities going on throughout the entire company makes it an exciting place to work and one to be proud of.
cons: The company has been going through a lot of growth in the last several years which comes with new challenges and higher stress levels.  Employees are constantly challenged to do more with less and find ways to be more productive.

review_title: A company committed to innovation and valuing its people
pros: Eastman is a place where everyone can contribute fully and feel a sense of belonging, which allows Eastman to win in both the workplace and the marketplace.  The company creates a culture of inclusion that inspires innovation, encourages respect and enables contributions at the highest level.
cons: Economic challenges in our industry are creating some near term challenges for our industry, not just Eastman.  I am confident Eastman will find the way to balance addressing short term challenges without sacrificing long term sustainable growth.

review_title: Employer that looks out for employees & investors with headquarters in Kingsport TN.  What is Eastman Chemical Company ?
job_title: Integrated Global Supply Chain in Kingsport, TN
pros:
Challenging work environment with a commitment to growth in individuals and the business.
Have achieved year over year increase in earning for past 3 years and working toward this for 2013.  Employees are rewarded for meeting and exceeding annual goals.  Safety at work is a priority for all employees and this mindset spills over to our lives outside of the work environment.
Short, easy commutes to work with little traffic.
cons: Small regional airport and rural communities -- personally I like this but those who are looking for a metropolitan area would see this as a Con.   Shopping in the Tri-Cities area will not offer the variety available in a larger or metropolitan area.

review_title: Eastman is a place for a 40 year career without regrets
pros: The culture is collaborative, team oriented, and caring.  People stay for the quality of the work environment and the large variety of opportunities.  The company is extraordinarily ethical and rewards people who stand up for doing the right thing.  Unlike some other chemical companies, there is an emphasis on technology investment.  Compensation is average, but cost of living in our largest locations is very low.
cons: Collaborative culture can make for slow decision-making.  Career orientation and loyalty means that advancement can be slow also, but that is a price for long-term commitments.

review_title: Great first impression that has not tarnished over time.
job_title: Process Improvement Engineer in Longview, TX
pros: Eastman has worked hard to foster an inclusive environment for their employees.  There is a strong emphasis on team work, but the individual is not forgotten in the process.  There are numerous opportunities for training, growth and advancement without giving up your family in the process.
cons: As with a lot of big companies, there does seem to be some duplication of recordkeeping activities and paperwork that can be frustrating.  However, this is gaining some recognition at higher levels and it appears that some efforts may be underway to address some of the duplication.

pros:
- Management team that is looking to sustain the enterprise for the long-run
- Strong focus on safety 
- Highly ethical culture
- High responsibility theme running throughout the employee base
- Very strong culture oriented toward winning as a team
- Gaining traction on remaking the company as a specialty growth engine with less dependence upon filter tow
cons: - The emotional bank account of employees with regard to willingness to give discretionary time and effort for the good of the company has historically been extremely high.     There have been a lot of withdrawals in the form of intensity and pace of work over a pretty long period of time.

pros: Great  company culture and values that recognizes the importance of safety, wellness, inclusion, and employee collaboration.   Strategic direction greatly improved in recent years with strong momentum in many areas.  Diverse opportunities for career development in both technical and business roles.
cons: Company culture and behaviors still tend to be headquarter centric, although recent changes in organization and structure and expansion through acquisition have greatly helped vs. 5-10 years ago.

review_title: Eastman is a company that not only cares about the success of the company, but also the success of it's employees.
pros:
Eastman overall makes a sincere effort to provide a work/life balance for employees.
Eastman provides a very fair and competitive salary and benefit package to employees.
Eastman makes very frequent and sincere efforts to make sure employees understand the company's strategies, missions, and visions.
cons: I think Eastman's workforce might not be as diverse as other similarly sized companies due to the fact that their global headquarters is located in a smaller metropolitan area; however I do think that Eastman has made a big effort in the recent past to recruit people from outside the industry and emphasize education and diversity in the company so this is something that is improving.

review_title: Eastman is extremely team oriented and strives to enable every employee to perform at the top of their capabilities.
job_title: Process Improvement Engineer in Longview, TX
pros: The work culture. Eastman understands and values teamwork and listens to it's employees wants and desires. It puts family first and is very flexible with work schedules to meet the needs of each individual. They enable each employee to perform at the top of their capabilities and drive employees to continue learning and widen their experience base.
cons: Biggest downside is that it seems all of the focus is on Kingsport. Longview is a very large site and is currently hiring more and more young engineers. It would be nice to invest some money in the infrastructure much like they have committed to do in Kingsport.

pros: Kingsport is a quiet town and close to the mountains.  A good place to live if you like the outdoors.  The cost of living is reasonable.  Some departments have decent co-workers that are great to work with.
cons: Health care benefits with Cigna are frustrating.  "In network" is only half the doctors and half the hospitals in the area.  If you live in Johnson City, you have to go to Kingsport or Bristol to go to the hospital.  No sign of Cigna working things out with MSHA (the other half of the doctors and the hospitals).  With high deductable health plans, we should be able to go to any doctor or hospital.

pros: Most team members genuinely care about each other.  Very collaborative and friendly culture. Many strong VP's and directors give hope for a better future executive team.  A very well intended workforce who wants the company to succeed. Strong portfolio of products makes company viability seem strong.
cons:
Top leadership (CEO and most executive team members) are seen as out of touch, very Wall Street oriented, and in it for themselves.  Whether fair or not this is blamed on the CEO who wont live in Kingsport (our headquarters).  The CEO took over a $3 million raise at a time when all promotions were held and significant cuts were being made across the company.  The CEO is seen as in it for himself, most feel he'll be gone in a couple more years, and would probably already have been gone if the company had performed better the last few years. 

Work/life balance was a strength at the company but now that is a thing of the past.  Lots of stress and overworked team members due to labor cuts and refusal to increase headcount.  Difficult matrix organization to navigate makes it challenging for newer employees to understand where they are going.  A 'career framework' was going to be rolled out to help but that was cut due to all the cost savings (again why do executives get such large increases under these circumstances).  This was one of the best places to work, that is no longer the case.

review_title: Eastman is a World Class Organization
pros:
Total commitment to Safety
Excellent Benefits
Very competitive salaries
A world leader in several product lines
A strong focus on quality
Efficient productivity without sacrificing Safety or Quality
Honest and sincere people make the difference
This organization makes aggressive yet calculated decisions on growth and opportunity Always focused on the future and never complacent
Commitment to diversity and attaining top talent
Is invested not only in their workforce, but the community it resides in
Operates with a "Green" mindset and sets a standard for Chemical Companies
cons: None for me. I love working for Eastman. If you are someone who prefers to work close to a Major Metropolitan area your options are limited, but the communities where we work are all optimal for families.

review_title: Eastman is a great place to work.  However, if you are in the sales environment, promotions and raises do not come easy.
pros: Great people, great benefits, great understanding of work and life balance, believes in the "family message", variable compensation bonus plan,
cons: average or slightly lower pay, you must be "in the club" for promotions-not always performance based.  Frequent restructing within leadership team. A little rigid in their old ways of doing things and sometimes too worried about "the numbers" as most publicaly traded companies are.  Unfortantely, that sometimes sacrafices business relationships and may hurt overall growth in the long run.

review_title: I enjoy working for Eastman they are a very good company to work for, it's like everyone pulls together to meet goals.
job_title: Fire Maintenance Specialist in Kingsport, TN
pros: Benefits, vacation time, holiday pay and they train you before turning you loose to do your job. They make sure to have the best wa of doing your job. If you need special tools to do a job or training they will see to it that you get it. Also, Kingsport is a great place to live because of Eastman Chemicals commendment to the community.
cons: The company handing our health care isn't very good.

pros: Great people, good salary, and did I mention the people?  Eastman is located in smaller cities which is great for people who did not grow up in a major metropolitan area.
cons: They seem to be moving away from a teamwork culture and to a more individual performance based culture.  There is also a lot of politicing that goes on in some divisions within the company but I suspect it is that way in every company.

review_title: A strong culture of teamwork & dedication to achieve company goals exists at Eastman with many opportunities for growth.
pros: Eastman provides many tools to help you succeed including multiple training courses and opportuniites to suggest new courses where needed. The experience of the  technical staff at Eastman is vast and will help drive success for future product development. Flexible schedules are common with the expectation you will get the job done. I can't say enough about the willingness of people to help you succeed. It really is a team effort where projects are involved. Everyone works together to make new ideas and projects be successful.
cons: Starting in 2015, everyone will change to high-deductible healthcare plans. The high-deductible plans, although a normal part of benefits for most companies now, are often more costly with less patient benefits.

pros: As a fairly new employee and recent college graduate, I can say with enthusiasm that the transition from undergrad to full-time employment with Eastman could not have been easier. The culture is friendly and welcoming - it is difficult to describe to someone who hasn't experienced it firsthand. The work is exciting and challenging and I've been given opportunities as a new employee that I could never have expected. Eastman is an awesome company and I look forward to many years of challenging, innovative experience.
cons: Upfront onboarding/training could be more relevant and could be more appropriate in terms of timing. For example, some of the training required for me to be able to do parts of my job was a month or two after my initial hire date.

review_title: I cannot imagine a better place to work!
job_title: Advanced Research Scientist in Kingsport, TN
pros: The company culture is one of positivity and proactivity, whether it is about your work life or your personal life.  It's not just a culture that is mandated down from management, you can really feel that it comes from the bottom up, and you only get that feeling when everyone around you loves what they do.
cons: Like many companies, Eastman hired fewer people during the great recession, and with recent successes they have been hiring a lot of new, young employees. This has lead to a significant age gap, and this can occasionally lead to friction.  This is an issue that I do not think is unique to Eastman, and it is something that everyone is aware of and works to improve

pros: I respect and enjoy my coworkers and the technical work i am asked to perform.  I do not have to travel an excessive amount
cons: Ranking system for employees is demotivating and hurtful for most employees.  An attempt to 'drive performance' using this ranking system has resulted in disengagement of employees and to limit discretionary effort.

review_title: Winning company strategy, closer to markets and customers globally
pros: Eastman has been going through a lot of change over the past years and has become less of the conservative family company it once was, and more of the innovation driver that customers need. The collaborative culture is still there, which is good. Decision making is getting faster. Proud to be part of this company that is getting better, faster and more global.
cons: Some will say that the performance rating system is bad. I’d argue that it’s the best way to ensure everyone is getting feedback..... no real cons for me

review_title: Perfect balance between 'totally employee focused' yet willing to make tough decisions.
pros:
A medium sized company growing to become a large company, while retaining the benefits and thinking found in small companies.
Eastman's strength is in it's people...professional, hard working, smart, capable, resolute, can-do, make-it-happen attitudes.
Products that are highly desirable in the marketplace.
cons: Some of the pains that come with growth.  Too much good work to be done, have to make choices to let some of the good stuff go.

review_title: A well-run company that values work and family life balance.
job_title: Manager, Six Sigma and Process Excellence in Kingsport, TN
pros:
Able to attract excellent employees and put their skills to use.
An excellent culture. Extremely ethical with a balanced view of customers, community and employee stakeholders.
People are willing to put in the extra effort when necessary, because we can all tell what is important.
Senior management is very capable and successfully executing a vision to transition the company from being a commodity chemical company to a specialty company.
A bonus system that effectively engages all employees in the success of the company.
cons:
Key sites are in small towns, so prospective employees need to consider such
Having to learn to take more market risks to succeed in the specialty space

review_title: Eastman cares for it's Employees and the Community!
job_title: Business Organization Specialist in Kingsport, TN
pros: I've been with Eastman for 5 years and I have to say they have been wonderful to work for.  As things shifted with the economy my original position with the company was terminated after 16 months.  However, immediately following the news of my position being terminated I was informed I needed to go meet my new boss in 20 minutes.  My supervision found me a new job within the plant.  Eastman strives for growth for its employees.  Eastman is also very involved within our community...we are FAMILY.
cons: I haven't really experienced any downside to working with Eastman.  If I had to share a con I guess it would have to be...nothing!

review_title: Eastman likes to dictate to its employees what their career path shall be and has no true leadership.
pros: Some people are truly a joy and privilege to work with.  There are also some very smart people who've solved very difficult problems.
cons: Some people do not have the necessary qualifications for their position.  There is a lack of communication between business units.  Those in leadership roles are weak and the company generally does not accept best practices from outside sources such as professional organizations.

review_title: My scepticism proved wrong - the Eastman team is the key
pros: Though Eastman has been going thru several acquisitions recently putting extra work on many employees, they remain open, friendly and always willing to help. Management sets the tone and repeatedly emphasizes importance of Safety & Wellbeing in addition to other Core Values. Strategy of the Company is well communicated and there are plenty exciting job opportunities.
cons: Eastman is located in North-East Tennessee with limited access to small, family owned restaurants and entertainment opportunities you are used to from a bigger city. However, the approximity to the Smokies, the beach and many historical places is awesome for outdoor activities and travels.

pros:
Job security
Annual raises/bonuses
There are some really great people to work with and build lasting relationships with
Great managers
Contribution to the company (United Way, etc)
cons:
1. Location: the company loses the potential for amazing talent because of its location.  It's great for people who already have families but young, sharp professionals who come out here won't like it.  If you're in sales, it might not be too bad because once you've completed your first year here you work from your home office.  There's also a lack of diversity because of its location in a predominantly Caucasian area.

2. Pay an arm and a leg for insurance and still get a bill

3. If you come in as an non-exempt employee who plans on moving into an exempt role soon, you're on your own.  It would be fine if this were the case for all employees but it isn't.
