Exempts are moved into positions regularly without having to look at the career site and their managers work together to make these transitions occur as quickly as possible.  So if you're someone who has a lot of ambition and wants to keep growing in your career, do not come in as a non-exempt employee and think it will be easier.  It won't.

Two other things that demonstrates the divide between non-exempts and exempts are:
      You're told you will be able to apply for tuition reimbursement after working for the company a year but it doesn't end there.  You MUST be an exempt employee to get it.  If you're a non-exempt employee, you will pay that tuition out of pocket.

      There are also networking groups that meet frequently for luncheons and dinners where the eligibility depends on your exempt or non-exempt status.

review_title: Strong company with healthy growth platform
job_title: Marketing Communications Manager in Kingsport, TN
pros: Eastman is really a great place to work. The people are caring - both about the work and about each other. The corporate leadership is doing a good job of improving bottom line results year after year despite economic challenges globally.
cons: Worst con I can think of is that Eastman - like a lot of other companies - overvalues external job candidates when it comes to competing for job openings. Internal candidates tend to be either overlooked, or if they get the job, are not paid as well as an external candidate would be. It can be frustrating.

review_title: Eastman Chemical is a wonderful place to work.
pros: There are many exciting opportunities at Eastman. Eastman is in a state of high growth. We have a very diverse product portfolio enabling us to serve many markets in a positive manner.
cons: Would like to see more cross functional assignments, and faster opportunities for salary and position growth for top performers.

review_title: Eastman Chemical Company provides a healthy, safe work environment.
pros: There are many pros to working at Eastman Chemical Company. This company offers voluntary classes in work styles, ways to improve your time management, and increase your effectiveness. We are enabled to live a healthy lifestyle through providing improved nutrition in our cafeteria, on site fitness centers, and encouraged safety in the workplace and at home. On top of all that the Eastman headquarters are in a small town with good quality of life, strong community environment, and low cost of living.
cons: I would say that my only "con" would be lack of a bus system between the buildings since our campus is rather large. This really isn't a problem though since you can easily drive from one area to another.

review_title: Eastman is a very Family Oriented Company!
job_title: Integrated Global Supply Chain in Kingsport, TN
pros: Eastman is family oriented and has a very caring environment.  Eastman achieves exceptional business results yet employees can still strike a healthy work/life balance.  Plus, I love the location.  I really like the small town feel of Kingsport which has plenty of amenities to meet most of my needs. The people at Eastman and in Kingsport are friendly and helpful.
cons: While there are plenty of career opportunities, the movement to new assignments can sometimes be delayed.  There is succession planning, but there seems to be a shortage of people to fill some assignments.

review_title: Great company that helps you achieve your career goals while offering great compensation and benefits.
pros: I love the normally flexible work schedule. I never have to worry about having Dr. appointments or personal emergencies. They offer so many growth opportunities & they offer classes to help you learn more. I feel challenged but not overwhelmed.
cons:
The corporate hierarchy can be a challenge at times but that's just corporate life unspecific to Eastman. 
I've recieved conflicting information regarding my performance which can be stressful & leaves me feeling confused.

pros: Most of the employees at Eastman are good to work with. The atmosphere is generally positive and upbeat. The company culture is good. Pay is competitive for the local region. There are generally opportunities for strong performers to excel.
cons: The ranking at rating system implemented by Eastman a few years ago is an overall hurt to employee morale. Within a predefined circle, employees are ranked, and someone will always end up at the bottom, with corresponding pay and bonus penalties. This particular aspect of the company feels like it's moving backwards rather than forwards.

review_title: Eastman has provided me with wonderful professional opportunities and intelligent, collegial co-workers.
pros:
Abundant opportunities for growth to those employees who work hard, get along with others and deliver results.

A professional environment with a strong commitment to principled behavior.

Collegial co-workers who, generally, want to work hard and do a good job for the company, without drawing attention to themselves.  A team environment. 

An executive team that does not rest on its laurels, but keeps its eyes on the medium-term horizon.
cons:
We need greater diversity of thought and of cultures.  

We need greater tolerance for diversity of thought.

review_title: Challenging, collaborative environment with some of the most intelligent people I have ever worked with.
job_title: Market Insight and Strategy Manager in Kingsport, TN
pros: Eastman has an atmosphere of collaboration and critical thinking.  Most people are sincere about being hepful in the spirit of everyone being successful.
cons: At times, too much collaborative decision making can slow down the work.  Also, employees that have been around a while need to do better to embrace those that work offsite.  The attitude towards needing "face time" in order to get work done needs to TOTALLY go away if the company is to continue success.

review_title: Great Place to Live and Even Better Place to Work!!!!
pros: Great atmosphere to live and work with usually a great work/life balance.  Eastman has very competitive salary and benefits relative to the cost of living at most of their sites and offices. Its great to be part of a company that embraces safety and growth at the same time.  Overall, a fantastic leadership team and colleagues!!
cons: Great place to live but still lacking with the mainstream places to eat and shop.  Still many employees that do not embrace change.

review_title: Great company to work with, with an even greater future ahead
pros: Been working for Eastman more than 20 years. Certainly things are different from when the Kodak age however the company has evolved in a different entity with a more global focus and more diverse in nature. Can't be wrong on staying longer at Eastman and welcoming new colleagues.
cons: Few. Sometime progression is slow, especially when you have worked longer years. Eventually someone recognizes the value you bring and the contributions you make.

pros: Fantastic co-workers, great schedule
cons:
•Pay is below average for the work
•Benefits are dwindling down to nothing 
•Morale is at all-time low
•Diversity is feared by operations personnel because it increases the likelihood of HR issues. Investigations are frequent and a show of force by the legal team, which contributes to a collective disdain for diversity on shift; it's considered too much of a headache.

review_title: Eastman is meeting the challenges in the future!
pros: Solid company and I feel can withstand any future down turns in economy.
cons: Benefits package has cut employees salary from between $3,000 - $10,000 annual.  This is due to the out of pocket medical dedutible.  In my opinion this will be considered in Eastman's recruiting efforts.  Also, this sum might not have as much impact on larger salaries but to a general laborer or business support person this has great impact.

review_title: A successful culture built on people who are the best in the world at what they do
pros: In addition to being a great culture where people treat one another with respect yet hold each other accountable, Eastman is a company where people feel the obligation to leave the company in better shape than they found it for the next generation.
cons: The main area that comes up is location. However,  the very low regretable turnover proves that location in the end turns out to be a retention tool. The low cost of living, low crime rate and the opportunity for great work-life balance create a strong reason for people to stay once they join.

review_title: Eastman - a great place to work!
job_title: Senior Technology and Business Research Specialist in Kingsport, TN
pros: The company is devoted to developing a well trained staff.  They want to give you the opportunity to be the best you can be.  However, safety is their #1 focus . . . they care about their employees.  Very diverse personnel -- and the trend has been moving into management areas over the past several years.  Also, Kingsport is a great place to raise a family and is in a beautiful part of the country.  If I knew then (when I was hired) what I know now, I wouldn't change a thing.
cons:
Getting to Kingsport can be difficult.  We have a small airport,   
and air travel usually involves coming through Atlanta or Charlotte.

pros: Lots of great people work here.  There is a real sense of community.  The people I work with are great people and really good at what they do.
cons: Interesting counter-intuitive culture.  Cubicles, but in some cases people are expected to work without bothering or even collaborating.  Drive to push innovation and productivity but then discouraging the business to take a step back and analyze pain points.  We are often too busy to improve.

pros:
Eastman treats its employees wonderfully, and because of its location in NE Tennessee, salaries go further than they would elsewhere.

Opportunities to move around Eastman (either in other job roles or other countries) present themselves often to those who are looking. One has to try if they want to stay stagnant at the same job for years.

Safety is definitely number 1 at Eastman. It is rare that an employee gets seriously injured (besides the too often slip and fall accident from not watching where you are walking)
cons: The only con I can think of is the location. The tricities doesn't have much by way of entertainment unless you want to get outdoors. But if you are looking for a city atmosphere, you are out of luck.

review_title: Highly talented and motivated workforce, where you can make a difference in your job.
pros: Strong work ethic, very skilled workforce, opportunity to have many different kinds of assignments that are both challenging and rewarding. Safety and customer service are top priorities.  Low cost of living in Kingsport, TN and competitive salaries.
cons: A more conservative work culture with a history of only hiring employees out of college versus from other companies. Kingsport can feel small to someone who is used to a big city life and broad social outlets.

review_title: Eastman is a fantastic place to work and succeed
job_title: Senior Administrative Assistant in Kingsport, TN
pros:
We have 10 paid holidays and a personal day that was recently added & vacation given on a fair basis.
The Company values me as an employee and allows me to lead as well as contribute.
A family atmosphere where others truly care about what happens to you.
cons: More concentration could be focused on non-exempt promotions and career ladder.  We are all a part of the same Company attempting to make it grow & succeed.  It just seems like non-exempt employees are at times treated like the "red-headed step child".

review_title: Good people, good work-life balance, good company outlook.
pros: The company is full of folks worth making friends with and who will freely offer their time to work with you. The culture is not one based on competition, ends-justify-the-means, etc. Management doesn't expect you to live at work, though the realities of working in a chemical plant means that there are occasional demands to work outside of your routine schedule.
cons: The company has a bimodal age distribution with most of the management much older. This is changing and provides opportunities as those individuals retired, but does result in a slow-to-change culture that can sometimes be frustrating. Most Eastman sites aren't located in major metropolitan areas so if that's important to you Eastman may not be a good fit.

review_title: The future for a great global company to work for.
pros: The opportuntiy to have personal and professional growth, have exposure and contibute with a diversify community. The company treats employees farly and provide professional opportunities. The change to embrace new cultures, diveristy and strong team work!! New CEO, more changes for a great place to work!
cons: Sometimes getting out of the comfort zone is a challenge for people. In my opinion, you will always have cons in a company but it also depends in you if you want to make the difference and work hard to obtain what you expect in your professional life.

review_title: Good pay,  stress level high, morale low.
pros: Eastman pays well. Small town environment, which is great! Fitness centers and a recreation department is nice. Very good school system.
cons: Stress level is very high, and morale is low. Shift workers have no family life because we have work all the time. Getting  more dangerous because of the work load and processes that we have to watch with less people. Pushing equipment past the limit that they were designed.

pros: Eastman allows you to continue learning throughout your career. I have worked for Eastman for more than 30 years and every day of my career has been different. Eastman allows you to follow your passion and play to your strengths. I have worked in many different jobs, at many different sites  and have traveled around the world.
cons: Eastman hires the best employees and expects results and certain behaviors from their employees. You have to be smart, collaborative, responsible, adaptable and have a bias for action.

review_title: Overall a great place to work
pros: Eastman  has a great culture.  Work/Family balance is promoted and supported.  The location for corporate HQ provides a short commute to work in a beautiful part of the country.  The company has been very successful over the past few years which has made the morale generally high.  Eastman employees tend to be very good, hardworking people.
cons: While the company is growing and management has seen turnover, there is still some "old-school" mentality around, which can cause tension with younger employees who are looking to advance quickly or make decisions quickly.

review_title: Highly ethical company with a strong growth strategy.
pros: Opportunities to work with committed, passionant, capable co-workers.  Also, Eastman is in the midst of executing on a strong growth strategy so new opportunities are frequently available.  Most businesses and functions are centralized in East TN which offers a low cost of living, good schools, great outdoor recreational opportunities, and close proximity to larger cities like Knoxville, Charlotte, Nashville, and Atlanta.
cons: If you desire to live in a big city atmosphere then your opportunities within Eastman Chemical will be limited.  Also, company provided benefits (e.g. health care, vacation) are "middle of the pack" when compared with other companies.

review_title: Company to invest large part of your career life
pros:
intellectually challenging environment, employee friendly- Eastman truly cares, lots of exciting career opportunities which can span across various functions-  for e.g. it is not uncommon from someone within IT to progress in innovation or product management. 

if based out of Kingsport, Tenneessee - one cannot but appreciate great year around weather!
cons: headquartered in a small place called Kingsport- so less options for dining, nightlife, shopping. if you choose to join the company be prepared for long drives during weekends to Atlanta and Charlotte. On the contrary, if you like outdoor activities (lakes, mountains) this is the place to be.

job_title: Global Supply Chain Intern in Knoxville, TN
pros: Great mentor and supervisor, very motivational and helpful work environment, interesting project work.  I loved the culture here!  The intern program is very well established with lots of opportunities for socialization- I made so many good friends this summer.
cons: I rarely had a full 40 hours worth of work each week, so when I was bored or idle I often had to seek out work in other areas.  However, that turned out to be a good thing because I was exposed to more of the supply chain

pros: Super people who are always willing to help, wide variety of positions available at headquarters site without having to relocate, wide variety of equipment and processes to keep technical professionals interested for a whole career, new engineers have interesting work and responsibilities right away, beautiful locations, great community relations.
cons: Advancement is relatively slow.  This isn't the job for you, if you want to rocket up the ladder.

pros: The culture at Eastman is unlike any other. Eastman does a phenomenal job of recruiting and retaining world class talent, which in my opinion is largely a result of the culture. Employees deliver strong performance and exert maximum effort to achieve their objectives, not to serve themselves only, but to make a meaningful contribution to the growth of the company.
cons: The company headquarters is located in a rural area, which may not be fit for all. However, the company has multiple manufacturing and sales sites dispersed throughout the United States. Outside of US opportunities exist as well.

review_title: Good place to work in East TN
pros: Best place to work in the area - Benefits are pretty good - Pay is best in the area - Growing company with exciting plans to grow in the future - doing very well as a chemical company right now - good communication and openness with employees on future plans and goals of the company
cons: Best place to work in area... if you want a similar job with comparable benefits and pay you'd have to relocate.  Reclassifications/promotions/recognition do not always seem fair across the board.  IT sometimes seems to be the forgotten or unrecognized group in the company.  IT over the past few years has cut a great deal of budget but the workload has increased

review_title: One fo the few lifetime Career Companies left in the US
pros: Eastman Chemical Company truely cares for its employees and balances the need for a profitable business with the need to provide for its employees.   Eastmans benefits and compensation package in whole is one of the best in the nation.   Work at Eastman is always challenging yet rewarding.  Resources needed are usually available and Eastman has some of the most innovative yet practical employees I have ever seen.  Great teamwork throughout the entire company.
cons: The larger the company gets, the more difficult it is to expand the great culture at heratige Eastman across all of the newer Eastman locations and organizations.

review_title: Eastman is the best place I have ever worked.
pros:
Exceptional leadership by senior management, especially through down periods in the business cycle, that positioned Eastman for great growth opportunities.
Ethical and cooperative behavior is expected and demonstrated throughout the Eastman culture.
Diverse opportunities exist within the company for those who want to advance and are willing to work for it; one doesn't need to search outside the company for growth opportunities.
cons: The advancing speed of business, push for quicker returns, and overall doing more with less increases the difficulty to maintain a healthy balance between work and family life. This is certainly not unique to Eastman.

pros:
People are the backbone of Eastman. I have never worked with more pleasant, open and warm people than at Eastman. The workforce is diverse and we pride ourselves in highly ethical and "all in for safety" behaviors. Beyond that the business model and Eastman's products are outstanding.

I love Project Inspire and how employees are taken on board to participate.
cons: As in any company of the size of Eastman the organizational hierarchies slow the decision making process and are very complex. Sometimes things are analyzed to death. Trend to cut cost at the bottom but not touch the top. Too US centric.

pros:
* People - The people are very talented and team oriented.  
* Culture - There is a strong commitment by all levels to put the corporation first in their work.
* Portfolio - We ahve a great portfolio of products with many product having clear market leadership.
cons: * Location of corporate headquarters is not ideal for recruiting new talent.  However, most of those that have joined the company elect to stay with the company until retirement or for very long periods of time.

pros: The best part of working for Eastman Chemical Company has been the supportive and team culture of the Eastman family.
cons: The main reason to consider not working for Eastman Chemical Company is the continuing decline of the benefits package.  The main reason to consider leaving Eastman Chemical Company is the declining value of the benefits package and the focus on eliminating the opportunities for mid-career employees.e of the benefits package and the

review_title: Excellent place to work with great people and clear future vision.
pros: Great work environment and culture. Core values include teamwork, honesty/integrity, diversity/inclusion, safety/wellness, sustainability and innovation.  Competitive pay and benefits as well as job security. Strong leadership focus and clearly communicated vision for the future.
cons: As the company grows, focus should shift to less centered around headquarters in Kingsport, TN. Fewer career options for non-engineers. Resources are inconsistent across sites and organizations. Personal workload high due to staffing cuts, which makes work/life balance a challenge.

pros: Great experience if you are looking for something corporate.
cons: No career movement allowed for two years, supervisors play favorites and target the ones they don't like.  They will also do massive layoffs at least every couple of years.  Their motivation for who to lay off changes as well so you never feel secure.

review_title: Multiple career opportunities within an international company
job_title: Chemical Engineer Management in Kingsport, TN
pros: Eastman has a very collaborative, responsible culture.  Corporate direction and strategy has been focused for 5 years and the results have been excellent.  Eastman has a varied and strong portfolio of businesses that should give a bright future.
cons: Career paths are not clear to personnel.  Some people seem to move from job to job while others are left in a single area.  Information on how or why things happen is not shared with personnel consistently across departments/managers.  Some information is held too tightly that should be shared to help employees understand their position.

pros: Professional growth opportunities exist for driven individuals; the company is expanding its international footprint which would provide additional opportunities to learn and contribute on global level; solid financial results allow to maintain structured training programs for employees; range of products is very wide and touch a lot of industries; plenty of complex and intellectually challenging work for many functions; constant learning is a must.
cons: Corporate headquarters are located next to the largest integrated manufacturing facility, thus location is not very close to cultural and entertainment centers. Dual career families encounter challenges due to limited number of employers in the area.

review_title: More than just a place to work!
job_title: IT Project Manager in Kingsport, TN
pros:
Highly principled culture exemplified by leaders
Financially stable and constantly seeking organic and inorganic business growth
Very flexible work schedule to accommodate family obligations
Actively involved with local universities and high schools to develop talent pipeline and partner on research
Dedicated to employees' career development via training, job rotation, and organized social activities
Leads and sponsors numerous community service initiatives and organizations
Supports early adoption of technology
HQ in very desirable place to live away from urban sprawl close to many outdoor activities
cons:
Obsessed with meetings
Organizational structure is very hierarchical
Tendency to be silo'ed

pros: Company is in the midst of significant change of both its business model and culture.  The vision is strong - just need to get everyone on board and acting more as a nimble specialty chemical company.  Starting to see the return for investments made in innovation over the past few years.  There is opportunity for those who want to learn and grow their careers to do so.
cons: Not everyone wants to change and at times management can be slow to move out resistors.

review_title: Eastman is a great place to be!
job_title: Senior Mechanical Engineer in Kingsport, TN
pros: For the first time in my 25 year career in industry, as a new hire to Eastman I was encouraged to balance my work life and home life. Never before has a company expressed concern for my long term welfare of a balanced life. I've worked several places during my career, and Eastman is head and shoulders above in compensation, recognition, support, training, and encouragement to do the right thing. It is a blessing to be a part of the Eastman Team!
cons: Eastman is a big site, and sometimes it takes a little longer to champion a change or a project than it might at smaller facilities.

review_title: Many years of challenging, interesting opportunities at Eastman
pros: Challenging, interesting opportunities; good benefits; headquartered in a great community; provides job stability; very good people to work with; global sites
cons: Benefits have changed to be not as favorable to the employee as in the past, but that is due to the changes in US business and the economy.  It is still ahead of other companies on the benefits provided.

review_title: An excellent company for a diverse technical career
pros:
Opportuniites for very different technical assignments while still working for the dame company - many fields and many technologies, from small molecules to polymers

Opportunities to branch out into business roles

Great colleagues who will help one another, with special attention to new employees

Great bonus program that shares company results with employees

Managers that share information

Colleagues that become friends
cons:
Has struggled to define a strategy and stick to it, but seesm to have overcome that in the last few years

Worried that pay and benefits (not bonus) are beginning to be less attractive those offered by competititors

review_title: Excellent place to start a career.
job_title: Market Development Manager in Kingsport, TN
pros: There are an abudence of opportunities at Eastman right now and the company is in a growth mode.  The projects are fun and challenging, which provides an excellent place for young professionals looking to grow their career when there are not many good opportunities out there.  Friendly, collaborative culture makes meeting new people and finding mentors easy as well.
cons: Shares drawbacks of most large companies.  Meeting heavy, process oriented decision making.  While management is open to new ideas, getting traction for them can take several meetings about the same topic.  Heavily matrixed structure can make role responsibilities feel ambiguous from time to time.

job_title: Integrated Global Supply Chain in Kingsport, TN
pros:
Pay is exceptional
Great benefits
Top notch employees who take pride in striving to be the best in our industry
Commitment to the employees and the community
Foster Growth
Leadership, supports and actively gives to the community (schools, city, etc.)
cons: Small, quiet town.....great place to raise a family but definitely more room for more economical development within the surrounding Tri-Cities area to draw in younger talent and young families.

pros: Everyone works really hard, and you can consistently count on people to help you succeed.  As a sales rep, I continuously have to rely on my team to help, and I know that I can always count on them to help me do what is right for the customer and for Eastman's business.
cons: Sometimes there are a lot of hoops you have to jump through to reach a final decision or you'll get different answers from different members in management.  It can be frustrating when you want to make a snap decision, but you have to wait on others in order to get the final okay.

review_title: Eastman is an excellent Company to work for.
job_title: Business Organization Specialist in Kingsport, TN
pros:
Eastman really likes to promote people who work hard and have a good work ethic.  I'm challenged and never board.  Eastman thrives on training opportunities for thier employees and they really encourage personal growth. Eastman stresses we take our vacation and spend time with family...good work-family balance.  Eastman allows flexable schedules which works great for my family.

Eastman is also VERY involved in our community.  They contribute a lot to community events.  They also participate in unexpected world-wide disaster relief situations.  Praise them when they will match employee contributions.
cons: I don't have any Cons.  I've been with Eastman for 6 years and I feel blessed to be an employee.

review_title: Eastman Chemical Company's is a global company located in east Tennessee.
pros: Eastman is a company that cares about it's employees, it's community, and it's coustomers. Eastman's leadership  focuses on  creating superior value to all stakeholder. Eastman cares about the health and safety of all their employees and continually provide programs to educate employees on safety both at work and at home.
cons: I would have to look hard to find a "con". I have worked for Eastman for many years and could not ask for a better employer.

review_title: Safe, caring, and highly productive culture.
pros: Eastman provides and encourages continuous training in all important areas including safety courses and professional growth.  It is a very collaborative place to work with high productivity.  I heard a lot of talk regarding work-life balance before I started work and here at Eastman I am happy to report that they live it and mean it.  I thoroughly enjoy my time at work here at Eastman and would recommend to others as an excellent place of employment.
cons: If you like living in the heart of a big city this place is not for you, but there is easy access to large cities for those that like to visit without the hassle of city living.

pros: The people are good: smart, friendly, devoted to the success of the company, devoted to the success of their team. Eastman's policies are fair and employee-positive. Professional development opportunites abound. Advancement plans are available and actively discussed. I feel like the company values my contributions and wants to support my success, which is also the company's success.
cons: We hold lots of meetings. These are often fun and productive but they can eat up time quickly.

pros: Most of the people interviewing were nice. Many of the employees had very positive things to say about the company as a whole.
cons: HR was terrible communicating all information in general. The interview process as way too long compared to their competitors. The employees were all old white people who seemed disconnected with industry standards external to Eastmans' internal training. The lack of diversity made the environment seemed like there was a "glass ceiling" for non white or non Christians within the organization.

job_title: Advanced Chemical Engineer in Kingsport, TN
pros: The strength of Eastman will always be the boots on the ground. Coworkers are friendly and genuinely motivated to help you succeed. Front line management is focused on providing their employees with the tools they need to do their jobs. They also excel at mentoring and growing their employees. Driven and successful people are highly rewarded.
cons:
There are many layers of middle management, and from the bottom it is unclear how much value they add. Lower middle management (just above front-line supervisors) tends to be populated by yes-men that have little understanding of the processes or people they manage. Ineffective managers who have impressed somebody in the past are shuffled around to where they can do the least damage. Kingsport is a small town, and those who's parents work at Eastman get promoted with uncanny regularity. Decision-making is slow (except in the case of a manager's pet project!) such that most good ideas are not commercialized until the market has moved on and the product will no longer be profitable.

The Executive Suite like to talk about the strength of Eastman's employees and how they are the reason for the company's success, especially before and after announcing layoffs or benefit reductions so the company can meet its earning growth targets. Layoffs are often done quietly. What was once a very paternalistic company where "Uncle George" Eastman took care of his employees is quickly becoming an investor-focused profit machine.

pros: Lots of great people to work with - everyone is willing to help each other. Lots of teamwork between individual contributors. Good safety culture. Competitive starting salary and benefits for college new hires. Opportunity to move to other positions within the company.
cons: Advancement is  very slow in the company - results in almost no salary gap between experienced (that started at Eastman) and new hires. Advancement is also more based on years of experience vs peers than actual performance.

job_title: Process Excellence Technologist in Kingsport, TN
pros: So far, I can say the company has been very welcoming.  I already feel valued as an employee and am encouraged to think creatively in all aspects of my work environment.  Orientation and follow-up training opportunties are plentiful, and there are obviously many avenues to allow exploration and growth as an employee.  I feel empowered to be a leader.  I also feel compensation is fair and benefits are definitely above average for the region.
cons: I haven't found anything that wouldn't be true of any large organization - to be recognized and advance , an employee has to reach out for opportunities that exist, demonstrate a strong work ethic, and be adaptable when change occurs.

review_title: Eastman Chemical Company is full of challenging and rewarding unique projects.
pros: Throughout a career, one will progress by gaining more and more responsibility and opportunity to show success and work with talented individuals. The people employed come from many backgrounds, but in general have integrity and dedication for their work.
cons: There are not many cons for a career at Eastman Chemical Company, but some may include the size of the company and the globalization of the different business units.

review_title: Excellent company for which to work
pros: The culture of Eastman is wonderful.  There is flexibility with work/life balance, plenty of opportunities for personal growth and advancement, and an overall friendly, "family" feel within the company.
cons: While some people put "small town" or "Kingsport", I enjoy the small community better than the "hustle and bustle" of St Louis.  Coming from Solutia, the only real con I can say is the rigid processes and procedures, but this is actually just a difference that takes some getting used to.

review_title: Low ceiling, very little opportunity to grow
job_title: Senior Sales Representative in Mississauga, ON
pros:
Low pressure sales system 
Excellent opportunity to travel nationally 
Value in person sales over cold calling 
Very liberal with product samples and demonstrations
cons:
"Do as I say, not as I do" management leadership style. Training program consisted of listening in on phone calls.
Consistently denied opportunities to invest personally in the company - not taken to trade shows/ US corporate meetings and events.
Given smallest sales territory by a massive margin and actually increased sales by a considerable percentage but constantly criticized based on relatively low numbers in comparison to the those of the other reps.

review_title: Eastman Has Been  Very, Very Good to Me! (a rank-and-file perspective)
pros:
1. One of those nice, secure manufacturing jobs like our dad's had--we can still make it in the USA! 
2. Very team-oriented environment with an extreme emphasis on safety.
3. Steady, satisfying workload with better-than average pay, benefits, and atmosphere: What's not to like?
cons: Its cons are the cons of all larger companies, along with too many meetings and too much emphasis on Safety. Although, really, can there ever be too much emphasis on safety?

review_title: Eastman Chemical: A great company to work for.
job_title: Senior Project Manager in Kingsport, TN
pros: I have worked for Eastman Chemical for over 25 years.  During this time I have been challenged continually with new opportunities for personal growth as well as opportunities for professional growth.  Eastman has provided me with ample opportunities maintain and grow my skills through continuing education, then placed in roles to take advantage of that training.  This has been a win/win for Eastman and myself.  Thank you.
cons: Like other companies, I am concerned about how Eastman will have to react to the government mandates on healthcare.

pros: With a large company comes various job opportunities. At the largest sites, you can move into different job functions and never have to physically uproot your family. Eastman is working hard to do their part to minimize industry's impact on the environment. Eastman is very supportive of family and promotes good work-life balance.
cons: Several outside upper level managers are being brought in who don't understand the "family" culture that Eastman has had for many years. However, some are trying to understand it and make positive changes and improvements.

pros: Company has great people that makes the work easier to handle.  Eastman team members truly become a second family and the support is incredible.  Career path could take you anywhere.
cons: Benefits are getting worse and will continue to do so as the Company tries to find ways of cutting costs.  Lots of disgust as to some of the items now being allowed for insurance due to the ACA (Obamacare).  Job cuts keep occurring and and the Company is doing well financially, despite Wall Street Outlook and what they want.

review_title: My experience at Eastman has been very rewarding and challenging.
pros: Eastman has a lot to offer, with training, opportunities for growth, diversity, and core values provide a good work environment for everyone.
cons: Eastman has a tendency to ask a lot of their employees.  This is a multiple year opinion, not  talking about just the last year.  Also, the non-confrontational culture  creates a change management issue.

review_title: Best career decision I have made, coming to Eastman.
pros: They offer a variety of job opportunities and promote growth and advancement. They want you to have a successful career. They are flexible with your schedule, whether for illness, family, school, etc. Everyone I work with is really friendly and helpful!
cons: My only con at this point is pay and vacation, simply because I was getting more from my previous employer. To get into Eastman, I had to start in an admin position, even though I have a degree and over 5 years of experience. However, it will be forth it! The pros definitely outrank the cons!

review_title: Have had a variety of roles across the company. It's been a great experience.
pros: Super people to work with. The culture is very collaborative and results oriented. People want to win but to do it in the right way and in a way they can be proud of. Also the company is growing and providing lots of new opportunites for career growth.
cons: We are moving fast and are stretching to dal with all the challenges and opportunities we face. I think that is to be expected of a growing company but does present a real set of issues that have to be addressed. The good news is that spells opportunities for the people here and those that want to join.

review_title: This company makes me feel safe and secure!
pros: Very military friendly, Safety of people is the number one priority, very military friendly. They are extremely flexible with my National Guard drill schedule. The work load is very manageable. I feel like I have been set up for a long successful career since my first interview.
cons: Most entry level jobs are shift work, It takes a while to get hired. Some of the entry level jobs are very monotonous and usually the apprenticeship is in a different division than you started in. Just when you start getting a feel for the division you have to learn a whole new set of procedures and essentially a totally different culture in some cases.

pros: The work / life balance is hard to beat. The variety of job opportunities is extensivefor one company.  Pay is quite good relative to the cost of living.  The local school system is strong and accomplished
cons: There isn't much ethnic, religious or political,diversity in the region and that is largely reflected in the population of Eastman employees

pros: Eastman is a growing company that provides challenging and fulfilling career opportunities while providing a healthy work / life balance.  With the recent acquisitions, Eastman has truly become a global company with great diversity providing for unique and valuable approaches to business opportunities.
cons: There are still opportunities for Eastman to become more adept at moving fast to keep up with changing market trends and design new products to meet market needs.  However, Eastman management and most employees realize this is an opportunity and are working together to address.

review_title: Fantastic Place to Work!  Exceptional Experience.
pros:
I was with my previous employer for 18 years, was employee number 6, and helped grow that organization to over 400, and in that business have worked with many other companies and their employees as a service provider.  I left that organization as the result of ownership changes that negatively impacted its culture and future.  I have been with Eastman for almost 4 years now.  That experience, I believe, puts me in a unique position to offer the following opinion of Eastman.

The people.  Hands down some of the most kind, caring, helpful, and intelligent folks I've worked with.  From onboarding, to helping me get up to speed in my job, to coaching, to encouraging me to grow; every single person I've interacted with has been genuinely interested in me and eager to help me contribute the best I can to Eastman, the company they clearly care for.  I feel privileged to be here.

The culture.  Face it, people make a culture, and here, it's clear there's a healthy respect for one another with a positive outlook for the future.  They know they are Eastman.  With very few exceptions, people here demonstrate and expect Eastman values in the decisions we make, in the way we care for one another, in the products we make, and in the way we're going to get our work done.  I feel listened to.  I feel that it matters to my management that I'm here and that I'm happy in what I do.  And safety, it's not just a word here.  Community and sustainability aren't either, they're actual working elements of this company, of this people.


The tangibles.  We all have jobs to earn and provide for ourselves and our loved ones, and hopefully be fulfilled individually while doing so.  Here again, Eastman appears to me to be as fair as an organization can be about balancing the earnings of employees, the rewards to employees when the company does well, the interests of the shareholders (which many of us are too), capital reserves, and growth.  From pay to benefits to training to individual opportunities, I feel Eastman provides a solid career for me, and anyone willing to put in the effort.
cons: As no person is perfect, neither can be any organization of said people.  So, while I do have a very positive opinion of Eastman, there are things that could be better.  But here's the thing.  In my experience, they care when they get things wrong, and when they can, they work to rectify them.  Procedures sometimes get in the way or are unfair in a particular circumstance.  We're people, so there are conflicts at times.  But seriously, I've seen a lot of "other grass" out there, and it isn't any greener.  There really isn't anything glaringly wrong with this organization.  This is why there are so many with 20, 30, 40 year careers here, and for many, this is the only job they've ever had.  That says something.

pros: The 9-80 work weeks are great. Pay for the amount of work completion is a plus.
cons: Management is extremely aloof to the needs of the plant. Safety is not a priority and needs to have a significant focus. Advancements are few and far between even when they are deserved. The work culture is tense with the union and salaried employees. It is also difficult to be assigned meaningful tasks. Management is not focused on the big picture but their own picture for their advancements.  Behavior focus vs a balance with performance is a must. No one is held accountable for their assigned tasks. Which means nothing gets achieved for the site goals.

review_title: It could have been better, but not bad.
pros: The company has been very good to me. I have been here 28 years now. It rewards hard work and dedication. The people in this area of the country are some of the hardest working people around and Eastman seems to pick the best of them.
cons: The benefits today are not as good as they once were but all of that is not Eastmans fault. I guess the biggest complaint would be that it is not as family oriented as it once was.

review_title: Eastman Chemical will bend over backwards for their employees
pros: I cwork at Eastman becasue I am invested in and valued as an individual, not simply a cog in a machine.  Despite being offered several other jobs at competing Fortune 500 companies, I chose to remain with Eastman for career and personal development opportunities.  When I needed to turn down a promotion requiring a geographic move due to health problems, Eastman worked with me to open an equitable position in my home office.
cons: The culture at Eastman is slow-to-change, often maintaining traditons because 'that's the way it's always been'.  As a high-permorming Millennial, sometimes this can be discouraging and frustrating.

review_title: Eastman has treated me well in my career of two years.
pros: Eastman most of all is focused on the safety of every individual.  Many programs and a lot of time is spent on making Eastman a safe place to work.  Also vacation, time off, scheduling, etc. for a lab technician is really nice.  The work environment and being a part of the team is a good feeling.
cons:
Graduate degrees are needed for what used to only require a 4-year degree, at least in my case of being a technician instead of a chemist.
Health insurance for the newer employees has a very high deductible.

review_title: Eastman is a gem of a company, hidden away in the foothills of Appalachia.
pros: Come work at Eastman Chemical Company only if you like to surround yourself with bright, hard working, and dedicated people. The staff at Eastman prides itself on their excellence in manufacturing, customer reliability, and commitment to sustainable growth.
cons: Part of Eastman's charm is the beautiful countryside that surrounds the campus. If you prefer city living however, you will find that it is several hours to the nearest big city.

review_title: All in all a fairly good experience
pros: Worked 20 years in production which was a challenging, yet rewarding experience.  Was allowed to go back to school to work toward being Lab tech certified.  Since then have even been more challenged.  Very interesting job working for the last 2 years in this part of the company.
cons: Seems like there is a point in ones career that it does not pay to attempt to improve.  Upon being promoted, was informed of being cut in pay.

job_title: Senior Administrative Assistant in Kingsport, TN
pros: The company has been considerate of employee's work-life balance by allowing flexing of schedules.  Personal growth and training are encouraged.  Safety is enforced as a high priority.
cons: One of the biggest challenges is adapting to changing leadership and continual restructures.  Historically compensation was a large consideration for all employees while in the last years it's become more of an exempt employee benefit.  The company used to be well known as a secure place of employement with focus on ALL employees.  Company seems to be getting more and more top heavy and management are the only ones who reap large bonuses while it used to be spread among all employees.

job_title: Shift Process Leader in Texas City, TX
pros: It's a job. Lots of opportunity for extra work and experience. At unit level good. Company does well. Hear nothing but good things about treatment of employees at Kingsport and Longview sites.
cons: Work at the Texas City site. Small , no room or opportunity for advancement. Upper Management very vindictive, no HR support. Upper management who sees you maybe 5mins a month decides your raises and bonuses with answers given as to why you don't get one. Upper management cares more about "yes men" than quality work.

review_title: Eastman is uneventful and having a hard time going to the next level.
pros: Eastman is in a good location.  Promotional opportunities are ok.  The company generally stays up to date on current technology.
cons: I am not conficent that Eastman salaries are comparable nationally.  The company thinks they are family oriented.  I do not believe that senior management values people.  They tend to take local people working there for granted.  Kingsport is a one major employer town.

pros:
There are a lot of chances to move around in the company.
There is a very strong culture and a feeling of loyalty and togetherness with co workers.
The salaries are globally competitive with the HQ being located in a place with a very low cost of living.
Tons of chances to do things of real honest impact.
They are very good to young Analysts.
The workers trust the executive team.
cons:
It is a very very large company, and its hard to get the big picture.
Bad Employees tend to be shuffled around till they find a good place for them rather than simply let go.
Communication between groups needs work.

review_title: Great Company, But it's a company.
pros: Challenging and fulfilling work.  Lots of opportunities.  Most people I work with are incredibly kind and thoughtful.  Lots of teamwork with very intelligent people.  Lots of the tools and technology I use are cutting edge.  Integration of new tools and software happens very fast in my area.
cons: Has a very corporate feel to the work.  The people I work with are co-workers and not so much my friends.  The work areas are pretty bland and plain.  Cubicle farms definitely make you feel like just another employee.

review_title: Growth company that puts safety first, has an inviting culture, and headquartered in a great community.
pros: The Eastman culture is by far the best I have ever experienced.  The commitment to safety is extraordinary.    The focus on growth and innovation is impressive and exciting.  The opportunities for professional growth is greatly supported.  The diverse workforce works well together at common goals.  The headquarter is located in a pleasant community that is family friendly, offers many special activities, and has many great educational systems.
cons: Occasionally, meetings are overwhelming and hinder contributing to the bottom line.

pros: Great work and personal time balance. A wealth of knowledge to draw from current engineers that have been with the company for a very long time- twenty and even more years. Excellent career launching support for fresh graduates and good starting salaries and benefits.
cons: Upward growth is a little difficult because  too many employees are eligible for retirement but not willing to. Career advancement is based mostly on company need not necessarily on merit which is difficult because of these long serving individuals.

review_title: Great employer with a talented and innovative team!
pros: Eastman has a wide variety of career opportunities which allow for employee challenges, movement and growth.  The community surrounding the headquarters is small which provides a great place for families.  Eastman employees have outstanding values which make for a great team environment.  Many employees are quite committed to improving the community thought volunteering opportunities.  Onsite exercise facilities make it very convenient to exercise during lunch or before/after work.
cons: Insurance coverage has greatly declined and this has always been one of the positives for Eastman in the past.

pros: After having the opportunity to work for a few employers, what strikes me the most is the drive of people and the empowerment that management gives to all employees to come up with fresh ideas to improve their work environment. Also, for a multinational, Eastman employees and managers are very accessible. There's is a very open culture for dialogue. Salaries and other benefit are industry standard. In short, I can only recommend this company to everyone!
cons: Due to working in a multinational, you'll need to be willing to find your own way. You can rely on peers & management, but you'll need to reach out yourself.

job_title: Systems Technician Associate in Kingsport, TN
pros: I have worked a Eastman Chemicals for over 40 years. There has been no other place that I have heard of that has been there for their employees. I have two grown daughters - One that has a PHD - The other with 2 masters.  Wife has been a stay at home Mom. Tell me what compamy that this can be done on one income. The company has always been fair to the employee needs and thru changes. A great place to make it thru life.
cons: There are no problems were at Eastman.

pros: Challenging, competitive, creative, global, diverse, and increasingly  multicultural work environment.   Constantly pushing to innovate new products, services, business models and work processes.  Friendly, responsible, ethical workforce with a team mentality.  Diverse set of career options across functions, business and Regions.
cons: Work / life balance is discussed but those who lean toward the work side definitely have more opportunities open to them.   A number of businesses face stiff competition today from competitors who do not have the same measures for success.   Eastman is passionately pursuing differentiation as a Specialty Chemical Company.

review_title: Company with aggressive growth strategy but keeping employees in the loop
pros: Conscientious company which is going through a lot of changes (acquisitions, growth strategies) whilst at the same time looking after its employees' safety and wellbeing.
cons: Due to the current changes, and despite keeping employees informed, there is quite a bit of uncertainty amongst employees as staff that don't fit in the new organisation are being let go whilst at the same time many new people are being taken on from outside the company.

pros:
Overall culture is very good. Depending on the reporting organization there are plenty of meet and greets, public forums, open discussions about activities, a fair amount of clarity regarding growth plans, and expectations. 

Management works hard to have a very good working relationship with all of the individual contributors. Many of the directors and VPs have luncheons and town halls to share what's going on. There is also a semi-annual corporate town hall where the CEO and senor VPs present the high level vision for the next time period. All of these events leave you with a good feeling of what's going on (though they are sugar coated to feel good. 

Nearly everyone is friendly and most of the coworkers are great to work with. 

Many positions offer alternative work schedules (four 9's and a 4) which is a great benefit if you get to take it. The schedule can be pretty flexible for doctors appointments, sick leave, working from home (if position allows), and requiring time off.

There are also multiple picnics and social conventions throughout the year, which are a great way to socialize with fellow employees and upper management.

The IT department is working on the latest technologies, which is very exciting. There is a big desire for greater productivity through technology and that has allowed many of us in the techno-sphere to get to work with the latest and greatest devices, applications, and systems. Depending on the position, you are allowed to provide direction from an individual contributor level which effects the entire company.

Eastman is growing! (Positive & Negative)

Eastman provides 401k matching up to 3.5% and provides and annual deposit for retirement.

Many locations have onsite gyms. There are three gyms located across the Kingsport campus. 

Safety is emphasized and that is great to see.

Dress is Business Casual Monday - Thursday and Friday is dress casual.

Compensation when looked at across the US is just below market average, but it is more on par or slighter higher when considering the cost of living in the East Tennessee area
cons:
This is one of my biggest struggles with Eastman. There are many benefits to working here, but there are many cons as well.

The Meetings: many employees spend so much time in meetings that we barely have time to work.

Saturday night work: IT employees are expected to perform maintenance type work on Saturday nights. Understandable in a 24x7 environment with little time for downtime, but this is still a con in my view. These Saturday night working take away from quality (and valuable) personal time with friends and family. This takes away from work-life balance. 

On call: similar to the Saturday night work. IT employees for critical systems are expected to be on call 24x7. Depending on the team this could mean once in a blue moon, every other week, or in some cases I know of employees who are on call 24x7x365 with no relief. This is driven away several very good employees and has some on the breaking point. The people who are in the every other week model are still on call since they are 'backup', which means if the other person doesn't answer right away the backup is called. This takes away from work-life balance. 

Not enough vacation provided for work load during early years. Takes 5 years to accrue 3 weeks vacation and 10 years to accrue 4 weeks. Two weeks does not allow for enough down time to recover from the workload and stay healthy. This solution appears to assume that during the early years you will not have a very much stress.

Frequent understaffing: many areas are overworked and understaffed. Some groups work overtime every week with no end in sight. This takes away from work-life balance. 

Everything is done the Eastman way. This means that simple solutions become complicated quickly as they are bent to conform to the Eastman way of doing things. Heritage exceptions most be supported forever.

There is a lot of stress and management tells us that it is just a factor of life in the growth market. The company  keeps growing (Yay!, good thing), buying acquisitions and not increasing staff to cover the work load shift (really bad thing!). Management also does some paper magic to make things appear like they are properly covered, but in reality one person is dedicated to a project while the other is there for backup in name only. 1.25 people assigned to project does not equal 2.

Benefits keep shrinking. What was an A- benefits package has become a C+ benefits package since the recession.

review_title: A highly motivated company with a terrific work culture.   People here care about each other.
pros:
Company is in a growth mode with growing opportunities.   Headquarters and largest site is located in a beautiful part of the US and is very family friendly.
Eastman has a long, enduring tradition of treating its employees fairly and also engages at a high level in the communities where we are in business.
cons: The company continues to  grow and move into more of Specialty Chemicals Company.   This growth brings considerable change and high workloads on the groups absorbing the transitions.   Even with the high workloads, employees are excited and great to work alongside.

review_title: Performance-based ranking system threatens collaborative company culture
job_title: Advanced Chemical Engineer in Kingsport, TN
pros: A large percentage of the people who work here really enjoy their jobs, and are pleasant to work with.  Many roles/supervisors are supportive of maintaining a good work-life balance.
cons: The new performance-based ranking system is causing Eastman's collaborative culture to deteriorate.  The work environment is becoming more competitive.  People are afraid to take on ambitious assignments or try new roles because they would risk receiving a bad ranking, simply because the job wasn't a good fit for them.  Good employees receive "unsatisfactory" rankings because they work in a group of top performers, and their supervisors are forced to rank every employee from top to bottom.  Eastman's pay is not good enough to justify this type of work environment, and our benefits get worse every year.

review_title: One of the best places to work
pros: Lots of opportunities, lots of learnings of new fields, businesses and skills. One of the best and ethical management. Safety oriented, very good work-life balance. Employees are valued and provided with lots of training classes useful for future positions. Generous base salary and fair benefits. Best of all, I made lifelong friends and coworkers at Eastman.
cons: The location is not for everyone. Can be slow in decision making process and immigration support. It will really be hard for you to adjust to another company after working for Eastman (probably the reason people boomerang).

review_title: Global Employer Headquartered in a Fantastic Location
pros: Eastman is a stable chemical company thanks to everyone from the operators who "make stuff" to the C-suite officers who "steer the ship".  Having lived and worked for almost 30 years in Kingsport, I can say it's headquartered in one of the safest, lowest cost of living, and most beautiful places in America for outdoor activity.  If you like a short commute and a smaller city atmosphere, Kingsport and the surrounding areas would be a perfect match. However, as Eastman has transitioned to a global presence, the possibilities for travel and assignments in larger cities and many parts of the world are now possible. The work is very challenging.  Lots of opportunity to make contributions for greater success.  Many people will praise the culture and it is good but changing, as Eastman is changing to be an outperforming chemical company.  Culture comes from history and Eastman is morphing.  Some changes are good and needed but probably won't come without some cost to the culture.
cons:
Since Eastman became a publicly traded company there have only been 2 women that have made it to the inner C-suite circle.  If you are looking for true gender equality, Eastman might not be the right choice.  Those in charge of this important and needed culture change hold up the same few that have made VP as "the" examples but the general population of women are still not viewed as equals or have equal opportunities.  Those that are selected for advancement to high leadership levels tend to have no children (% of women with 2 or more children at Director and above, does not mirror that of the overall female population at Eastman).
Promotions occur annually and are governed by an Advancement Ladder criteria.  There are many levels which could be used to reward, recognize and engage employees.  However the practical implementation has changed such that a significantly smaller percentage of employees are allowed to occupy the top rungs.  Employees that aren't selected as "the stars" that gets to advance past the career rung, become bitter and disengaged. This system is more about who knows and likes you, than what you do.  No doubt, those that reach the highest levels are solid performers but Eastman hires only the best and brightest.  The system leaves many highly contributing, employees parked on the career level rung.
Another annual practice is the rating of employees.  No one will say the distribution is fixed but at the same time, there must always be people on the left side of the curve.  Each year, if the "non-performers" leave, employees with solid contribution and performance have to worry that he/she will be deemed in the lower percentiles during the next annual cycle. There has to be something better.

review_title: Review of Eastman, TCO (Texas City, TX)
pros: Good working relationships between operations, maintenance, engineering, logistics, HSES, from hourly to salaried, a good collection of professionals.
cons:
A lack of leadership in Senior Management.
Upper management reacts peevishly to perceived slights (a slight is disagreeing in any way with their point of view).

The only way to advance is to be a yes man (picture a bobble head doll).
Any past slight (see above) can land personnel (hourly and salaried) on a black-list for advancement or special assignments. Redemption is rare (hence the use of the word peevish).

Sycophants are welcome and appreciated (remember the bobble head doll) and can expect advancement and praise; just never voice contradictory opinions.

Two misguided views of Leadership held by management:
1) Leadership is viewed solely as one's ability to agree with and back enthusiastically any decision, new idea, edict, etc., that issues down from above, and
2) Your ability to react positively to negative news, reviews (these can be scathingly personal), disrespect and downright rudeness (you will be tested and later informed of how well you succeeded or how miserably you failed - remember the use of the word peevish).This is done in the name of "developing you".

Needless to say, morale is the lowest I've experienced in well over 20 years working at this site. The glowing reviews and "we are a family" attitudes expressed by people from the Longview, TX and Kingsport, TN plants are not heard here. Personnel here at the Texas City site have to look at the name on the sign out front to remind themselves that they work for Eastman.

review_title: Great Company to work for, despite recent changes
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Texas City, TX
pros: Variety of opportunites, lateral and vertical movement opportunites, continuining education, world class training, moderate work life balance, world experts available for help/mentorship, many volunteer opportunities are encouraged on a coorporate level
cons: New management has created tension and unease among employees as job security is questioned, management is not well trained at coaching and development, there is a percieved sense of obligation and duty at Eastman that can negatively influence your feelings about the work

pros: Eastman Chemical continues to actively invest in an already world-class culture, diverse workforce, and long-term growth. While at Eastman I have been surrounded by competent and ambitious colleagues who sincerely care for me, one another and the best interest of the company. Senior management has and communicates a clearly defined growth strategy that have resulted in stability and favorable financial outcomes.
cons: I myself consider the Kingsport, TN site location to be strength. However, external stakeholders and employees relocating from the major metropolitan areas may find it to be more secluded and difficult to travel to and from.

review_title: Company with a defined strategy and deeply focused on growth
pros: One good part of working at Eastman is the breadth and size of Eastman.  The ability to work at one division, and then move to another division while staying in Kingsport is a big bonus.
cons: The standard rate for new employees' vacation time is 2 weeks.  This seems a little below average when compared to the industry.

review_title: Career experiences are full and rich
job_title: Principal Systems Analyst in Kingsport, TN
pros: People are fantastic and willing to do what is best for the company, the community and the greater good. Extremely dependable workforce with work ethic which is top-notch. Values are ethical and for success.
cons: Change in the world is not felt as quickly here, but that is a part of the growth of this company to a specialty chemical company. Workloads are heavy, but we all believe it will get better. Older workforce means that there will be opportunities in the future for new hires.

pros: The company culture is very good. Good life/work balance. Eastman cares about the community. Good activities at headquarters and good training opportunities.
cons: The downsides are the compensation. The entry salary might be competitive but the yearly raises are low when compared with other companies and so are the bonus.

pros:
Strong growth / innovation orientation and drive up and down the organization (both organic and inorganic).
Excellent culture that drives the right balance of urgency / bias for action with collaboration, as well as good work/life balance.
Unique opportunity to work for a Fortune 250 company while maintaining a desirable work/life and family balance in a smaller community with an attractive relative cost of living
cons: Overall talent bench is not yet deep enough to achieve corporate strategy aspirations. Need to keep building it both from the inside (development) and from the outside (key talent acquisition).

pros: Lot of interaction for sales.  Good pay for position.  Loved dealing with customers on a daily basis.  Regular customers make the job interesting.
cons: Not everyone treated the same.  Never know who is going behind you back to make themselves look good.  No real benefits to being on salary.  More taken away than given once on salary role.

review_title: Highly Satisfied with employer location, opportunities, culture, and ethics
pros: I love the location - here in East Texas, where there are signs of changing seasons!  If you are a chemical engineer, there are lots of opportunities - not just process engineering, but in all areas of the company.  I have never had a bad experience with supervision or management - I've always been treated fairly and respected for my work. Eastman values "doing the right thing" - a company with good ethics.
cons: Salary is a bit lower in comparison with the Houston area.  Currently trying to "fix" the age and experience gap in engineering and operations.

review_title: This company offers challenging careers and offers competitive salaries and benefits.
pros: The quality of workers is very high.  The company trusts their employees to do their job.  I have had ample opportunities to use my skills in ny job assignments.  My supervision has always provided challenges so that I have never wanted to look at another place to work in over 30 years.  I am fairly compensated and many of my coworkers have become good friends.
cons: Offce/cubicles become outdated, but a new corporate center building is under construction so that many offices will be moved from inside the manufacturing plant.

pros: Eastman operates according to key values, the company respects the employee and work-life balance, and the company offers good, meaningful work.  The company has a strong business portfolio which allows for a stable workplace.
cons: Eastman locations are in generally smaller towns.  This can be a pro or con depending on preference.  It can be challenging to work at either very large of very small sites.

pros: Great people and teamwork environment.   Good pay and low cost of living.  Flexible management with focus on both work and home life.  I am a 30 year employee and am so glad that I have been able to raise my family here.  I really love working here.
cons: Continual reduce cost pressure.  Doing more with less people.  Extreme pressure generated by stock price and EPS.  Business side management not always as structured and straightforward as mfg and technology.  They are somewhat worried about quotas in job placement instead of qualifications.

review_title: With its safety-first culture and forward thinking, Eastman is a fantastic place to work!!
pros:
Safety is the top priority
Plenty of room to grow 
Plants across the world with opportunity to travel
Excellent compensation
Eastman cares about your family, and you are not just a number
Excellent culture of hard work, honesty, integrity, and ethics
Wonderful community to live and raise a family
Beautiful location in the Appalachian Mountains near lakes, etc.
cons: The only con I have heard others say is that the Tri-cities does not have a night life like many large cities. This does not apply to me, so i have a hard time thinking of cons.

review_title: Human Company looking not just on results also HOW you get the results
job_title: Sales Representative in Ciudad de Mexico
pros: Without doubt our culture is what makes difference since each of us is involved in follow good behaviors, ethic code, sustainability, safety, wellness. Is incredible how good your can feel in a company the covers all aspects to get a balance between personal and profesional life; and of course this is reflected in good results.
cons: We have many procedures to follow up, some of them require too much time. But this year we are working in a productivity initiative.

pros: Eastman appears to value their employees with competitive pay and competitive benefits.  Safety is a focus area for the company, differentiating it from many other employers.  Rewarding opportunities exist both on the technical side and the managerial side.
cons: Working in a large multi-national company adds some extra procedures and paperwork that are not necessary.  Finding the way to do things the "right way" (by policy/procedure) is not always easy.

review_title: An excellent place to work with great people and clear vision for the future.
pros: Great work environment - culture, values and team orientation. Strong leadership focus and clearly communicated vision for the future. Eastman has commitment to safety, wellness and sustainability.  Competitive pay and benefits as well as job security.
cons: Resources are inconsistent across sites and organizations. Personal workload is high due to staffing cuts, which hinders work/life balance.  As the company grows, focus should be shifting to less centered around headquarters in Kingsport, TN. Career opportunties for non-Engineers less clear.

pros: Every employee has a can-do attitude, ensuring that anytime a fellow coworker has a question or a problem, he or she personally handles it, or finds someone who can. Eastman deeply cares about professional development, and recruiting/retaining the best talent. It is a fast-paced, results oriented company that puts employees' safety as its first priority.
cons: It takes quite a bit of experience to come in even on an entry level position. Movement to a higher position or title might take quite a bit of time and additional training.

review_title: Great compensation and benefits, great ethics, poor training
pros:
Compensation is very competitive.
Benefits are still great even after cuts.
High retention rate.
Management is extremely transparent.
The mentorship program can work extremely well when assigned someone in your unit.
cons:
Technical training is almost non-existent.
Frequent organizational changes lead to a lot of unwanted position changes.
Some positions are unique, such that new hires may have no one to ask for help.
The mentorship program can be ineffective when assigned someone outside your unit.

review_title: Inconsistent Management & Unneccessary Focus on Short-Term Growth
pros: There are plenty of friendly coworkers.  The working environment is a collaborative one.  There are plenty of opportunities within the company due to the multiple product and business arcs.
cons:
The compensation and rating system at Eastman is not great.  Employee compensation is not reflective of job responsibility increases and focuses mostly on "years of experience," with some differentiation based on performance.  Therefore, there is high likelihood of being moved from one job to another within the company and being told that it is a lateral move, despite the fact that the amount of responsibility and effort required to meet performance goals greatly increase.  Management has no answer to the question as to why there is no difference in compensation in this regard.  This type of management would tend to make working hard for a company that doesn't appropriately reward it's employees exhausting and frustrating.  

Additionally,  there has been a large focus on large cost decreases within the company.  The CEO has acknowledged the squeeze coming from investors on the need to maintain large single-digit growth.  Some departments are feeling the pressures of being asked to maintain or even increase throughput, while reducing budget available to make improvements or repairs.  This ends up leaving gaps that could significantly impact the company from a financial standpoint in the longer-term.

review_title: Thankful for my job at Eastman Chemical
job_title: Cash Management Specialist in Kingsport, TN
pros: I have been with Eastman almost 7 years now, coming from a long history of family members who have worked with Eastman.  I enjoy my job and what I do very much.  I have a good group of people to work with.
cons: Employee benefits continue to fade, leaving more and more for the employee to "pay out of pocket", but wages do not seem to make up the difference in what the individuals are having to pick up themselves.  As everything else continues to go up, wages do as well, but not nearly at the same rate all expenses continue to rise.

review_title: Glad I made the decision to join Eastman Chemical!
pros: People, culture, leadership, global footprint, innovation capabilities, career opportunities, and integrity.
cons: Eastman is located in a beautiful part of the country and this is a fantastic are for family life.  A small con for very young professionals is the smaller population (vs. a large city) but you also leave behind the anxiety, commute time, and hustle & bustle of big city life.

review_title: Transition... This ship does not turn on a dime!
pros: Strong culture of safety.  Establishing a vision and long term strategy.  Mid to upper level directors and manager are seasoned and know the ropes (in most cases). Strong balance sheet with inorganic growth vision that will bring non-tradition opportunities for Eastman.
