cons: Transitioning to new Leadership Team (CEO, COO, CTO) back filling with seasoned internal candidates that have never had to make the tough decisions.  CEO influence will dominating the near to long term vision (He is an consultant / outsider view) that has surrounded himself with "Yes" people.

job_title: Executive Administrative Assistant in Kingsport, TN
pros: So many opportunites and training are available to employees for career development and personal growth.  Many health and recreational programs are provided to employees and their families.  I feel it is definitely the BEST place to work in the area...maybe anywhere!!
cons: Sometimes the size of the company makes it difficult to keep up with everyone although the company does a great job with the many sites of info on our intranet website.

pros: My experience at Eastman has been great. Everyone has been very helpful in assisting me in carrying out my tasks when I have issues. Eastman has a great vision for the future and very capable leaders who are enabling that future. Eastman really takes care of their employees and provide excellent benefits.
cons: The main con that is hindering progress is a reliance on functional silos. There needs to be more communication among groups and a more process-centric mindset.

job_title: Segment Market Manager in Kingsport, TN
pros: Highly collaborative environment that requires good interpersonal skills to excel. The company and location offer an excellent personal/professional-life balance. Smart and passionate colleagues that are always willing to help if needed.
cons: Extreme process orientation can be burdensome in certain situations. Opaque hiring and compensation structures can lead to disappointing results for individual employees. Extreme focus on short-term initiatives creates a somewhat hectic environment that can be detrimental to employee morale. Benefits (401k match and investment options, health insurance, family leave) are sub-par compared to major industry players.

review_title: Eastman Chemical - A great place for a job & a career
pros: Growth oriented, specialties company.  Consistently strong performance.  Innovation focussed.  Heavy emphasis on employee development.  Sustainability empasized.  High quality leadership team and employee base.  Very positive culture.  Strongly supports the local community.
cons: Small town headquarters is a plus in some ways (contributes to the company's strong values), but a drawback for those who need to stimulation only offered in larger cities.  The company has historically been very process driven (again, a plus in many situations), but has to work hard to break the limitations that mentality can impose on creativity and innovation.

job_title: Chemical Engineer, Entry Level II in Jaipur, Rajasthan
pros: Lots of opportunities for growth and to exerience multiple roles. The company has a great culture as well as a good work/life balance. Compensations is slightly above average. Becoming more global, which enhances the number of opportunities available.
cons: Sometimes they can be too safe and flat. Need to take bigger risks to excel as a specialty chemical company.

pros:
Community oriented and encourage employees to volunteer in the community
If you are not happy with your current position or supervision, just wait because everyone changes positions every 1-2 years
cons:
People hire in right out of school and stay so not a lot of fresh ideas from employees that have worked at other companies - it is the Eastman way or the highway
Very bureaucratic and political environment - must notify multiple layers and departments for any decision

review_title: The name of the game at Eastman is INTEGRITY.
pros: This company strives to provide value to all its stakeholders by offering valuable products from safe and environmentally friendly processes.  Everyone is empowered to identify safety risks and STOP any activity that could prevent someone from going home free from injury at the end of the day.  Management is keenly aware of Eastman's role in protecting the environment so future generations can enjoy the planet as much as we do.
cons: If anything, the area has a small-town feel.  For some that's a benefit.  For others who desire a  more urban lifestyle, a different geography may be required.

pros: Just launched an effort for more inclusiveness of diversity across the organization
cons: Whilst Eastman new  launched focus teams for Women, African-Americans, and LGBT they chose to completely ignore the Latin/Hispanic group. No even a mention from the CEO acknowledging the contributions of the Latin community at Eastman during the Hispanic Heritage Month, even when hispanics ar ethe largest minority group in the US.

pros: Eastman is a good company with a variety of potential career opportunities.  The people care about each other and also about the companies success.
cons: The benefits package needs improvement.  The company has continued to take benefits from employees while delivering, and increasing, year over year earnings growth.

job_title: Executive Administrative Assistant in Durgapur, West Bengal
pros: In comparison, Eastman's benefits package is nice. The company works hard to keep insurance premiums low (I pay less than half in premiums than I did with my previous employer.), and makes every effort to reward high contributing employees. Eastman is as transparent as they can be when it comes to informing employees of difficult times ahead, allowing preparation if necessary. They are very clear about their strategy and expectations, and feedback is given about your performance, good or bad.
cons:
Communication within the company could use some improvement. Information overload. What may be important to one, will not be important to another, yet all information is jumbled together. 

Communication from the top down gets misinterpreted easily, or not communicated at all. At times, information that is expected to be communicated broadly gets communicated down to the director level, and it stops. The Directors either communicate information further down very poorly, because they don't understand it, or don't have time. Information tends to either be poorly communicated or not communicated at all. 

Many times, there are important role changes that are not communicated broadly, such as admins. Admins are the direct contact to each organization/division as a whole, yet those roles aren't deemed important enough to communicate broadly. Admins are not viewed as important by many higher ups, however the company would not function without them.  This has gotten to the point that many admins are seeking title changes such as "organization specialist," to be viewed as more important, however all "admins," "business support," and "organization specialists" essentially complete the same or very similar tasks. You have some business support with job skills that are not appreciated or utilized because they are "business support."

When one expresses that they cannot take more workload than they have, continuing to add to it, makes for a very stressful/tense job. 

There is a Corporate Communications Division, however they seem too busy to help with communications inside each organization. It would be helpful for each organization to have their own communications "person" assigned to them to aid the Executive in communicating broadly. The communications person could attend meetings to aid in communicating the message, etc.

job_title: Chemical Engineer (Ph D ) in Jaipur, Rajasthan
pros: Stock price has gone up by a factor of 7 since 2009.  Dividends have increased almost 20% in the last 2 years.
cons:
Raises for non-managerial employees are meager.  Benefits (health care, retirement/pension) are eroding or gone.  Culture is trying to change from one of cooperation to one where there is competition between employees.

Management claims that employees are their greatest resource, but their actions are contrary.

review_title: Throughout my career, Eastman has consistently provided an opportunity for exciting new challenges as an employee.
pros:
- Recognizes hard work and thought leadership
- Culture is a good balance between results leadership and people leadership
- Invests into building employee skills and capabilities
- Growth oriented culture
- Focus is not in one region only.  Eastman is global.
cons:
- Perhaps conservative on compensation
- Acquiring growth oriented talent/skill can be more challenging to recruit to HQ location

pros: Eastman has a work environment that every person is looking for. They genuinely care about their employees, have great benefits, give opportunities to grow in every aspect of your life, and want to watch you succeed. Eastman offers everything from professional development to help with lifestyle changes, and they encourage you to better yourself. Employees are even encouraged to be creative and work in groups or small teams. Eastman highly encourages collaboration.
cons: Sometimes Eastman spends too much time collaborating, instead of making decisions. While collaboration is key to a team environment, sometimes they need to come to quicker decisions. However, the company is working on this.

pros: The people truly are very kind and helpful at Eastman and in Longview. The projects I was given were not intern projects that had no purpose. They were genuine projects that saved the company money and I received the satisfaction of watching something I created being put to use.
cons: I think the biggest con is getting used to Longview. Being from a city, Longview is a whole different world. However, the new hires and other interns made my time in Longview memorable and I ended up loving the city. It's not for everyone, but if you give Longview a chance, you will grow to like it.

pros: As a company in general my experience has been that it is a wonderful company with good policies in place for overall fairness to all employees, opportunities to expand and grow your career and a general sense of promoting work-life balance.  I have found Eastman to be a company that promotes, encourages and nurtures family values.
cons: Satellite offices do not always hold/conduct themselves fully to corporate values.  Some lack of leadership with no visible checks and balances from the corporate level.

review_title: EMN traditional Business Model proves to be a Nightmare for Martinsville Manufacturing Site.
pros: Eastman has many training programs to offer employees that express interest in adding to their personal skill set.
cons: Traditional EMN business model and leadership styles were forced down the throats of a once profitable Manufacturing site in Martinsville.  EMN forced B2B model on a B2C business, forces major downsizing to long time loyal employees.

pros: Most coworkers are great.  Most management is competent.  Pay is competitive for the area and the company is heading in the right direction strategically.
cons: Benefit package has been eroding significantly and merit pay increases have slowed.  Promotions have also been getting more rare.  Unfortunately it seems the company is beginning a slow slide from a great place to work to nothing special mostly due to changes to HR policies that help the bottom line at the expense of the employee.

pros: Eastman is like its own family. The people truly care for their employees and everyone here is always helpful to help others succeed in their career. Eastman also offers amazing benefits to include medical, dental, vision, vacation and 401k. I also love that we have an onsite gym that offers classes also that I can step away from my desk for 15 minutes to take a stretch class that helps refresh my mind and body to continue to be very productive. Eastman is people committed.
cons: all of my experience has been positive working here at Eastman

review_title: Global Company with Positive Working Environment
pros: As a whole, Eastman employees are kind and easy to work with, providing criticism in a way that can be encouraging and helpful. There are many opportunities for training, learning, and travel because it's a global company. It's a great place for a career because you can work at several different roles during your time with the company - not stagnant.
cons: It's a very process-driven culture, which can be good, but it can slow down progress in a day and age where change and adaptability are imperative.

pros: The opportunity to grow at Eastman is almost limit-less. The company will help you to grow and advance in your career and there are many opportunities to work in different divisions to broaden your experiences. Many training opportunites to further education and knowledge. The benefits for medical care are exceptional, especially in today's world. Eastman values the communities around them as well and make many efforts to provide outreeach for the community. Eastman is also involved in several charities; I commend their values.
cons: The company is quite large, especially at the Kingsport site. It takes some time to adjust to the site and semi-learn your way around.

review_title: A very frustrating place to work
pros: Pay and job security is pretty good in this day and age. The headquarters, and most of the employees reside in a beautiful part of east Tennessee, which is a wonderful place to live. Most employees are very ethical, competent and enjoyable to work with.
cons:
If you are not willing to brown nose management, don't expect to ever get promoted.
Management does not want to hear the truth, they only want to hear what they believe to be true.

review_title: Eastman Chemical Company has provided a very good life for me and all of my family
pros: Application of the Eastman corporate documents is usually very good.  These include the Eastman Team principles, Safety Policy, Environmental Policy, and Quality Policy.  Eastman is very focused on safety and I thing they truely care about each employee and want them to be able to go home safely each day.
cons: There really aren't any true cons that I can think of.  It is no different than any other company in that there are always things dne that we wish had happened differently but it is a great place to work.

pros: Low cost of living and great job security.  there is a lot of flexibility in jobs since most are located in Kingsport.  Most of the time business, technology and prodcution are colocated, so it is easier to make decisions.
cons: There are not a lot of advancement opportunities; however, there are always lateral moves available.  The track for poromotion is very unclear and is kept "secret", but for a select few, promotion is seamless.  Very process oriented

pros: This is a good thing, When there is a lot of knowledge to be gained from years of experience.
cons: It is also bad when Eastman continues to allow bad supervision to remain on staff with very little functionality. I think Eastman would be better served if they could find a way to advance people instead of strangle holding talent at the risk of keeping insignificant players. If Eastman really did their research, They would recognize those that do not add value.

pros: It really is a great place to work. The pay is good, and benefits are comparable. There is ample opportunity for training and working with many different people. There is a sense of community and family. The company is growing with many opportunities in areas in which Eastman leads the market. Teamwork and networking are emphasized strongly. Safety is a top priority at Eastman.
cons: Some things take a while to get initiated or to shift gears. Some of the petty things that should be a simple decision take a longer amount of time. Teamwork and networking are emphasized strongly, depending on your take on this.

review_title: Excellent Company to work for - and I have for many years
pros:
Competent employees - hard working - know their jobs and do them to the best of their ability.
Company supervision is highly ethical in their dealings and trustworthy
Heavy emphasis on safety and welfare of the employees and their families.
Good career opportunities and management who works with you to help you succeed
cons: Workload is consistently challenging and can be very stressful. This could be considered a "pro" for some and a "con" for others.

review_title: Eastman Chemical Company- Employer from Hell
pros: Eastman Chemical is, unfortunately, the only game in town in Kingsport TN. They are one of the best (and only) large employers in the area, which isn't saying much.
cons: Horrendously inhumane management (they know they have a captive workforce) and poor working conditions make this a company, if at all possible, to avoid. There is a tremendous sense that you are a meaningless pawn if you aren't either management or have a PhD (from the management's chosen schools). The politics of the place are at least as bad as anything on Wall Street, but with a southern flare.

review_title: Eastman is a very family oriented company that focuses on personal safety and employee needs.
pros: Eastman is a great place to work due to the small company attitude with the big company assets. There are so many opportunities without having to relocate consistantly. This gives every employee the opportunity to be successful without placing un-needed stress of relocation.
cons: The only con that I can think of at Eastman is that it is still a chemical company. Each employee must be diligent in their designs and consider all chemical properties and how to manage them safely.

pros: Eastman is committed to work/life balance, as well as safety. Benefits & Compensation are competitive. Eastman provides a wonderfully diverse culture.  I enjoy meeting new people everyday and working with an exceptional group of people.
cons: Business Support personnel do not receive any paid sick leave so if you miss any work due to unforeseen health reasons then you must file short term disability.  It would be nice if they offered a set amount of hours a year for paid sick time before an employee would need to contact the employee service center for short term disability compensation.

pros: Eastman strikes a good balance overall of mission and comraderie; the people are great to work with - employees care about each other personally and work hard to create success together. Leadership cares about the health and well being of employees and their families while balancing what's needed to create short term and long term success for the company.
cons: Getting to decisions can take a while, but the company is actively working to improve in this area.

review_title: I'd love to retire with this Company
job_title: Client Services Human Resources in Kingsport, TN
pros: It's a principle based Company. Things arent arbitrary or subject to one person's mood. They treat me with respect with clear rules of the game. One works hard, one gets rewarded. Period
cons: We could be faster in our decision making process and could be more aggresive in our Risk Taking attitude, but these issues are not overly significant when it comes to the way EMN treats its people.

review_title: Great Company for Mulitiple Career Paths
pros: Eastman is a great place to work for someone who wants many opportunities.  During my career as an engineer in Kingsport I have had the chance to work in all parts of the company and to do different types of jobs.  My assignments have ranged from pure engineering to new business development, project management, manufacturing, and health safety and environment.
cons: Since Kingsport, TN is a small city, that may be a disadvantage to some people, but it's a positive for me.

review_title: Sub-par corporate culture, not a place to propel a career
pros: Comfortable environment, laid back atmosphere.  Most boss's primary concern is to stay under the radar and maintain the status quo, which makes things easy if you don't do anything stupid.
cons: Not a progressive company, fairly static in nature and almost a lazy work ethic. Promotions infrequent and almost all employees leave if they desire to reach for better things for their career.

review_title: Fantastic growth company with lots of opportunity for personal development
pros: Eastman Chemical prides itself on creating a collaborative, team environment focused on growth.  The talent of its employees is first-rate with outstanding leadership at all levels.  Eastman is a great place to grow personally and professionally.
cons: If you like the hustle and bustle of a big city, the Tri-Cities may not be your 'cup of tea'.  But if you enjoy the outdoors and a slower paced life style of a smaller metropolitan area, you might warm up to Northeast Tennessee.

job_title: Senior Systems Analyst in Kingsport, TN
pros: I started with Eastman last fall and I love it!    Eastman employees are professional and great people.  Eastman focuses on Safety, sustainability, productivity, work life balance and professionalism.    It is made perfectly clear from day 1, that Eastman expects the best from it's employees. In return, Eastman provides a tremendous work environment with abundant growth opportunies.
cons: Let me see... Great Company, Beautiful area, wonderful people..., Nope, I'm not seeing a downside so far.

pros: It is the only place in Kingsport to work.
cons: Employees are not given the tools they need to work efficiently, they are expected to do the work of 2-3 people and are paid on the low end of the pay scale of other similiar companies.

review_title: Eastman - Providing a great career since 1978
job_title: Senior Research Chemist in Kingsport, TN
pros: The Company listens to each employee and often acts on your concerns and suggestions. You always feel like a valuable resource to Eastman, and numerous recognition opportunities exist within the Company. Safety is the number one priority, and it has been estimated that you are 20 times safer when at work than when you go home for the evening! New ideas that have merit are encouraged and empowerment is the rule rather than the exception when an employee choses to pursue a validated idea.
cons: None worth mentioning other than normal administrative snags periodically.

review_title: An amazing place to start a career!
pros:
They really care about their employees and their personal lives.
Lots of career mentoring, mobility and advancement.
Great benefits and vacation.
On-site cafeterias, gyms, medical facilities.
They area has a very low cost of living.
The Eastman culture is very helpful and respectful, it has to be one of the best out there.
All employees, no matter their position, are nice, curteous, and helpful; it is not a cutthroat or competitive culture.
cons: Some of the manufacturing buildings are smelly due to the nature of the products produced.

review_title: Cutting through all of the nonsense, not bad
pros: The personal interactions are great, people get along very well and actively try to help each other.  It certainly doesn't have the poisonous "not my job" attitude in union shops.   If you like small mountain towns, this is for you.  One thing I really like is that compared to many other companies I'm aware of, if you need something, travel, equipment, training, cell phone, whatever, if you can justify it, you're likely to get it.  I have many friends at other companies that have to battle to get the basics they need to do their jobs.  Not here.  People tend to come herre and stay, so there is a huge depth of experience and history with the products and the company, which can help new hires.  Overall, it's tough to find a lot of significant things to complain about in the day to day job, other than the piddly nonsense that you have in any company.  There are some big picture things that can get you down if you let them, which I'll discuss below.  Another thing I like is attention to some of the minor details.  There's 4 gyms at the complex, and they're free to use.  There's multiple credit union branches in the plant, one of which is full-service.  They have several in-plant cafeterias and fast food places, although their fixation on health has been nearing "neurotic" levels lately.  The company sponsors many activity clubs, and has its own recreation area and campground.  Overall, for salaried employees, you have a lot of schedule flexability, but you still have to meet your expectations, which can be pretty serious.   The culture here is extreme honesty and little corner cutting.
cons: The downside to a place where people join and don't leave is a lot of inertia in doing things "the old  way".  Also, it's tougher to advance while waiting for people to retire or expire.  Not the place for you if you're a big city person, or aren't into relaxed, religious southern culture.  Jersey shore types beware! (kidding).  Putting aside all of the "piddly nonsense" mentioned above that you find anyplace, the primary problems are intertia.  It takes FOREVER to make decisions.  It's common to be pulled into a high priority job that you bust your butt on to make a tough deadline and then see it sit in an inbox for 6 months to a year.  WAY too many meetings, workgroups and project reviews.  There's also a major disconnect between the upper level management and the rest of us.  The main office complex is about 2 miles from the plant, and in general, people there (building 280) don't tend to leave.  As most have risen to their jobs over a full career here, they feel that since they did your job 20 years ago, they know what's going on now, so they don't need to talk to you about it, or they just talk to your director.  Occasionally this results in something hitting the fan where you have to explain things that happened which the VP's probably should have known about in the first place.  I'm not asking for my hand to be held, but at least show some interest.   Eastman has been acquiring companies like crazy (and that's worked well, to their credit), but they're slow to catch up on the integration at the individual level.

review_title: I have been working at Eastman full time for 8 years mainly in the Engineering Department.
pros: Eastman has always said that they value their employees and that people come first and in many ways they do.  We have an excellent safety culture which displays to the employees the importance our company places on the people and getting them home safely each day.  My management has always been a great supporter of work/life balance, and in fact many of the areas of the company allow for part time schedules, especially for moms with young children at home where it can be difficult to balance having it all.  The headquarters of Eastman are tucked into a neat community in northeast TN which has wonderful community, great things to do for outdoor-lovers, and also very close to large cities for shopping, arts, etc.
cons: Eastman recently moved to a performance based rating system, where at the end of the year each employee is ranked as outstanding, exceeds expectation, meets expectations, and does not meet expectations.  This system is quickly killing the morale at the company and the ability for people to work as a team (why help someone else do better at their job if they might be ranked above you because of you helping them?).  Newer/Younger employees seem to be leaving the company either because of lack of morlae, or because the "grass is greener" somewhere else.  Eastman has long had an environment of teamwork - and in fact, that is why we have hired the people we have because we are not the "competetive" environment that many other companies are.  But with the performance rating system, we are starting to become more cut-throat.  We do not pay the amount that we need to pay for a competitive environment (employees can go elsewhere and make 30-50% more easily).  We need to come back to a culture that works for Eastman, one of teamwork and collaboration.  In addition, the performance based rating system does not work well for an engineering department, where you have many employees contributing at a top level and then coming in as "meets expectations" at the end of the year.  Every person in this organization provides a unique expertise and it is difficult to compare one type of contribution to another.  Also, instead of reducting the number of promotions availble, the company needs to open the number of promotions and maybe even make MORE levels of promotion (especially at the lower salary grades).  This is one thing that is important to the next generation of employees.

review_title: You get a sense that you are part of a family.
pros: This company continues to be successful after (what will soon be) 100 years, which is very impressive in todays world. In my opinion other companies should observe Eastman in how they make each employee feel important, because I feel like this in itself drives a team effort that simply works. Eastman has a good relationship with the community in Kingsport which is also important.
cons: This is a heavy industrial plant, so a lot of the buildings isn't exactly like a walk in the park, very hot in the summer.

pros:
You'll find a healthy culture and many opportunities in this growing global company building a diverse portfolio powered by innovation, expertise, and real teamwork. The company takes its core values seriously and understands the importance of work-life balance and integration. 

You'll find development opportunities from mentoring to formal learning in addition to meaty assignments. Larger sites offer the opportunity to build a career in one place, and a global footprint offers opportunities to relocate.
cons: The genuinely caring culture helps offset the challenges one can expect from growth and transformation.

pros: There are a lot of great people at Eastman.  The environment is pretty casual, but everyone seems to be trying to improve the company.
cons: They are a little bit politically correct and focus a lot of time and energy on things that seem to be formalities or that seem to treat employees like children that need to be told how to act.

review_title: Eastman cares about their employees and about the environment
pros: The upper management is very aware that the workers are the ones that keep the ship afloat and seem grateful for the hard work and commitment we have to the company
cons: Some would like the headquarters located in a less rural location.  Others love the smaller town experience.

review_title: This is one of the most rewarding places i have ever worked.
job_title: Pricing Process Specialist in Kingsport, TN
pros: The benifits are amazing. The overall atmosphere at work is outstanding. The relationships that you build with your co-workers can not be beat. This company gives so much back to the community it makes you proud to work here.
cons: For me the only downside I have to working at eastman is my drive to work takes me about 30 minutes. other than that I have no complaints

review_title: Great company culture, strong leadership, marketing focus for future growth
pros:
Senior Leadership (VP & up) - strong, capable and caring about people
Focused on long term success vs. short term results - investing for the future
Impressive director and manager talent 
Culture of inclusion & collaboration 
Large global business - run with global mindset
Strong marketing and technical team capability
Commitment to running Sustainable Business
Culture of encouragement and opportunity
cons: IT integration - Solutia and Eastman - complex and difficult for employees

review_title: Dedicated team of employees, working together to grow our company, our culture, and our future.
pros:
Our demographics and our growth plans will deliver opportunities for personal and corporate growth.  Great place to have challenging and rewarding work in many functional areas.
Culture, while changing, remains a strong positive for employees, community, and corporate ethics.
cons:
Change is necessary for the survival and growth of the company.  That change is exhilirating (and too slow) for some, and yet threatening to others.  If you don't like change, you'll be frustrated.  
Also a lot of processes and decisions by consensus, which can be a source of frustration.

job_title: Human Resources Representative in Kingsport, TN
pros: The quality of Eastman employees, from bottom to top, is really incomparable.  Not only are most people smart and dedicated, but even more importantly, the company is full of people with strong character.  Honesty and integrity is important here.  Things get done through collaboration.  People here are just NICE.  Historically, professional employees have moved from assignment to assignment on a regular basis, which has provided great opportunities to broaden skill sets, build networks, and identify and leverage strengths.
cons: The collaborative nature of Eastman's culture sometimes impedes decision-making processes; at times, too many people are given too much say.

review_title: This long term career employee has seen many changes - most good some not so good.
pros: Key result areas are well-defined and adhered to.  Executive team understands the importance of sustainability and keep that concept in the forefront of critical decisions.
cons: For a company as large as Eastman, sometimes what an employee accomplishes is not noticed and appreciated.  I have seen this situation in the past, but not so much lately.

review_title: Seems to Just Keep Getting Better
pros: The company culture of excellence, teamwork and investmnet in people continues to keep me committed to Eastman. I have challenging work assignments and appropriate autonomy to get my job done.  The people here are very smart and willing to help others learn.  The company is stable and continues to grow via acquisition.
cons: Very little diversity especially in leadership and senior leadership levels. We can be very slow to make decisons since everyone feels the need to weigh in and it has to be perfect.

review_title: A great place to work with a strong culture of safey and wellness!
pros: I've worked in many industries and in many different roles and Eastman stands out as providing a truly caring environment.  There is a strong sense of work-life balance along with management committment to providing a safe and enjoyable working environment.  Time is spent on employee development and investing in continuing education.
cons: Implementation of change is sometimes slow, however I believe that goals are aligned throughout the organization and this enhances the environment of continuous improvement.

pros: Working on changing product portfolio, management has, good vision but lacking in execution (communication, reinforcement, etc.)
cons: Performance management is a joke.  Needs to be more differentiation from top performers.  Current bonus and merit increase based more on length of service than true ability or outcomes

review_title: Eastman Chemical is a GREAT place to work!
pros: The most important thing about working at Eastman is the people.  The environment that is fostered at Eastman is truly one of family.  This is driven home once one experiences a family tragedy, loss, or medical emergency because everyone bands together and provides support, both emotional and physical.  So the fosteration of a family atmosphere is the foremost reason, to me, that Eastman is the place to be employed.  Secondly, the professionalism that is continually on display at Eastman is unsurpassed.  Everyone strives to be all they can be, everyday, regardless of what they do or where they do it.  Third is the fact that the company actually cares, and does all it can to make everyone a success.  Opportunity is everywhere at Eastman and one only has to decide to excell and they will be given opportunities not afforded at other companies.  Benefits are generous with good pay, good medical coverage, bonuses that are based on fair and equitable formulas, 401K matches, and retirement benefits are but a few of the things that help make Eastman the wonderful place it is.
cons: A very few managers that have been with the company close to 40 years are reluctant to change and let go of old ways.  These are good people with great intentions but somewhat slow to evolve and accept new ideas.  This is reflected in the fact they are still managers and haven't been able to rise above this level, so this has minimal impact.

pros: The company is in a strong growth mode and is not afraid to use the capital on hand to grow through acquisitions in addition to our organic growth.  In addition, recent changes to drive a performance culture are the right ones.
cons: As with any conservative organization, at times we can be slow to change and realize that just because we've done something for 30 years, it doesn't mean that we need to do it for the next 30 (this is slowly getting better).

pros:
Eastman is one of those rare companies that "does the right thing".  They're a genuinely ethical company that treats their employees well, manages their operations well, and believes in being a good neighbor.  I've worked at several different companies in my career, and I've finally found the place I can retire from.

Although I occasionally hear complaints about the compensation package, I think it's very competitive.  What I make in Kingsport would be competitive even in the Northeast where I'm originally from.  Eastman is also very generous in giving employees paid time away from work for charitable activities like the United Way and National Engineer's Week, and there are a lot of opportunities for training both internally and externally.

Last but not least is that the company is doing well financially.  I come to work each day with the confidence that my job will be here tomorrow and the day after that.  When I worked in other industries that was not always the case.
cons: Tennessee Operations is a huge place and there is a strong tendency to get pigeonholed.  You really need to work to make yourself visible if you want to move around or be promoted.  The other drawback is that East Tennessee is not for everyone.  If you like the outdoors it's a great place to live.  If you are looking for more urban amenties, it's definitely not the place for you.  Johnson City is a little better than Kingsport but not much.  I miss things like professional sports teams, diverse restaurants, and options for nightlife.

review_title: Really, Truly Great Place to Work
pros: Having worked at several places before joining Eastman I can confidently say that Eastman is a fantastic company full of great people.  Recent leadership changes over the past decade have helped to retool the culture and it has really started to pay dividends the past few years when it comes to the bottom line and team member morale.  In addition, traditional HR practice was to hire people with engineering degrees FOR EVERYTHING.  Today’s leadership realizes we needed to be more diverse than that and is working to get those with specific expertise (innovation, marketing, project management, etc.)  into those type positions while driving one-track engineers back into engineering roles where they are better suited to excel.   I think that many of the negative reviews you will find on here are from Eastman lifers/aforementioned engineering types who are threatened or have been affected by this culture change because for years it seems the status quo was acceptable.  Those negative on the company’s outlook also contend that Eastman used to be family oriented and that it’s not anymore.  As someone with experience elsewhere, I contend that Eastman has the most family-oriented culture of anywhere I have worked so I guess it’s a matter of perspective.  These negative views are heightened by the fact that current leadership is mostly not from East Tennessee and locals generally have a hard time trusting those not native to the area.  The company trains and compensates team members better than most and best of all – there is zero tolerance for internal backstabbing.  Finally, the Tri-Cities area with the Blue Ridge mountains and foliage is breathtakingly beautiful and the local people are some of the most genuinely nice and welcoming people you will ever meet.
cons: Eastman’s insurance benefits are a disappointment.  HR leadership claims that our benefits benchmark better than other companies in the chemical industry but if you’re striving to be the “best place to work” and recruit the best talent, then your competition isn’t other chemical companies – it’s other top companies regardless of industry.  So, does our healthcare program match up to the likes of Facebook or Bain?  No, they don’t.  Don’t get me wrong, benefits are not bad but they could certainly be better.  This is the consensus #1 negative you will find on Glassdoor or if you surveyed Eastman team members.  The other con worth mentioning is that it’s hard to get Eastman engineering lifers to think outside of what they have always done.  Since they have been with Eastman for 10, 20, 30+ years, they are extremely adverse to change or looking at things under a different lense.  As I mentioned previously, leadership is working to change this but it’s still something that I would like to see changed quicker as it slows innovation and crushes productivity.

job_title: Lab Technician, Associate in Kingsport, TN
pros: Eastman is a large, global company that functions well in a number of ways.  Eastman's greatest strength has always been it's unique culture of people.
cons: For every area Eastman excels in, they seem to manage to have some equally non-functioning or frustrating system that has to be dealt with. This is usually exasperated by middle management. Career advancement opportunities are extremely rare at the technician level.

review_title: Eastman is a place for collaborative success!
pros: The culture at Eastman is one of caring, for each other, our communities and our business partners.  Team members who join Eastman from other companies validate our belief that our caring culture is unique and a competitive advantage.
cons: Our corporate HQ location and largest site in Kingsport, TN can make it difficult to attract and retain talent to deploy to our mfg and commercial sites across the world.

pros:
-Good work/life balance
-Intersting project work
cons:
-There is still very much a "good ol' boys club' culture. Advancement opportunities are given to employees who attend the right churches. Strong resistance to diversity and inclusion efforts throughout various levels in the organization.
- Experience outside of the company is not valued, it is seen by many as a negative
-Benefits, specifically health insurance, is very poor. Compensation is okay for the area, but raises are small (2% on average) and promotions happen about every 5-7 years.

pros: the starting pay is great, benefits are decent & are effective immediately, job is very easy
cons: Zero leadership from “‘management”, no accountability, favoritism, hostile work environment & no sense of urgency for anything to change.  a high school feeling job. no consistency

pros: Some really good people and a good learning opportunity. Benefits and pay are better than a lot of places around East Texas.
cons: There isn’t any understanding in your apprenticeship especially if you have a 2 year degree. If your not meeting expectations you might get told that it doesn’t matter because we hired you with a degree. Who remembers every little thing from school.

pros: One of the most amazing thing about this company is that they care about you - they want you to be successful. All of the coworkers I've been in contact with are extremely friendly and helpful. "You own your own career here at Eastman".
cons: Although Kingsport is a great place to live and work at, it is a fairly small city. You'll still find everything that you'll need here, but if you move from a huge city, it is quite a difference.

review_title: Eastman is a high integrity, teamwork oriented employer committed to company and personal growth.
pros:
* Team oriented environment, everyone truly wants everyone else to succeed
* My management has been very understanding when I've needed time to deal with non-work related issues
* Eastman is well managed, we stayed pretty healthy during recent financial crisis
* Eastman is high integrity, cares about environment and community
* Tennessee, home of many employees, has no state income tax
cons:
* Kingsport TN where majority of employees are located is not a cultural mecca though the outdoor activities are unparalleled
* Not a huge number of other professional job opportunities in Kingsport area

pros: Eastman has a family and team oriented culture.  It is also large enough to provide multiple career paths and challenges if you have an inclination and ability to branch out.  Many of the positions are based in one place, making geographic stability possible as you grown in your career.
cons: Eastman's headquarters are located in a smaller city and some may find that the area does not have the benefits of living in a larger metropolitan area.

review_title: A great place to contribute and grow!
pros: High integrity, high ownership workforce.  Strong focus on safety and environmental stewardship.  Good job of getting into the right businesses and markets over the last decade.  Technical excellence, and good at solving hard problems that add economic value to the company.
cons: Been through a number of transitions and transformations since spin from Kodak, which can make communication of vision and strategy more challenging.

review_title: Eastman is simply a great place to work.
pros: The people at Eastman are wonderful.  We are very focused on innovation and moving the company forward.  There is a world of opportunity from a career perspective.  Eastman provides an environment where you can bring your "A game" while not having to look over your shoulder.  We understand the the competition is external, not internal.
cons: For some it may be the location.  However we offer global opportunities and while in Kingsport, TN you are close enough to larger cities without having to deal with traffic, etc.

pros: Competitive salary and benefits.  I very much appreciate the continuation of the bonus.  There is a very good work-life balance.  I enjoy coming to work.  I appreciate the resources that Eastman commits to the United Way and other charities.
cons: As an engineer for Eastman, I will never be the designer of a signature piece.  My work consists of solving daily problems.  Not sure how I fit into the emerging picture of company with many locations and businesses across the globe.

pros: Company doing well over the past 5 years , 5 years of consecutive earnings improvement. There is no state income tax on TN.
cons: It can be difficult to receive meaningful feedback on performance. We have performance ratings reviews but specific feedback on how to continue to develop and get promoted is difficult to obtain.

pros: Eastman has a great company culture where employees work together. Pay is good for the area and Eastman is committed to developing its talent.
cons: Some colleague have expressed a lack of opportunity for advancement or new assignments. I have not found that to be true. You have to realize that this is a big company and there will be some competition for jobs.  One executive said that you should "bloom where you are planted and good things will happen."  That is a good attitude to have, and it is perfectly acceptable to discuss interest in other assignments while being patient.

pros: Eastman Chemical is one of the most ethical, employee-centric, and innovative companies I have had the privilege to work for.  The CEO and Executive Leadership team has a future-focused strategy with a strong foundation for safety, team member empowerment, while creating a climate for success via innovative solutions and products for our customers, employees, community and world.
cons: The only con I see is we are sometimes slow to change, however we recognize that culture and are working to education and provide tools to manage change more effectively.

review_title: A very diverse company with a wide variety of opportunities, demanding of your time and personal/ professional growth.
pros: Eastman in Longview, TX  has some of the highest pay rates in our area. The training and job education is extensive and on-going; you will re train annually and updates to training documents are issued regularly. Safety is a high priority and any issues that arise are reviewed and discussed in depth on all levels, so you feel like you have an input and are made aware of every hazard possible. Commitment to safety and sharing of information with employees at all levels is something the company does very well.
cons: Your time at Eastman initially will be learning your work site and getting accustom to the schedule. There will be tons of computer based training about the company and safety practices to be completed within a designated time, in addition to learning job responsibilities and mentoring at your department level. After about 3 months, you will be scheduled to attend Eastman Learning Center, an onsite training facility with faculty that will guide you through in depth self paced learning and labs. This is all great for creating a skilled workforce and giving you confidence in your co-workers, but it becomes overwhelming. Much of the work at the learning center is done on your own time with books and disc to be studied at home. When working a 12 hour rotating shift and trying to balance sleep and family time, it is way too much to be expected. I have never felt so incapable and slow to learn on a new job as I did at Eastman. My time at the job was stressed and needing to add additional time onsite and at home without pay- to meet the requirements for the school was nerve wracking; driving in on my days off to attend the school felt invasive to my family time.  You often work with same crew on days and night for years, so you better like each other

review_title: Great culture which makes for a great place to work!
pros: Eastman has a unique culture that sets it apart from competitors.  The people truly do make it a great place to work.  Most areas offer a flexible work arrangement that is highly attractive to young professionals.
cons: Though Eastman can sometimes be slow to change, great improvements have been made in the recent past to enhance change management.  Great talent and succession plans will be key to fulfilling gaps created by an aging workforce population in the near future.

review_title: Eastman people care about their people!
pros:
Excellent safety emphasis and behaviors to match
Encourage personal growth and development as a job expectation
Collaborative, friendly, team-oriented culture
Located in a great location for raising a family
Excellent business results the last few years
cons:
Location isn't ideal for young employees right out of school
Change sometimes seems slow because of the size of the company and conservative culture

review_title: Eastman Chemical is a great company to work for!
pros: Eastman has a great philosophy. It's like working for one big family. There are so many colleagues with different nationalities which makes work life interesting and fun. If you wish to and do your best working your way up the ladder at Eastman is possible. I've been working at Eastman for half of my life and look forward to the years to come.
cons: I can't really think of any.

review_title: Great place to work and live
pros: Respect and Integrity comes naturally at Eastman Chemicals. In addition, Eastman encourages its employees to move within different functions which is unique, great learning experience and big differentiating factor. For example it is not uncommon to find employees who have switched from IT to marketing to supply chain.
cons: There is lack of 'fun' at work; Lack of faster career growth opportunities for younger, aggressive talent (especially when you compare to companies in other sectors such as Technology and Banking)

review_title: Rewarding set of people to work with...
pros: The major reason to work at Eastman from a technology perspective is the people you get to work with on a day to day basis.  The technical capabilities of those individuals and their team first attitude makes the interactive project work rewarding and successful.
cons: The current culture is positive in my opinion but the current trajectory also suggests a work environment more focused on individual careers than collective success.

review_title: Eastman Chemical, a great place to work
pros: Eastman encourages and rewards collaboration between it's diverse work force.  This type of work environment enables each employee, no matter their position, to be a major contributor to it's success.  This behavior gives each employee the opportunity to feel like a leader and creates a win/win situation for both the companyand their employees.  It's a great place to work.
cons: I cannot think of a single "Con" as an employee at Eastman Chemical

review_title: Grateful for the opportunity to work at a company that not only cares for its employees but the community at large.
pros: A forward looking company with efficient and smart employees.  Positive attitudes.  Add a little southern charm and you've got a great atmosphere!
cons: Sometimes there is a little of the "we've never done it that way" mentality.  But that seems to be fading.  I see a lot of willingness to try new methods.  Change is accepted for the most part.

review_title: Working at Eastman for over 30 years has greatly enriched the quality of my personal and family life.
pros: Eastman has a strong set of core values that guide all decision making.  Eastman understands that a strong learning culture is key to sustaining long term success and consequently makes regular investments in development activities for all team members.
cons: Eastman culture and non traditional locations of major facilities is not for everyone.  Focus on quality of work life and outside of work standard of living is not valued by some people as much as others.

review_title: A career company with a lot of opportunity to move within the organization
pros:
Strong growth culture that creates lots of career opportunities
Competitive pay and benefits.
Culture is very supportive to help you succeed.
cons: Cost of living is low at the corporate headquarters in Kingsport which means if you leave the area to take another job with another company, you will need a sizable increase in pay to maintain your standard of living

review_title: Working with some of the best people in the world!
pros:
My favorite thing about working with Eastman is the people.  Most everyone I work with really values and respects me, as a person.  I feel like they take the time to invest in my personal and professional life, and it is a very welcoming environment.  I never feel afraid to ask questions if I'm unsure of something.  It's a collaborative and friendly environment, not to mention our subject matter experts are extremely knowledgeable.
I also enjoy the opportunities Eastman offers; I get to see many sides of chemical engineering without having to relocate across the country.  I am constantly learning and growing at work, and I feel like I am challenged every week.  There is also a strong emphasis on safety that I really appreciate.
cons:
There are pitfalls in communication, especially regarding the hiring process.  Since starting with Eastman, I've seen a subtle shift towards more competition, especially with the new ranking system.  I think that has made it harder to be productive and inclusive.
The work-life balance is usually very good, but there is little compensation when we have to work overtime.  Upper management can set unreasonable deadlines, and it's hard to know how much we can push back.
While there are many opportunities on-site, it can be very difficult to move around.  Management should communicate better between areas to get people into positions where they can excel.

pros: Job security, decent wages, good plant security, good amount of time off, company ethics are such that you can proudly be a team member.
cons: Shift work, no promotional opportunity or career ladder to climb, no performance-based raises beyond reaching "top pay," bonuses have been drastically reduced in recent years, benefits have been reduced/degraded in recent years, no pension, pay could be better. Often times we are told the company didn't do well enough for a raise or bonus, while the company outwardly boasts record profits.

review_title: A (great) company in a cross road
pros:
If you are someone who value job stability above all else, you will be really glad to work for Eastman. It is a good company, with high ethical standard (to the point of choking you with lectures and investigate even smaller smell of non-compliance) and decent salary and benefit. 
It is also a company that innovates well, at least in the past, and quite good at launching new, good products, and protecting them for the longest time possible.
It is an integrated and differentiated mid size chemical company integrated all the way from cracker to some consumer products and has been able to leverage this as one of its utmost strength. It has very good product portfolio.
cons:
The very aspects that make Eastman great are also the source of its own weakness.
It is big company - it leaves some people feeling disengaged. I do think this is also because Eastman is the most centralized multinational company of this size I have ever seen. There are no global business leaders in Asia. Almost all middle-high appointments are in Kingsport, TN - I think this is really one of the reasons of disengaged employees in Asia (it pays well, so there is a reason the overall turnover is low)
It has a high ethical standard - and it has caused some to actually be very afraid of making any bold decisions for fear of being questioned by the Ethical Compliance team. Balancing empowerment and control has always been a problem with the company.
It is a company that has a great product innovation history and great current portfolio. It sometimes over rely on old set of products that historically has given good returns and do not refill the pipeline soon enough. It innovates well in product but not really in business practices.
In my opinion Eastman will be near perfect company to work for if you are in the chemical industry if all these weaknesses can be addressed.

pros: The benefits are pretty good, you get paid really well especially for the area, I have one of the best supervisors/coaches I've ever had (but that's pretty rare)
cons: The headquarters is in eastern TN which is not an optimal place to live if you like diversity.  It is also very difficult for a trailing spouse to find a job.

pros: Good Pay and work-life balance. They tell you to go home if you are working too much.
cons: A lot of people feel that they are underpaid, but I am not sure. Benefits are nice, but the deductibles are high on health insurance. The bonus is good, but the company bases it on its own performance. They have some measures, but a lot of it feels arbitrary.

review_title: Not the most ethycal company by far, a shame...
job_title: Field Service Technician in Santo, TX
pros:
Work environment with peers great;
Compensation package fits the market average;
cons:
Millenials causing severe damages, leading to disruption in the teams.
No real growth for those willing to take the lead of their career growth.

pros: Plants are located outside of standard chemical production localities.  Work schedule is less taxing than some chemical companies.  Benefits were good.
cons: Plants are located in small towns.  Resistant to change and new ideas - not invented here syndrome.   Becoming more of a standard chemical/petrochemical company but with less MBA's.

review_title: Very Friendly People Finding Very Innovative Solutions!
pros: Great work environment, where people actually care. Safety and teamwork is a core value for this company. Management is really concerncened with your career goals and try to make sure that you feel that you are adding value to the company.
cons: Location (Personal preference). Some people love it here though.

review_title: Not bad if you are an engineer from a southern university, otherwise keep looking.
pros: There is little visible infighting. Harmony is the overriding strength of the company. Pay is generally good for the area. Solid financial position.
cons: Incredibly slow to act. Must be concensus on everything. Risk adverse. Very conservative corporate culture, where minorities and women have not yet been fully appreciated. While the company has posted record earnings since 2009, each year more and more benefits for employees are reduced and pay raises hover around 2%, which translates to a net loss in earnings during this same time for employees.

pros: Competitive pay, increasingly professional, realistic, and sophisticated company leadership and evaluation of company and individuals' performance (much better than in early years as stand-alone public company)
cons: Because of location of headquarters, no professional peers in community or region; have to work to stay current and stimulated professionally

pros: It's a great environment to work in.  Everyone is friendly and helpful as well as very professional. As an intern Eastman has helped me get to know the company.
cons: Eastman is very large. I would say its possible to feel lost in the sea of employees. This can be avoided if you take the connection opportunities given to you.

review_title: Friendly, safe, and innovative work inviroment
pros: Lots of young engineers are being hired by the company, little to no work politics, old timers will go out of their way to teach you everything, supervisors are very supportive
cons: not as diverse as other companies but the company is trying its best,  salaray is slightly less then competing companies, office space isn't the best but there are plans for improvement, longview location might not be suitable to everyone,

review_title: Not the best thing since sliced bread, but still a decent place
pros: The pay is good for the area and there is opportunities for overtime, as well as somewhat of a chance to better yourself.
cons: Some positions expect way too much from one person. Some of these employees don't even have a chance to eat lunch or if they do, they eat while they work. The constant push to get the overloaded list of things to do complete can be a major safety concern. Eastman expects employees to arrive at least half an hour early - on your own time, without extra compensation, in order to change clothing and relieve the next guy and are also under pressure to work overtime in order to appease management, failure to do this will leave you feeling constantly job-scared. They preach safety first and foremost, but rush people though very minimal training programs and leave them barely able to do their jobs. The 12 hour rotating shifts isn't for everyone, and it may interfere with your personal life and even your health. For newbies especially, schedules can change with little notice, during your first year - don't make plans and get used to the idea of spending less time with your family. This can be especially trying for new or young couples as well as those that have just started or are planning to start a family. At Eastman, they offer on-site medical services, however if you need to go there it's recorded. Too many trips to medical and you may be risking your job, despite what they tell you. Bear in mind, Tennessee is a right-to-work state and they can fire you for almost any reason imaginable. Eastman seems to have made a habit of placing managers that trained in one department, into an area that's as different as night and day and on the opposite end of the plant, then expecting them to manage a group of people when they themselves have minimal knowledge of how the job its self is actually done. With the implementation of the new healthcare reform act, benefits at Eastman are on the decline. In years past, they offered excellent benefits, but as of 2015 even those of us on the old medical plans will be forced onto the plan as everyone merges together onto the same coverage. The new plan has a high deductible and the premiums are outrageous.

pros: Eastman us a great company to work for. It is a challenging employer, always looking to get the best out of you. Besides safety and wellness, they are providing several means to develop yourself. By developing yourself, there is always a next step.
cons: On the other hand Eastman is also a very conservative company, resulting in sometimes slow decision making (they need to be sure) and not the most innovative.

review_title: Proud to work for this company!
pros: Great place to start a career and learn about business. The culture is inviting and helpful. Questions are usually welcomed, so all can learn quickly. Short commutes and no traffic if you live and work in Kingsport.
cons: Not much cultural or ethnic diversity in Kingsport. Hard to move up the ranks at Eastman if you don't have a supportive first-line supervisor.

review_title: Great Values, Great Employees, and Great Future Opportunities
pros:
Strong grounding in values, ethics, and principles
A culture where doing the right thing is valued
A group of employees that you're proud to work with
A commitment to our customers and creating value through innovation and service
cons: Learnings to be a truly diverse and global company --- strong roots in corporate headquarters a part of the strong cultural values but still learning to operate in a less centralized structure

review_title: I have had a meaningful career at Eastman and feel I have made a difference.
pros: Eastman strives to help employees find a balance between work and home.  I have been given the opportunity for training that has improved my skills and my immediate supervision has always been very supportive and helpful.
cons: Several locations is one of the positives about the company, but also can make it a challenge to advance through the higher levels of management.

job_title: Senior Chemical Engineer in Kingsport, TN
pros: The people are first class.  The people are great to work with.  It doesn't feel like some companies where it's so competitive that people will walk all of over to get ahead.  The pay is decent.  The company encourages work life balance.  They invest time and resources in their employees to grow you.
cons: The pay is good but could be better, seems to be only average to slightly above average.  The cap for vacation is 5 weeks of vacation.  Bonus is somewhat competitive but could be much better.

pros:
Eastman offers a complete structure for new employees, making the onboarding process very exciting and productive, with last generation tools and very useful information. Everything is well organized and clearly explained on the Intranet, additionally to have easy access to leaders and partners always willing to help.
Plus, I became part of a very professional and ethical team, where work is made with love and in partnership, what definitely confirms that yes, we are in one of the Best Places to Work!
cons: I would not have cons, but some suggestions that I already share monthly with my direct supervisor.

review_title: Manager with global role - great place to work
pros: Eastman is a great place to work. Good career opportunities for entrepreneurial people that can manage a large enterprise environment. Team members treat one another with respect and there is a low teeshold to upper management. Good strategy for differentiation and innovation, and sticking to it even in difficult times.
cons: Demanding environment and reorganizations  are difficult for the employees. Drive for continuous improvement can be challenging.   Still one of the best places to work.

pros: Competitive salary for the location is the only advantage.
cons: Health benefits are expensive and coverage continues to decline. The health plan is a high deductible plan, in addition to paying insurance premiums employees pay $3000 or $5000 before insurance coverage begins and this insurance upon retirement will be eliminated after 2021. Prescription Partner only pays for certain prescriptions without regard to physician input to determine patient effectiveness. Prescription partner determines type and length of medication needed.

job_title: Plant Electrical Engineer in Kingsport, TN
pros: I've been here two months now so I can't say much, but overall a great place to work so far. The weeks are actually 40 hours and the culture promotes teamwork between team members rather than the competition between coworkers that I've seen elsewhere.
cons: There are no cons. Five.

review_title: I've been fortunate to have worked at Eastman Chemical for 38 years.
job_title: Information Technology Analyst in Kingsport, TN
pros: There is ample work and Eastman has always provided challenges and opportunities.  I've had the opportunities to work in several areas of the plant supporting a lot of different areas with alot of different needs.  I moved to the Corporate infrastructure and have maintained several key contacts and have had the opportunity to provide them guidance and support from the Corporate level.  I've always been proud to be an Eastman employee.
cons: The workplace is changing and it is not the same family oriented Company.  Like all companies Eastman has been forced to change benefits.  That has been the biggest CON is trying to provide for my family and a spouse who is handicap and the impact of the new changes will dramatically impact us.  So that will keep me working long after I thought I could retire.  It has been a gradual elimination of benefits over the last several years and losing the 6th week of vacation to higher deductibles on health care are definitely CON's.  I know some people have left the company because of the loss of benefits and the long long hours.

review_title: Because of the people I work with and the work atmosphere, I look forward to going to work..
pros:
The Pros of Eastman include the people, the work atmosphere, the geographic region (Kingsport,TN), diverse opportunities and the management philosophy. Eastman enhances these pros with a history of integrity and sound management.

The people attracted to a company like Eastman reflect many of the positive aspects of the company. They tend to have caring attitude and they want to do the right things. It seems some of the key elements of the work culture can be traced back to the company's more paternalistic past. As a result, it is easy to find people who will go out of their way to help you on projects. This helping attitude creates a enjoyable work atmosphere.

The company's work atmosphere is one of team work and cooperation. While there are still areas where silo management and behaviors can be seen, the general attitude seems to be one of trying to cooperate for the overall good of the company. Some of the work atmosphere may be created by the smaller size of the city relative to the relatively large size of Eastman. 

While Eastman and its subsidiaries operator in large and small cities around the global, I can best speak to the city that is home to Eastman's headquarters, Kingsport TN. Kingsport is part of a metropolitan area with a population of about 500,000 which includes Bristol TN/Va and Johnson City TN. The people you work with are often your neighbors, their children are schoolmates of your children, and the people you see around town. This smaller town atmosphere likely reenforces the work atmosphere since they people you work with are also members of the same civic clubs, recreational clubs and booster clubs. For some this smaller town atmosphere might be a con rather than a pro, but I think it develops a stronger organizational relationship. It is rare to have such a large and multifaceted employer in a town the size of Kingsport and the broad range of corporate functions based in Kingsport gives rise to a number of challenging career paths.

With corporate research, engineering, IT, HR, Supply Chain, and several diverse manufacturing operations in Kingsport, your career path is not limited by one or two functional areas. You can grow and even completely change your career path and never move. In all of these areas you can take pride in knowing that the company is well managed.

I am a satisfied employee who is benefiting from the work atmosphere that I see as mostly positive.
cons: All of the areas that are pros above can make conflict and diversity of thinking difficult to process and deal with. When the organization is stressed it is likely to circle the wagons and lock out dissenters. This can and at times has lead to a hostile atmosphere where management ask for feedback but they do not really want any negative feedback. This can break down into an unpleasant and ineffective workplace. This has not been a widely experienced issue during the last ten years, but aspects of it can be seen in areas where business margins have or were compressed due to outside pressures.

review_title: Big Company with Family Business Feel
pros: There is a wealth of knowledge to draw from here at Eastman. We are well-staffed with specialists in several areas, so if you have a question, someone will be able to answer it. Pay and benefits are relatively good...at least compared to my previous employer. Most importantly, the culture is very family-oriented. When they say that they believe in work-life balance, I actually feel like they mean it.
cons: As with any large company, the process to make changes is slow. Also, it appears to be a low-risk, low-reward type incentive system.

pros: Fair and straight forward treatment, opportunities for personal growth and a diversed work place. At Eastman creating a collaborative workplace is very important and quite necessary; all the complexities that come from a highly integrated operation require seamless communication and the intent to go the extra mile on getting the job done.
cons: Benefits and salary may be average but are somewhat off set by location. Speaking of location, getting in and out of the Tri-Cities area could use some improvement; this is specially important if the job has a high travel component to it.

review_title: Very pleased with my decision to come to Eastman
pros: Eastman offers numerous job opportunities and promotes personal growth and advancement actively.  Another plus at Eastman is having a flexible schedule which is really helpful when it comes to family obligations or illness, etc.  Eastman also trusts its employee to do their jobs well so you don't have a supervisor looking over your shoulder all the time.  You are given the freedom to do a good job and make decisions.  This helps employees become more independent but team work is also key at Eastman.  I have worked at Eastman for almost 10 years and have been very happy the entire time. All my co-workers are top notch.  Most jobs at Eastman are very busy and management does continually look at jobs to make sure the job is still needed or has the right skill sets.  Annual bonuses are excellent for exempt (salaried) employees which is tied in with how well the company is doing.  Exempt employees are ranked against other exempt employees in their area and that determines the percentage of the bonus they receive.  Bonuses for exempt employees can be in a general range of $15,000 to $30,000 per year depending on individual and company performance.
cons: The amount of work can be overwhelming at times but in general it's very fulfilling with many opportunities for growth.  Advancement opportunities are there but probably not always at the pace that a new employee may be expecting.  Sometimes you have to be in the right place at the right time for career advancements because certain jobs may not be announced on Eastman's internal job announcement center (eJobs). Benefits are not as good as they were in the past but benefits are changing everywhere.  The amount of vacation offered is good.  Pay for business support personnel could be higher for the type of work that they do. In general, annual raises for business support personnel are in the range of 2%. Business support employees are also eligible for an annual bonus (called VIP) which is dependent on performance.  It's generally between $1,000-$2,000.  The percentage a business support person receives depends on their ranking.

review_title: Large company with a culture of teamwork and treating employees fairly while operating in a competitive industry.
pros: In over 30 years of experience with the company I have consistently seen a spirit of teamwork and customer focus. The company is not immune to the pressures of being in a competitive industry and there have been some ups and downs, but I believe there is an overall commitment to being a responsible company attempting to balance the interests of employees, customers, shareholders, and society at large. I was able to make a significant mid-career change in the type of work I do without having to change companies, which has enabled me to continue to work for the same company without getting bored. I have seen others do the same.  Whenever I have had some tendencies towards complacency or boredom, it seems that new projects and needs have appeared that have allowed me to get reenergized. Throughout my career, I have seen examples of employees from different parts of the company working together and being able to look at a larger picture than just their own area of responsibility.
cons: I think the cons are largely dependent on expectations. There is a certain amount of bureacuracy that I think is essentially inevitable in a largy company (and probably smaller ones as well) and there are times when it seems that management may not know as much as I would like them to know about what I do. (But the flip side of that is that I have had considerable autonomy in my work.) There was a period of time when I felt overworked and highly stressed, but the situation has improved. The benefits are not as good as they used to be in some respects, but I think they are still good, still competitive and I tend to agree that some of the former programs were not sustainable.

review_title: Eastman offers its employees the opportunity to suceed and contribute to the success of a world-class chemical company.
pros: Eastman offers flexible work hours, advancement opportunities and challenging job assignments to its employees. Pay, healthcare, vacation, etc., are comparable to other Fortune 500 companies and provide employees with security and confidence in meeting personal obligations. Continued company growth provides a variety of work assignments and contributes to employee satisfaction with job duties. Team members willingly help others, share knowledge and have a geniune interest in the well-being of coworkers.
cons: Inability to retain younger talent due to perceived shortcomings of the region.

review_title: Committed to Excellence and Ethical Business
pros:
Eastman Chemical is a company that lives and breathes its ethical business policy. Every email or memo that comes from the CEO to the Department Manager stresses the company's commitment to shareholders, employees, the community, and the environment. Employees are encouraged to volunteer, and those opportunities are spent working side by side with management and company executives.
