A balanced work and home life are also stressed by management - and they grant you the time to make that happen. They truly believe that happy, fulfilled people make the best employees. Employees are also tasked with holding the company itself to a higher standard, and repeatedly ask employees to act as monitors and advocates for the corporate ethical business policy.

The company also works very hard to ensure that they succeed in the business world. Their commitment to success is communicated to everyone from part-time landscapers to administrative assistants to production workers to managers to executives.
cons:
If you aren't prepared to give your best - don't work for Eastman. Eastman demands a commitment to excellence from all of its employees. 

While the company is great at seeking out new candidates from many walks of life, it sometimes does this at the expense of part-time employees. Turning more part-time employees into full-time employees would make the company a better place to work for.

The management structure is also a little top-heavy. With the current trend toward the flattening out of corporate structure, Eastman is behind the times. The company could become leaner by eliminating some of the redundancies at the upper levels.

review_title: Best place to launch your career
pros: Enjoy working with friendly people, slow paced and relaxed work environment. Not a lot red tape and politics that is expected of a huge company.
cons: Not a fast paced environment that you would expect of a growing company, great people but take a lot of time and deliberations in decision making.

pros: The people you get to work with are great, everyone want to see you succeed and helps you achieve your goals. They provide you with lots of opportunities to see different things that they are doing around the site.
cons: The work was not as technically demanding as I would have enjoyed. The area I worked in was not the most aesthetically appealing place and getting around was sometime a hassle.

pros: Great people, great compensation, flexible schedules. Of course, most of this depends on the area you go into and your manager. If you find yourself in a job that does not reflect "great" then certainly look into transferring into another job within the company.
cons:
No job is perfect, but the only cons I can think of are that we have a LOT of management--layers upon layers of management. This makes it difficult for decision-making and communication. You don't know who is responsible for a decision or who needs to be involved, which ultimately leads to time wasted and people upset over not being "in the loop".

Also, our bonus system is nice, but causes drama. For instance, when individuals are rated well and receive a nice bonus, it's hard to enjoy because you hear others very upset about their ranking and we are told that people ranked well get their bonus from the people that are not ranked well (take from the "low" performers and give to the "high" performers). This makes good performers feel a bit guilty, despite how well-deserved the "high" ranking is.

No Paternity leave, which is critical to the health of our families. I struggled with adjusting to life with a newborn and my husband had no paternity leave (he works for the same company) which made my situation much more stressful being home alone with a newborn and no support.

review_title: No balance, has become very competitive.
pros: They offer good benefits and salary for the area.
cons: Management constantly wants you to do more with less. You have to cut staff every year and then get beat on if you don't meet your quality or safety goals. The cost cutting has been going on so long now it is like getting blood out of a turnip. Tremendous pressure to deliver with little support from Div. level or VP level management. One bad year and you're out.

review_title: A great place to start your professional career.
job_title: Advanced Chemical Engineer in Kingsport, TN
pros:
Various places to work both geographically and positions.
More than just engineering jobs.
An employer who participates in the local community and encourages employees as well (i.e. United Way).
Big supporter of veterans, the environment, and volunteer programs!
Talented executive staff.
cons:
Compensation is behind other companies starting rates.
Takes a while to advance.

review_title: Eastman does a great job balancing the needs of its stakeholders - employees, stockholders, customers, and public.
job_title: Supply Chain Manager in Kingsport, TN
pros: Externally competitive but internally cooperative environment.  Compettive salary and benefits, lots of opportunity to grow and try new things.  Over 25 years, I have worked in engineering, R&D, manufacturing, business organization, and now supply chain.
cons: Hierarchical, and like many corporation, promotions can seem to be based more on who you know than what you do.  Historically very paternalistic, a Kodak legacy.

review_title: Great people really do make the difference in a great company
pros: Supervision's actions match their words in developing people and trying to help them reach their full potential.  All this is done while continuing to look for opportunities to grow the company so that all of our jobs are secure for years to come
cons: The large size of the company can make change move slowly.  We tend to get bogged down in administrative policies and processes whose value doesn't always seem to justify the time required to get through the red tape.

pros: Eastman is a dynamic global growth company with a culture of teamwork and collaboration.  Many opportunities exist for personal and professional improvement.
cons: We are often slow to make decisions, and change management can be very difficult.  Focus on detail can sometimes make it "hard to see the forest for the trees".

job_title: International Trade Representative in Kingsport, TN
pros:
The company is very community focused and its employees work hard to enhance the Tri-Cities area. When asked where I worked, it felt good saying I worked at Eastman. 

Another positive at  Eastman pertains to its training programs, they were excellent and the company does value training its employees. My coworkers and peers were great as well.
cons:
The major con at working for Eastman pertained to management, especially in Logistics and International Trade. These individuals have no business in the positions they are in. Plain and simple.  

My international trade group back in 2013-2015 had so much potential with two new trade professionals and a veteran trade professional. Management squandered everything and all the while telling themselves they were doing a great job. Management was quick to point out your flaws and  rarely praise your successes.  Not to mention they micromanage. They had to know everything that was going on and always felt they needed to chime in to help us make a decision.  They really showed they did not trust us to do our jobs autonomously.  

There was simply no leadership. Logistics and International Trade management is a culture of "yes" men and if you fall out of line you are singled out. That sort of culture is devastating to morale. They simply want you to show up, do what is outlined in your job descriptions, do not challenge anything or any one, and go home. 

And if you are not from the Kingsport community, good luck trying to move around in the company.

job_title: IT Systems Analyst in Kingsport, TN
pros: Even in tough economic times for our industry, management is able to discuss why our path forward is right for Eastman's future. And our area management wanted to quell rumors and reassure us of our importance.
cons: We are hopeful that this will make sure that Eastman is here for a very long time. Eastman is important to the community and those who do not work at Eastman as well. This makes it hard sometimes because the effects of a slow-down can be felt by all.

pros: Have had a good experience working with Eastman. While it's not perfect, no place is. Company management has come a long ways, but it still has a ways to go, especially in the middle layers of management.
cons: Raises and promotions don't always seem to be based entirely on merit, but on who you know. Merit plays an important role, no doubt, but so does knowing the right folks.

review_title: A great place to go over every day
job_title: Principal Technical Service Engineer in Ciudad de Mexico
pros: People working sharing a high performance culture based on great experiences. Company really honor safety way of work "all in for safety" and promote a good-neighbor enviroment
cons: In some cases there are too much burocracy, seems like we have too many format to through, perhaps this is for the size fo the company itself

review_title: My past five years at Eastman have been both challenging and rewarding, which is exactly what I want in a career.
pros: Some words that come to mind are culture, career opportunities, health and wellness classes, great colleagues, personal development, and growth. I enjoy my current position and the team I work with. My immediate supervisor is a positive influence on the team; I feel that I am treated fairly and respected by others in the company. I truly believe the company values its employees.
cons: There really are not any downsides that I have experienced while working at Eastman.

job_title: Integrated Global Supply Chain in Kingsport, TN
pros: Fair, honest, ethycal, winning, very professional environment. Good opportunities for someone looking for healthy team work-style environment, coupled with business success.
cons: Of course the chemicals business is not the fast growing, new york /financial business style, overnight professional growth type industry, so some consistency and patience is required to demonstrate performance, leadership and grow within the company.

review_title: A company that has many facets to its growth!!
pros:
Strong, ethical leadership translates throughout the entire organization.
Willing to adapt and change in advance of a changing world.
Striving for continuous improvement.
Great attention to wellness and safety.
cons:
Need to improve global view.
Better appreciation of differences across businesses....not one size fits all.
Need to build better accountabiltiy and decision making at lower levels of the organization.

review_title: This is one of the best places I have ever worked at!
pros: Great work-life balance. Good opportunities for learnind and advancement.  Great place to live and raise a family. Eastman culture is one of the best out there.
cons: Kingsport is a small town and some may not like that. Still has your typical corporate life feel.  The company is changing for the good, but you must be willing to change as well.

pros: Organised and a nice place to work. They provide you same kind of working environment as others by providing same kind of laptops etc with limited access.
cons: As a contractor it is very hard to use their laptop as sometimes one needs to get information online specially if you are in R&D Department but due to limited access one can't use his/her abilities fully and in this way can't perform the job they need to perform.

review_title: Engineering Intern working with product development.
pros: Competitive wages, not stuck behind a desk, get to work with production employees. An hour lunch every day. Work is not overwhelming and interns are not asked to work overtime.
cons: Not enough direction on how to spend your time, frequently had to ask other engineers if they needed help or what they would like me to do next. Also stuck doing repetitive task that are not relevant to degree.

review_title: A Lifetime of Opportunity at Eastman
pros:
- Eastman has a history of caring about it's employees -- their safety, health, development, and general well being.  
- There are opportunities for personal and professional growth and advancement.  
- The employees are top notch and a pleasure to work with. 
- Location -- Upper East Tennessee is a great place to work, live, and raise a family.  
- Eastman and it's employees are very community oriented -- supporting worthwhile endeavors financially and through a large volunteer base.
cons: Some indications that older employees are being pushed out.

job_title: High Voltage CSM in Longview, TX
pros: Eastman provides a great experience for anyone who is intrested in starting a career. Their focus on safety and real consern for employees is unlike any other place i have worked.
cons: i really cant think of anything negative about working here. Im sure there are other great jobs out there but, for me this has been a great fit

review_title: Eastman people make the difference! IT personnel work until the job is complete
pros: Eastman is a no nonsense company who is a great corporate citizen. Eastman people accomplish the task no matter what the problem or need. However, this is not considered superheroic, that is just the everyday expectation. The community is family-oriented. The mountains and outdoor activities are fantastic!
cons: People in this region don't brag about accomplishments, so they don't see how special they are as a team and how other corporations struggle with big tasks.

review_title: Growth company with a great culture
pros: People are 100% committed to getting the job done, and work as a real team.  Smart people, professional work environment, and everyone is willing to help you.  Great to be part of a growth company, especially in a tough economic environment.
cons: Some of our processes can be a bit over-engineered.  We have lots of very analytical people - which is valuable in this kind of industry - but can also cause us to be slow to act at times.
